loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor J. is 48 years old. She lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, and she is engaged in the commercial service and trade business. More specifically, she trades clothing for children, small wares, and toys. Moreover, she trades such goods in the local bazaar, where her trade outlet is located.

Thanks to the previous loan she was able to secure and successfully repay, she was able to improve her business by purchasing additional goods to later sell. Now, Gulbahor is requesting a business development loan through Kiva in the amount of 2,800 STJ ($825) for 6 months in order to import new seasonal clothing for children.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing new seasonal clothing for children

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina is 59 years old and is a mother of two children. She lives in Baku city. Irina has been in the laundry business for five years. She needs a loan of $825 to buy the necessary things to improve the output of her laundry business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for improving her laundry business

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
Karomat K. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006. Importantly, she has been a responsible and reliable client who has not had any problems repaying prior loans. Because of the previous loans she secured and successfully repaid, she was able to improve her business by diversifying her product offerings.

At present, she has a trade outlet at the local bazaar where she sells sambusa, the national flour doughnut with meat. More specifically, she makes such doughnuts through individual orders, and she proudly states that she has many repeat customers. Thanks to those prior loans, she was able to offer her customers a wider assortment of doughnuts, making it one of the biggest trade outlets in all of Spitamen. Now, Karomat is seeking a business development loan via Kiva in the amount of 3,800 STJ ($1,125) for 4 months to further diversify her business in order to attract even more customers.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by creating an even wider assortment of doughnuts to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
A. Mavjuda is 38 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children. All her children are in school. Aida's husband is a cook and his income is not enough to cover the family expenses.

So Mavjuda decided to start her own business so that she could help him cover their living expenses. She is selling women’s clothing, such as suits, jackets, and skirts in the local market in the city of Dushanbe. She is trying to provide a wide variety of goods to meet the requirements of her customers with different levels of income.

Mavjuda requests a loan of $800 to purchase additional merchandise to increase the variety of clothes that she offers. She promises to repay the loan within 10 months. Mavjuda is counting on your help. You can be an important part of the growth of Mavjuda’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for women to increase the variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.en:
B. Dilovar is 29 years old. He is married and has 2 children. Dilovar sells cookies, tea, coffee, soft drinks, sunflower-seed oil, and sweets in the local food market in the city of Dushanbe. He has been in this business for 5 years. Dilovar is very polite and his trading place is very popular with the local inhabitants. The business generates the main income for the family.

Dilovar wants to keep on growing his business and to increase the variety of products that he offers. So Dilovar requests a loan of $800. He plans to purchase a greater variety of food to sell. This will enable him to increase his sales, to earn more, and to fully meet the needs of his family. Dilovar thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing a greater variety of food to sell

loans.name: Gularam

texts.en:
Gularam K., who lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, is married and has one child. She is engaged in the business of selling various products for use in customers' homes, so she trades small wares such as sunflower seeds, chewing gum, drop yeast, and plastic packages. Further, Gularam is involved in the livestock industry by providing low-cost feed to facilitate the growth and sales of such animals.

At present, Gularam would like to expand and improve her business. Therefore, she is seeking financial support via a Kiva business development loan in the amount of 2,400 STJ ($725) for 4 months to capitalize on the seasonal nature of her businesses.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing seasonal goods

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en:
C. Mastura is 46 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 6 children. For the last 9 years, Mastura has been selling children's clothing at the clothing market in the city of Dushanbe, Tajikistan. A dedicated entrepreneur, Mastura runs her business day after day with a cheerful smile and a desire to meet the clothing needs of her customers. She has gained a wealth of experience and loyal customers along the way. No one else in her market offers the selection and prices that she does. Forced to start her own business after she had to leave her previous job, Mastura is grateful for the income it has provided through the years.

Mastura has proven to be an excellent loan client and has never had a late payment. She is requesting a loan of 3400 Somoni ($1000) to help her purchase new inventory and update her product selection. IMON looks forward to continuing to help her business develop and be successful.

loans.use: Purchasing of the new clothing for children for selling

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
H. Farida is 43 years old. She is married and has 4 children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 8 years, she has been purchasing young sheep, which she fattens and sells in the local markets. Farida is a very hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible and admirable.

Farida has always looked for a way to provide extra income for her family. Farida wakes up early every morning to feed her sheep, with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. She started this occupation at the recommendation and teaching of her beloved mother. This business has allowed her to provide for her children's education. Farida wants them to continue their education, because she hopes that they’ll reach the goals that they have set for themselves.

Farida is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900) to buy sheep so she can expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: Purchasing more small sheep to fatten and sell to expand the business

loans.name: Feruza

texts.en:
Feruza K. has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007. She applied to MicroInvest when her sister told her about MicroInvest's loan procedure and loan program. Thanks to her previous loans she was able to open a stall selling children's wear and toys. She has a good assortment and low prices that give her repeat customers.

Mrs. Feruza K. is applying to KIVA with the request for a business support loan of 4000 STJ for 4 months to improve her assortment of goods for sale.

loans.use: to improve her assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Zubayda

texts.en:
Problems and money shortages never defeated Zubayda, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. Zubayda is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman. She is 50 years old, married, and the loving mother of 4 children. Her husband is an electrician.

Zubayda started her own business because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family expenses. For more than 18 years, she has operated a store where she sells children’s clothing. Usually, she travels to the neighboring town to get new garments at very cheap prices. Her store is well known, and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful.

Zubayda hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family, and especially for her children. To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan of 4000 Somoni ($1175) to buy more clothing to sell. She promises to repay the loan promptly, as she did for previous loans. Zubayda is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Zubayda’s business.

loans.use: Purchase new children's clothing to increase the variety of clothing to sell

loans.name: Iravan

texts.en: Iravan is 38 years old, is married, and has three children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, and is settled in the Kayidish village. He has been in the dairy business for five years. Now he needs a loan of $875 in order to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Mukiljon

texts.en:
Mukiljon K. lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, and he works in the livestock business. More specifically, he purchases and sells livestock. Importantly, he is a very experienced livestock holder, and he proudly states that he has the appropriate skills to succeed in this line of business. Growing up, he grew wheat and rice, but now his income comes primarily through his livestock operations.

He has a good flock of animals, but he now wants to purchase one more pedigree bull. Therefore, Mukiljon is seeking financial support via a Kiva business development loan in the amount of 2,600 STJ ($775) over 4 months to capitalize on the seasonal nature of the business and to implement seasonal programs.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by implementing seasonal programs and to purchase another bull

loans.name: Hokima

texts.en:
R. Hokima is 40 years old. She is a very wise and hard-working woman. She is married and has 3 children. The children attend the public school in the town. Hokima sells children's clothing. Previous loans from IMON have helped her business grow over the past 3 years. Little by little, she has expanded her inventory, and thanks to the good service that she offers, her business is growing rapidly. With the income she earns from her business, she is able to provide education and food for her children.

Now Hokima requests a loan of 3400 Somoni ($1000) to buy more merchandise to meet the demand of her clients and to continue expanding her business. She is committed to paying back this loan in 6 months. This is the time to help someone who needs it. Please do not hesitate to help improve this family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase more children's clothing to expand her business

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en:
S. Abdurahim is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. Only one of his children is married and has his own family. Abdurahim owns a small stall in the city of Dushanbe in Tajikistan, where he sells children's clothing. Since he joined IMON’s loan program, his life and business have changed dramatically. Abdurahim now has enough inventory to earn what he needs to meet his family’s basic expenses. Abdurahim says his business is like having land where he can grow food, and the loans from IMON are like seeds he can plant to produce food for his children.

Abdurahim is requesting a loan of 3400 Somoni ($1000) so he can purchase more new clothes to increase his sales and expand his business. This will help his family improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase more new children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en:
S. Suhrob is 31 years old. He and his wife, who is housekeeper, are raising 3 children. Suhrob’s children are small now, but he is already working hard in order to ensure the best future for them. Suhrob sells candies and sweets at the local food market in the city of Dushanbe. Over the past 14 years, Suhrob has acquired the knowledge and skills required to be successful in his business. Since he started his business, he has increased the number of customers and provides them with a good service.

Suhrob requests 3400 Somoni ($1000). He plans to increase the variety of goods that he sells to increase his sales, earn more, and meet the needs of his dearest children. Suhrob thanks everyone for support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase a greater variety of food to sell

loans.name: Husnigul

texts.en:
S. Husnigul is 45 years old. She is married and has 3 adorable children. Eleven years ago Husnigul, opened a small shoe store in the central market of Dushanbe, Tajikistan. With the assistance of loans through IMON, Husnigul successfully expanded her business. A skilled businesswoman, Husnigul is known throughout the market for her reasonable prices, reliable home delivery, and individualized customer service.

Husnigul requests a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900) to purchase additional inventory of children's shoes for the upcoming season. With the additional profit, she plans to continue developing her business so she can support her children's education at university. Husnigul and her children sincerely thank you for your support.

loans.use: Purchase children's shoes to increase the inventory and variety of shoes to sell

loans.name: Bibibosafo

texts.en:
Y. Bibibosafo is 37 years old. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a taxi driver and his salary is not enough to meet their living expenses. So Bibibosafo decided 6 years ago to start her own business. She has a trading place near her apartment where she sells eggs, sugar, tea, sweets, and other food. She works very hard to give her dearest children a good education and to make all of them happy.

Bibibosafo is planning to expand her business and purchase more goods to increase the variety of food that she offers. She requests a loan of $1000. Bibibosafo is counting on your help. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her with increasing her business.

loans.use: Purchase a greater variety of food to sell

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreytouch H., 35, and her husband, Mr. Virak Chea, 42, live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993 and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of their children study in the local school. Her eldest daughter weaves silk at home when she is free after school.

Mrs. Sreytouch has been a silk weaver since 1991, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Virak is a rice farmer.

Mrs. Sreytouch is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: Ruslan is a single man. He  is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, and is settled in Bahmanli village. He has been in the taxi business for five years. He would like a loan of $1200 to buy more spare parts to help improve his taxi business.

loans.use: to buy the spare parts

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 52 years old, married and has five children.  She sells plastic products such as cups, plates and bowls, which she purchases from the Onitsha market.

She needs a loan of $450 to buy more inventory to meet her customers' needs.  Grace is grateful to KIVA lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial assistance and she says "God bless KIVA lenders".


.

loans.use: To buy more plastics for sale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience A. is 36 years old, married and has 4 children.  She sells food products such as dried fish, palm oil, drinks and other provisions.

She needs a loan of $450 to buy more dried fish to sell, as the demand for this product is very high.  It is used in the preparation of Nigerian soups such as Egusi and banga.

Patience thanks all those who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish for sale

loans.name: Bunthorn

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthorn C., 35, and his wife, Mrs. Channy Eng, 30, live in a small village off National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1996 and have two children, one son and one daughter, who study in the local school.

Mr. Bunthorn has been a mason since 1992, while Mrs. Channy has been a garment factory worker for eight years. The couple is in the process of repairing their house and lacks money to finish some parts of the wall of the house. They also need to dig one well to use for the family. Therefore, Bunthorn is requesting a loan of $1000 to dig one well and finish the remaining part of house wall.

loans.use: To dig one well and complete the wall of his house

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. Navy M., 49, and her husband, Mr. Mak Moung, 53, live in a small village off National Road number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. One daughter is a garment factory worker and the other two children study in the local school.

Mrs. Navy has been growing vegetables since she was young. She grows many types of vegetables and rice on the farm not so far from their home, while Mr. Mak has been a mason for over ten years. Currently, Navy is creating a new business selling grocery items. She buys them from Ta Khmao Market for resale at her home. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more grocery items for her stock.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy Osariemen sells kerosene and yams. She started with the yam business before starting the kerosene business. She has been in this business for a long time.

Christy is 36 years old and married with 5 children. She needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy more yams and kerosene for re-sale. This, she says, will enhance her profit capacity and also enable her to meet the demands of her numerous customers. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene and yams for sale

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip D. is 48 years old, married and has 5 children.  He has been involved in fish farming for the past ten years, and says that this business is a very lucrative one. Some of his children are currently in secondary school while the other children are getting admission to university. 

Due to the capital-intensive nature of fish farming, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $450 to buy more fish food and more fish for rearing purposes. He says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more fish food and fish stock to rear

loans.name: Khanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Khanthy A., 47, and her husband, Mr. Hok Vorn, 57, live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. Their daughter was married and lives in the family home. Two of their sons are air conditioner repairmen, and the youngest son studies in University in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Khanthy has been a silk weaver since 1980, a skill she learned from her parents. In addition, she began farming after she got married. Her husband grows papayas, tomatoes, corn, and food crops on their farmland. Besides weaving and farming, the couple also raises pigs.

Mrs. Khanthy is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase silk materials for weaving, buy piglets to raise, and pay the fees for more plots of farmland for their farming business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving, buy piglets to raise, and pay the fees for more plots of farmland for farming business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace O. has been in business for a very long time and sells fruits and foodstuffs like plantains, yams, etc. She hopes to own a grocery store in future. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $525 to buy more fruits to sell, and thus meet the demands of her customers. 

Grace is 40 years old, married and has 4 children and she says that God will continuously bless KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom T., 53, and her husband, Mr. Lon Hong, 64, who live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1970 and have five children, two sons and three daughters. One son was married and lives outside the family home. Two daughters are assisting their mother in her grocery business. One son does farming, and the youngest daughter has full-time employment.

Mrs. Sokhom has been a grocery seller since 1980. She buys her supplies from the market in Phnom Penh for resale at her home. Her husband grows papayas, tomatoes, corns, and food crops on their farmland. Mrs. Sokhum is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase one motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase one motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Va

texts.en: Mrs. Va S. is a villager in Khvet Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small plot of land where she can cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Yron Yeth, is a teacher and cow breeder. Because the second business is going well, he wants to expand it; so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy two more cows. Mrs. Va S. is 34 years old and the mother of three children. Two of the children are attending the local school, while the youngest one is two years old, too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy two more cows for breeding

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet D. is 37 years old, married and has 3 children.  She has a home-based business selling provisions and foodstuffs. 

Violet requires a loan of $350 to buy more products to sell.  She says thank you to all who make this loan possible. 


.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen is 30 years old, married and has 2 children.  She sells palm oil and needs a loan of $875 to buy more oil to sell and thus expand her business.  She hopes to become a major distributor of palm oil.  This loan will help increase her profits, and she will be able to assist her husband in taking care of their children.

Queen is grateful to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil to sell

loans.name: So

texts.en: Mrs. So O. was bO. in 1970, and she now lives in Khvet Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a fish seller and her husband, Mr. Preap Pronh, helps with her business. They have five children, two of whom help their parents’ business, while another two are attending the local school. The youngest one is three years old and thus too young to work or study. Although most of Mrs. So O.'s family members have business activities, they still cannot support their family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. So O. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband, so he can start a new motorbike taxi business. She hopes to increase her income and better support her family with this new loan. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To help buy a motorbike for her husband to start a new motorbike taxi business

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs. Suon H. is a villager in Khvet Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Because this business is going well, she wants to expand it; so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory. Mrs. Suon H. is a 55-year-old widow with two children, one of whom helps her with the business, while the other immigrated to work as a laborer in Malaysia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her inventory

loans.name: Chreng

texts.en: Mrs. Chreng S. is a villager in Khvet Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a rice seller in the local village. Because her business is going well, she wants to expand it; so she decided to ask for a loan to buy 1000 kilograms to re-sell to her customers. She hopes she can increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. Mrs. Chreng S. is a 59-year-old widow without any children.

loans.use: To buy 1000 kilograms of rice to re-sell to her customers

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet O. is a hard working woman who has been in the business of selling provisions, drinks and foodstufs for the past 5 years.  She is 32 years old, married and has 6 children.

She needs a loan of $600 to buy more products to sell, and thus stock her shop with all that her customers demand.

Juliet sends her thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs, provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en: Mrs. Luong L. A. was born in 1982, and she now lives in Khvet Village in Kampong ChhnA. Province. She owns a small store, where she sells all kinds of drinks. Because this business is going well, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more drinks to re-sell in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Korng Luong, is a taxi driver who can make $5 per day to support his famiL.. Mrs. Luong L. A. has three children -- two of whom are attending the local school, while the other one is four years old and thus too young to work or study.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to re-sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia T. is 42 years old. She is a wife and mother of five children. Four of her children have completed high school; the youngest is still in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her livelihood.  She has been selling fresh tomatoes, pepper and dried and smoked fish for twenty years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of tomatoes, pepper and fish from the farmers and fishmongers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy fresh tomatoes, pepper and dried fish in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support two of her children when they enter university, hopefully next year. Leticia is a member of a community group called "Nyame Mma" (God's children) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, dried fish, smoked fish and pepper to sell

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mrs. Phon S. is a villager in Andoung Russey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She sells pots made of clay. Her husband, Mr. Chon Sophea, is a firewood seller and can make a small income to support his family. Although Mrs. Phon S. and her husband each have different businesses, they cannot afford to build a new house for themselves. Mrs. Phon S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house. She is 23 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Previously Mrs. Phon S. obtained a loan from AMK [Kiva’s Field Partner] to buy a piece of land, and she has paid it back in full. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To help build a new house

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: Mrs. Seak P. lives in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhang Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her household. Her husband, Mr. Ya Rothy, is a motorbike repairer in the local village. Mrs. P. is 37 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Even though Mrs. P.'s family members have different businesses, they cannot effort to buy a new house. In order to build it, Mrs. P. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to meet this goal. Previously, Mrs. P. obtained a loan from AMK to start her husband's business. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To build a house for her family

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel A. is a 47-year-old man, married with three children. All the children are in school. Emmanuel A. enjoys selling and takes pride in serving his customers. He has been selling maize for two years to support his family. He obtains his supplies from the farming communities, and sells at retail to his customers. He wants to use the loan to buy bags of maize to meet the daily demands of his customers in his community and the surrounding markets. He hopes to use part of his profit to pay his children's educational fees. Emmanuel A. is a member of a community group called "Nyame Mma" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: Mr. Ke M. is a villager in Phsar Krach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a fruit seller in the local market. His wife, Mrs. Erk Phat, assists him in the fruit selling business. They have three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining two attend the local school. Although Mr. M.'s family members have different businesses, they still live in an old house in poor condition. In order to live in better conditions, Mr. M. decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings in order to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To build a house for his family

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. M. is a 50-year-old wife and mother, with six children. She is resourceful and very enterprising. She has supported three children through high school with her business. The other three are currently in school. She is a food vendor and sells local foods like "kenkey and fish". Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains and eaten with hot pepper or fried fish.  Many people enjoy it as breakfast, lunch and supper. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to afford her production expenditure. This has affected production quality adversely. She needs the loan to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality as well. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, fish, vegetables and firewood. Grace is a member of a group called "Nyame Mma" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like maize, fish, vegetables, vegetable oil and firewood.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily K. is 40 years old, married and has 5 children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Emily has a grinding machine which she uses to grind tomatoes, peppers, beans etc.  She needs a loan in the amount of $450 to buy another grinding machine.  This, she says, will enable her to meet the demands of her customers.

Emily thanks all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy one grinding machine

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is 38 years old, divorced, and a mother of four children. She is a trader who is hard-working and enterprising.  For seven years, she has been selling maize, plantain, beans and groundnuts and gari in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says selling these products is very lucrative. Therefore, she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make enough income to rent a storeroom. Mary is a member of the group called "Nyame Mma" Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like maize, plantain, groundnut, gari and beans.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Prescious O. is 32 years old, married and has one child.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

In her store, Precious sells provisions, foodstuffs, and tailoring materials.  She needs a loan of $350 to buy more food products such as yams, oil, beans and rice.  She hopes to retain her customers by stocking what they need.  Through her combined businesses she is able to provide for her family's upkeep. 

Precious says thank you to all KIVA lenders and LAPO Microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John T. K. is a 49-year-old businessman. He is married with five children and very dedicated to his work. He owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits etc. in the local market of Nankese, in Koforidua. John supports his family with proceeds from his business. He wants to use the loan to buy supplies in bulk to expand his business. John hopes to save more towards his children's education. He belongs to the community group called 'Nyame mma Trust Group'. The group members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans on time.

loans.use: To buy store supplies in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase clothing, beauty accessories, and other goods for her small business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace O. lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 44 years old, married and has 5 children.

Grace sells yams which she buys from the northern part of the country  The demand for her yams is high from now until the end of the year. Therefore Grace needs a loan in the amount of $1200 to buy more yams to meet this demand.

She says thank you to all who make this loan possible, especially Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi A. is 28 years old. She is a single mother with three children, all of whom are in school. She is resourceful and very enterprising. She operates a restaurant and sells local foods like cooked rice and gari with beans. Gari is prepared from milled cassava and eaten with beans and fried ripe plantain. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to afford her production expenditure. This has affected production quality adversely. She needs the loan to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality as well. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of rice, meat, fish, vegetables, vegetable oil and firewood. Naomi is a member of a group called "Nyame mma" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en: Mrs. Huon H. is 35 years old. She is a farmer in Taing Tbeng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Sum Chhnam, owns a small kiln to make coal to sell. Since this business is going well, he wants to sell the product door-to-door, so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to add to the old one in order to transport his coal to sell. Mrs. H. has three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest is too young to study.

loans.use: To buy a cow to transport coal to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet E. sells fresh and dried fish where she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She is 40 years old, married and has 6 children.

Janet loves the fish business because the demand for her product is high.  The dried fish is smoked in fire and this keeps it dry for a long time.  Because of the high demand, Janet needs a loan of $875 to purchase more fish to sell.

Janet says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more fresh and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Net

texts.en: Mrs. Net C. is a villager in Krouy Wat Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. Her husband is a pig butcher who can make a small income to support his family. Mrs. C. is 39 years old and the mother of three children who all attend the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her inventory

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret Nyarko is 57 years old. She is divorced, with seven children. Only one child is in school. Margaret sells frozen food; she also buys dried fish and smoked fish from middlemen and fishmongers, and resells it in the local market.  Margaret has been in this business for fifteen years.  She says income is very low since she pays high rent on the store from which she operates. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen food, so she can increase her business and make enough money to build a permanent store for herself. She is a member of the group called "Nyame mma" Trust Group. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen food to expand her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
The selling of dried fish is one business that Victoria I. cherishes a lot. She is 39 years old, married with 5 children and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. 

Victoria is a LAPO client and needs a loan amount of $700 to buy more dried fish to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Net

texts.en: Mrs. Net S. N. lives in Tumnop Thmey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a pork seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Hem Sophak, is a firewood seller. Although Mrs. S. N. and her husband have different businesses, they cannot support their family well. In order to support their family, Mrs. S. N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a cow-breeding business. Mrs. S. N. is 21 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to go to school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cow-breeding business

loans.name: Doem

texts.en: Mrs. Doem S. is a villager in Prey Sak Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a thatch maker who sews palm leaves together to process into thatch. Her husband, Mr. Morn Chamnab, tows a cart with his motorbike in order to transport passengers for an income. Even though Mrs. S. and her husband have different businesses, they still live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family to live in better conditions. Mrs. S. is 28 years old and the mother of one child who is too young to go to school.

loans.use: To build a new house for her family

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is a 24-year-old trader. She is married with two children. She has sold used clothes and ladies' slippers in a local market in Koforidua for three years. With this business, she has been able to support her family. Her major challenge over the years has been funds to scale up the business. Esther has lots of marketing experience and she is very confident that the loan would enable her to make remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes and ladies' slippers to increase her inventory. She says her greatest joy will come when she is able to provide her children with a quality education to make them more resourceful in the future. She hopes to save enough to fulfill this dream of hers.  Esther is a member a group called "Nyame mma Trust Group". Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes and ladies slippers.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Mrs. Yim K. is a food seller in the village of Sala Lek Pram in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Vann Heng, is a village chef who makes a small income to support the family. Although Mrs. K. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot improve their living conditions. To improve their standard of living, Mrs. K. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a new pig-breeding business. Mrs. K. is 52 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one helps the mother in business. The third one is attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a pig-breeding business

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty O., a 40-year-old trader, is a divorced mother of four children. The children are in school. She is a very resourceful mother. Gifty supports her children through the sale of used clothing and shoes. The market for used clothing in Ghana is significant, as brand-new clothes are very expensive. Therefore selling of used clothing has created opportunities for many Ghanaian women like Gifty. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing and shoes to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her to save more for her children's education and also to rent a store in which to trade. She is member of the group called "Nyame mma" Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan. Gifty does not sell on group meeting days and her photo was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Naddima Nnalongo & Teo Mukasa Abateesa Group

texts.en:
Abateesa women's group is located in Kabowa in Kampala. Its leader, Teo M. Levi, is on the left in the photo, with Naddima N. on the right. Teo also participates in the Buganda traditional women's forum where she has been the emcee.

Teo's business, which she has pursued for the past year, is making uniform sweaters for children of two schools. She is a teacher by profession and usually makes the uniforms during her free time and during the holidays. She was able to get a water supply from National Water that she sells to her community, and this has increased her income also.

The loans help her so much with her beneficiaries' school fees. Teo M. says that without the loans she would not have been able to sustain her family on her small teacher's salary. With her share of this loan, she plans to buy more material for making sweaters and to complete paying school fees for her beneficiaries.

loans.use: Teo Mukasa plans to buy more material for making sweaters and to complete paying school fees for her beneficiaries.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Married with three children who are currently in school, Rachael O. is 43 years old. She sells food like cassava, plantain, maize, bananas etc. in the local market of Nankese in Koforidua, where she lives. She has been selling for the past fifteen years; she has lots of selling experience to win customers. Rachael is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her children with quality educations for their future careers. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock to serve her customers and grow her business. She is a member of the community group called "Nyame mma" Trust Group. In this group members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased stock for her food market.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene I. is 47 years old and is married, with four children.  She has been in the clothing and accessory business for a long time and the demand for her clothes, shoes and bags is high.  She needs a loan of $700 to purchase more merchandise to sell.

Magdalene is a hardworking woman and she hopes to lift her family above poverty.  She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: N. Rose is a member of Abateesa women's group in Kabowa. She is married and has three children; she also cares for two step-children and six of her husband's relatives, mostly orphans. Rose is a poultry farmer who keeps about 600 broiler and layer chickens at her home. She has ensured that her layers are in more spacious housing so as to give her more eggs, while the broilers are kept in closer quarters so that they gain more weight, and this trick has made a success of her business. She has been a member of her lending group since the start and the loans she gets are used to buy chicken mash and feed.

loans.use: Najjemba Rose will use her loan to buy chicken mash and feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene C. is 42 years old, married with 4 children. Her eldest child is 16 years old while the youngest is 4 years old. She sells palm oil and washing soap.

The washing soap is used in washing pots and pans that have difficult stains. Magdalene produces the washing soap herself. She buys the palm oil from a palm oil company at Okomu. She hopes to satisfy the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of US$ 700 to buy more palm oil to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Getu

texts.en: N. Getu is a single mother of 5 children with her own business ("Gomesi") sewing school uniforms and ladies' traditional wear.  She makes uniforms for three schools and often gets commissions from the Kampala City Council to make uniforms for orphans, and this ready market helps to boost her income. She is so grateful for the loans that have been like a partner to her after her husband's sudden disappearance without a trace 8 years ago (she is unsure whether to say she is married or a widow). She now cares for three grandchildren whose parents (her own children) died of AIDS. She needs a loan to be able to buy more material for making both school uniforms and ladies' traditional wear.

loans.use: Nabaweesi Getu needs a loan to buy more material for making both school uniforms and ladies' traditional wear.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah K. is a 55-year-old trader. She is married and blessed with four children. All four children have finished high school. Sarah says combining motherhood and business demands is very challenging. However the two must be attended to simultaneously. She has traded in yams, beans, groundnuts, maize etc. for five years now. She is able to support her household through this business. She needs the loan to enable her to purchase more stock to scale up sales. She hopes the loan will enable her to double her savings to provide quality educations for the children. Sarah belongs to a group called "Nyame mma" Trust Group. The group members assist one another to repay their loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more stock to increase her business.

loans.name: Naddiya

texts.en: N. Naddiya has a beauty salon in Kabowa that she has been running for three and a half years now. She is married with one child, but also cares for her three brothers and sisters and pays their school fees. In her salon, she braids hair and applies chemicals to the hair; she also sells the same chemicals to customers who prefer to do their hair in the comfort of their own homes. With the loan, she plans to stock her salon with more chemicals, braids, wigs and weaves in preparation for the festive season.

loans.use: Namatovu Naddiya plans to stock her salon with more chemicals, braids, wigs and weaves in preparation for the festive season.

loans.name: Jane Francis

texts.en: S. Jane Francis is 28 years old and is married, with four children. She also cares for one niece who is also in school. She has had a retail shop in Kabowa for one year and it is now doing well, thanks to a loan from Pearl Microfinance. Before her first loan, she had empty shelves and few customers, but after her mother introduced her to the Abateesa women's group, her life transformed for the better. She has been able to stock her shop over the past six months and now her customers have increased, with more profits coming in.  With this loan, her second with the group, she plans to buy more sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil, bread, soda and other items to sell in her shop.

loans.use: Serubogo Jane Francis plans to buy more sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil, bread, soda, and other items to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: K. Rose is a member of Abateesa women's group and the mother of Serubogo Jane Francis, also a group member. Rose has a clinic that is managed by her daughter but her main business for the past 6 years is poultry farming. She has over 800 chickens, both broilers and layers. She is married with 10 children, including 4 orphans belonging to her late children. This is her forth year with her lending group, and has nothing but kind words regarding the group lending, especially for people like herself who lack collateral to get loans from big banks. Whenever she gets a loan, she makes sure that she stocks chicken feed and mash.  Repayments are usually possible with the sale of eggs and broilers. Right now, the maize for chicken feed is quite expensive and this has increased the price she must ask for her eggs and chickens. If not for the loans from Pearl Microfinance, she would be out of business.

loans.use: Kiwanuka Rose plans to stock chicken feed and mash for her broiler and layer chickens.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham T. is 29 years old. He is married and the father of one child. He travels to farming communities to buy bulk foodstuffs such as maize, plantains, beans, groundnuts, yams etc. and re-sell them in the community market and sometimes beyond to his faithful customers.

Abraham's business is on a very small scale because of inadequate working capital. He believes this loan will help him to avoid middlemen who sell to him at exorbitant prices. He wants to use the loan to buy bulk stocks of maize, plantains, beans, groundnuts, and yams to increase his inventory.

Price hikes are another challenge to his business emanating from the current food crisis. Abraham hopes to cut down on cost through bulk purchasing. He trusts this will enable him to save enough to support his child in school. He is a member of the trust group called "Nyame Mma" meaning God's Children Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and assist each other to repay the loan. His picture was taken after their group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bulk stocks of maize, plantains, beans, groundnuts and yams, etc.

loans.name: Rayhongul

texts.ru: Наврасова Райхонгуль жительница района Вахдат. Возраст 47 лет, заумжем, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Клиентка занимается животноводством более 10 лет. Она покупает на рынке молодых бычков , откармливает их и продает. На доход от своего бизнеса содержит свою семью.Животноводство является основынм источником дохода ее большой семьи. Помогают ей ее дети. На кредит Райхонгуль планирует купить 2-х бычков.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rayhongul N., 47, lives in Vahdat district. She is married and has six children. Ms. N. has a high school education. She has been in the business of raising animals for over ten years. She purchases calves at the market, fattens them up and re-sells them. The income from this business is the main source of income for Ms. N.'s large family, and her children also help her with the business. Ms. N. has applied for a loan to purchase two calves. She plans to repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Loy

texts.en: M. Loy is a member of the Abateesa women's group.  For three years, she has owned a depot in Kabowa where she sells soda, beer, and other soft drinks. This is her second time to ask for a loan from Pearl Microfinance. Before her first loan, she usually found difficulties in stocking enough for her ever-increasing customer demands, but since then she has had no problems and it has greatly improved her business. She manages her depot alone, though her husband is very supportive.  They have two kids and also care for four orphans. She needs a loan to be able to buy more crates of soda, beer, wines and spirits for her customers and to ensure a stable business that will sustain itself through the end of the year.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda, beer, wines and spirits for her customers.

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.ru: Назаров Искандар житель города Вахдат. Возраст 58 лет, женат, имеет 8 детей. Образование высшее ,по специальности педагог. Заработная плата очень маленькая поэтому клиент занимается  куплей продажей овощей и фруктов. Он имеет небольшую торговую точку  на центральном рынке города. На кредит клиент хочет закупить ящики и посуду для своего товара. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Iskandar N., 58, lives in Vahkdat district. He is married with 8 children. Mr. N. has a university education; he was trained as a teacher. However, teaching salaries are quite low, so Mr. N. sells vegetables and fruits to make a living. He has a small trading stall at the city's central market. Mr. N. has applied for a loan in order to purchase shelves and dishes for his goods. He plans to repay the loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase inventory for selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maritta

texts.en: K. Maritta is an herbalist. She prepares local herbs for treatment of high blood pressure, diabetes, ulcers, syphilis, and many other sicknesses. She has been able to sustain the health of AIDS patients for a long time; her herbs prevent the skin disorders that usually affect such patients and this has won her more clients. She has three workers who help with looking for the herbs in the swamps and bushes around her area.  She sells from her home, and due to the efficiency of her drugs, many have come to her. She is proud to say that her driving force for doing what she does best is her late grandmother's spirit that gives her the wisdom to treat people using local medicine. Before becoming an herbalist, she sold used clothes by moving around to daily markets, a business she left for her daughter to manage. She is married with six children and cares for three grandchildren whose parents died without leaving them a penny. The loans help with the children's upkeep and school fees, plus paying her workers. The profits from the herbs help her to pay back her loans.

loans.use: Kizza Maritta plans to pay for school fees and upkeep for her children plus paying her workers.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel A. A. is called "Sammy" by most people in his community. He is 46 years old and married, with four children who are currently in school. Samuel is a dealer in hardware like assorted paints, nails, roofing sheets, hammers, PVC pipes etc. at Nankese in Koforidua, a town where he lives with his family. He buys his supplies from importers in Accra, the capital of Ghana, at wholesale prices and sells them to his customers at retail prices. He requests a loan to enable him to procure increased stock to accelerate business progress. With the loan, he hopes to increase savings so he can expand his shop to include the sale of cement. He would be very grateful for your support. He is a member of the trust group called "Biako ye" (meaning It is good to come together) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and assist themselves to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to expand his hardware business.

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.ru: Акобирова Зулхумор жительница города Вахдат.Возраст 37 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Клиентка  имеет небольшой продуктовый магазин.Имеет опыт в торговли более 5 лет. Магазин приносит доход,на который она содержит свою семью.В данный момент Зулхумор хочет закупить товар для розничной реализации.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zulhumor A. lives in the city of Vakhdat. She is 37 years old, married and has 4 children. She is a high school graduate and owns a small grocery store. She has been working in retail for over five years. The profit from the store helps her sustain her family. Zulhumor would like to purchase more goods to increase retail sales. She plans to repay the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase goods for retail sale

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia A. O. is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Koforidua, in the eastern region of Ghana. She is 41 years old.  She runs a clothing shop and has sold jeans, blouses and skirts, lace materials, women's slippers and dressing bags for the past eight years. Leticia is constrained by funds in running the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to purchase a large quantity of high-quality goods to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance. She is a member of the group called 'Biako ye'. Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase improved inventory for her business.

loans.name: Davri

texts.ru: Муродова Даври жительница района Вахдат. Возраст  45 лет,замужем , имеет  3 детей.Образование среднее.Клиентка из  дома торгует продуктами питания.Бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи.Так как муж клиентки временно не работает. На кредит клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент своей торговой точки.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Davri M. lives in Vakhdat region. She is 45 years old, married and has 3 children. She is a high school graduate. Davri has a home-based food retail business, which is her family’s only income. Davri’s husband is currently unemployed. Davri would like to obtain a loan in order to increase the assortment of goods she sells. She plans to repay the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia A. is 36 years old. She is single with three children:  one has successfully completed high school and the other two are still in school. Olivia enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, evaporated milk, bottled water, body and hair creams, powdered milk etc. However, she is constrained by low capital from making meaningful progress. She requests a loan to buy more inventory to increase her profits. She believes that with her good customer relations, the loan will enable her to realize her dream. She is a member of the group called "Biako ye" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Talbi

texts.ru: Назарова Талби жительница района Вахдат. Возраст 48 лет, замужем, имеет 7 детей. Образование среднее.Клиентка занимается производством кисло-молочной продукцией.Реализует продукцию соседям и на  местном рынке. В данный момент вырос спрос на ее продукцию и она решила купить дойную корову. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
N. Talbi lives in the area of Vaxdat. She is 48 years old, married and has 7 children. She also has a high school education. The client is involved with the production of sour milk products. She sells her good to her neighbors and at the local market. At the current moment the demand for her products has risen and she has decided to buy a milk cow. She plans to repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Sangali.

texts.ru: Назаров Сангали житель города Вахдат. Возраст 25 лет,женат , имеет2 детей.Образование среднее.Клиент занимается куплей продажей фруктов и овощей. Торгует на центральном рынке города.Он покупает у оптовых поставщиков  товар и реализует его в розницу.Бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи.На кредит хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки.Планирует погасить кредит в тчении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sangali N. is a citizen of the city of Vaxdat. He is 25 years old, married, and has 2 children. He has a high school education. Sangali is involved with the buying and selling of fruits and vegetables. He trades at the main market of the city. Sangali buys from farmers the goods and sells them for a profit. This business is the only source of income for his family. He plans to use the loan to increase his assortment of goods. He plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of commodity circulation

loans.name: Sayera

texts.ru: Назарова Сайера жительница города Вахдат Возраст 23 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Клиентка занимается пошивом национального женского платья.Имеет опыт в производстве более 6 лет. Сайера принимает заказы на дому.Бизнес позволяет ей обеспечивать свою семью самым необходимым.Кредит берет для покупки более современной швейной машинки.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев
texts.en:
Sayera N. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 23 years old, married and has two children. She is a seamstress with more than six years experience in the construction of women’s traditional dresses. Sayera does made-to-order work out of her home. This business allows her to provide her family with the necessities. The loan would go towards the purchase of a modern sewing machine, and she plans to repay it within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en: Eddy O. is 35 years old and is married with 2 children. He lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. The picture shows him standing with his wife and children. Eddy sells provisions and foodstuffs. He buys his goods from Benin City and Onitsha. He hopes to own a supermarket some day. He is requesting a loan of $700 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. He believes this will help to increase his profits. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia O. is a 60 year married woman with 9 children. She sells palm oil and yams. She buys her yams from the western part of Nigeria while the palm oil is purchased from Delta State. The demand for her yams and palm oil is very high. Palm oil is used in the preparation of Nigerian soups like Banga & Egusi soups. She is requesting a loan of $700 to buy more yams and palm oil for sale.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil and yams to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen O. owns a successful business selling lubricants like engine oil, power steering fluid and brake hydraulic fluid. She is requesting a loan amount of $450 to buy more Hydraulic lubricant for sale. She hopes to buy the lubricant in large quantities to sell to her customers which will enable her to make more profits and meet the demands of her customers. Helen is 42 years old and is married with 2 children. She thanks Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their support.

loans.use: To buy more lubricant to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet I. is 38 years old and is married with 3 children. Juliet has a salon and also does pedicures and manicures for her customers. In addition, she sells hair extension materials. She requests a loan amount of $450 to buy more hair extensions to sell. Her utmost dream is to see that her children receive a quality education. She thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Uyimwen

texts.en: Uyimwen Vincent U. sells beef at the market in her community. Uyimwen is 48 years old and married with four children. Her eldest son is married and is a furniture maker. The other children are in school. She says that she and her husband are doing their best to give their children a quality education. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more beef for sale. She says "thank you" to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more beef for sale

loans.name: Osatohanmwen

texts.en:
Osatohanmwen E. lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and has been in this business for a long time. She buys drinks from distributors in Benin City. Due to the increase in the number of customers that purchase her drinks, she hopes to buy more to meet their demands. This will enable her to retain her customers. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more drinks for sale.

Osatohanmwen is 38 years old and married with 2 children. Standing with her are her two daughters. She says "thank you" to all who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy O. is 40 years old and married with five children. Mercy sells yams and garri by hawking them. She buys the garri and yams from the village and takes them to the city to sell. She is a LAPO client and needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more yams and garri to sell. Mercy says "thank you" to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more garri and yams to sell

loans.name: Philo

texts.en: Philo A. lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Philo buys dried fish and garri from the village market and travels to the city to sell it. Dried fish is used in the preparation of Nigerian soups like Egusi, Banga,  and Okro. She is 29 years old and is married with three children. Philo is trying to make her life meaningful by working hard. She requests a loan of $700 to buy more dried fish and garri for sale.  She thanks all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish and garri for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther I. is a long time restaurant owner that sells cooked foods like rice, beans, yams, etc. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She buys her foodstuffs from the local market in her community. Her restaurant is open everyday at 8:am and closes by 7:pm. She is requesting a loan of $600 to buy more foodstuffs for cooking to sell to her customers. Esther is 60 years old and is married with 9 children.  Her eldest child is 30 years old and her youngest child is 16 years old. She thanks Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking to sell at the restaurant

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth O. is a hair stylist that makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. She also sells bags, clothes and shoes. She is single and is 27 years old. Loveth is also a part time student at the University of Benin. She requests a loan amount of $600 to buy more hair extensions, shoes, clothes and bags to sell. She travels to Lagos and Onitsha to buy all of her products. Loveth is grateful to all Kiva lenders and thanks them.

loans.use: To buy more hair extension, clothes, shoes and bags to sell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy Idunmwonyi is 32 years old and is married with a child. She sells foodstuffs and fruits like pears and oranges. The demand for her fruits and foodstuffs is high and she would like to retain her customers by meeting their demands. She requests a loan amount of $875 to buy more foodstuffs and fruits to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia O. is 43 years old and is married with five children. Her youngest child is 9 years old. Felicia sells palm and vegetable oil. Palm and vegetable oil is used in the preparation of stew and soup in Nigeria. She buys the palm oil and vegetable oil from oil millers in Benin city. Felicia requests a loan of $450 to buy more palm and vegetable oil to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more palm and vegetable oil to sell

loans.name: Iziegbe

texts.en: Iziegbe I. is 33 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she sells foodstuffs and provisions like tin tomatoes, indomie, palm and vegetable oil. She is requesting a loan of $525 to increase the inventory of her foodstuffs and provisions for sale. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and provisions for sale

loans.name: Franca

texts.en: Franca I. has a store in the Agbado Market in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sews and sells clothing materials. She purchases the clothing materials from Onitsha market.  Franca sews school uniforms for school children. The demands for her tailoring service is high and she is determined to retain her customers. She requests a loan of $700 to buy more clothing materials for sewing and selling. Franca is 48 years old and she is married with a 15 year old child. She says thank you .

loans.use: To buy more clothing material for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth O. is 35 years old and is married with 6 children. She sells and sews clothes at the market. Ruth makes lovely Nigerian designs mostly for married women and single girls. She is requesting a loan of $700 to buy more tailoring materials like sewing thread, zippers, landing, etc. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana E. sells vegetable and palm oil. The demands for her palm and vegetable oil are high because palm and vegetable oil are essential ingredients in the preparation of local dishes in Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of $875 to buy more palm and vegetable oil for sale. She is 50 years old and is married with four children. Her children are in the University and secondary schools. She thanks all of those that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more groundnut oil and vegetable oil to sell

loans.name: Favour

texts.en: Favour O. owns a tailoring store. He sews clothes of different styles for people. His customers are both male and female. He is 35 years old and is married with four children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Since the festive season is fast approaching, he is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more clothing materials for sale and also for sewing. He thanks all those that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials for sale

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
Mayra, es comerciante y tiene una tienda donde vende carne, abarrotes, conservas, refrescos.
Tiene un hijo y es separada; Mayra es la única que genera ingresos en su familia para los gastos de estudios, ropa alimentación y otros gastos de ella y su hijo.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (Compra de Abarrotes, carne, y conservas) para reabastecer su tienda.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
El crédito le dará la oportunidad de comprar en cantidad y bajar sus costos con el objetivo de mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mayra is a businesswoman, and she has a store where she sells meat, snacks, canned food, and soft drinks. She has a son and is separated from her husband; Mayra is the only person who generates an income in her family to cover the expenses of studies, clothing, food, and any other expenses for her and her son. Her home is located in the zone of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. This loan would be used for working capital (to buy snacks, meat, and cans of food) in order to restock her store. This is the second time that she has asked for a loan from IMPRO. Her history qualifies her as a Client 1, which is to say she complied well in her repayments, and because of this she is permitted to gain access this second loan. The loan will give her the opportunity to buy in quantity and lower her costs with the objective of improving her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (meat, canned food, soft drinks, etc.) for Mayra's shop

loans.name: Marius

texts.en:
Greetings from Marius from Kigali, Rwanda! Marius is 24 years old, married with 2 children. This young entrepreneur started his business selling home utensils in the market in 2006 with a working capital of US$ 458. With much hard work, his capital has grown to US$ 2935. He employs 1 person to help him run the business.

Marius is requesting a loan worth 515,000 Frws. The loan is to buy more stock for his business, expanding the utensils business in the market. The loan period is 12 months, repaid on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his business

loans.name: Violette

texts.en:
Muraho (hello) from Violette in Kigali, Rwanda! Violette is 32 years old, married with 3 biological children and 2 adopted children. Violette owns a boutique (shop) selling different items such as powdered milk, cassava flour, beans, bars of soap, bags of rice, salt, Colgates products, cooking oil etc.

Violette started her business in 2005, with a working capital of about US$ 211. It has grown to over US$ 1100 as per 2008. This client is requesting a loan of 518,925 Frws. The loan is to increase her stock, to buy more items for her shop. The loan period is 12 months.

loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Djimah

texts.fr:
Monsieur NAKPANE Djimah est née le 27 décembre 1975 à Bassar. Il est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Il a pour activité, la vente de volailles et de tubercules d’ignames dans le quartier d’Agoè. Il a commencé ce commerce depuis 2002. Généralement, ces activités sont exercées par les femmes mais monsieur N. a une passion pour ce commerce. Il a souvent pris le crédit auprès de WAGES et rembourse toujours bien.
Ce quatrième crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 120 têtes de volailles et 150 tubercules d’igname afin de pouvoir servir ses clients et tirer un bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mister Djimah NAKPANE was born on December 27, 1975 in Bassar. He's married and the father of two children. His business consists in selling poultry and yams in the Agoé neighborhood. He started this business in 2002. Usually, such activities are practiced by women, but Mister NAKPANE is passionate about this business. He has already obtained several loans from WAGES, which he has always repaid without problems. The fourth loan he is now seeking will enable him to buy 120 heads of poultry and 150 yams to serve his clients and make a profit.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy poultry and yams

loans.name: Kalabi Elom

texts.fr:
Né en 1983 à Lomé, monsieur A. Kalabi Elom est un jeune dynamique qui est né dans une famille dans laquelle la plus part de personne sont des commerçants. Après avoir quitté, les bancs scolaires, il s’est lancé dans la vente des cartes de recharge. Il est revendeur ambulant et vend de quartier en quartier. Avec cette activité, il arrive à satisfaire ses besoins quotidiens. 
Alors il a toujours une ambition qui est d’agrandir ce commerce pour vendre en gros afin de réaliser des choses autre que de se nourrir seulement.
A cet effet il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 2 petits cartons de cartes de recharges.
texts.en:
Kalabi Elom A. was born in 1983 in Lomé. This young, energetic man was born into a family, most of whom have commercial businesses. After leaving school, he started selling mobile phone cards. He sells door to door throughout various neighborhoods. With this business he is able to meet his daily needs.

He has always had the goal of increasing his business and eventually selling wholesale, in order to raise his living standard above a basic subsistence level.

Therefore, he is requesting his first loan to buy two (2) small boxes of mobile phone cards.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mobile phone cards

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Greetings from Serafine A. in Rwanda! Serafine is 32 years old, married with 4 children. She owns a small shop in Nyamagabe town. She sells domestic materials like soap, maize flour, cassava flour, matchboxes, salt, sugar, beans by the kilogram, Colgate, paraffin, biscuits, etc.

Besides operating her shop, Serafina grows beans, wheat, and sweet potatoes, which are commonly grown in this area. From all her business activities, she earns about US$ 22 per month. She employs two people to help her run the business.

She is looking for a loan worth 200,000 Frws. The loan is to buy more stock for her shop because the number of customers is increasing.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Essofalafia Group

texts.fr:
Créée en 2007, l’association ESSOFALAFIA est un regroupement de femmes qui mettent en commun leurs moyens financiers pour la réussite de leur foyer. Elles sont mariées et mères de familles. Elles exercent les activités commerciales différentes telles que la vente des céréales (maïs, haricot), des nattes et de savons. Comme leur activité essentielle se repose sur les céréales, elles ont un magasin commun dans lequel elles stockent leurs marchandises.
Elles sont très dynamiques et aident leurs maris dans les dépenses de la famille.
Le premier crédit que les membres de cette association sollicitent leur permettra d’acheter 11 sacs de maïs, 6 sacs d’haricot, 35 nattes et 8 cartons de savons. Avec ce nouveau stock, elles pourront bien vendre et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Created in 2007, the ESSOFALAFIA association is a group of women who share their financial means for the benefit of their households. They are married and have children. They have different businesses such as selling cereals (corn, beans), mats and soaps. Since their main business is related to cereals, they have a common shop where they stock their goods. They are very energetic and help their husbands with the family expenses. The first loan that the members of this association are seeking will enable them to buy 11 sacks of corn, 6 sacks of bean, 35 mats and 8 boxes of soap. With this new stock, they will be able to make more sales and to provide for the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell corn, beans, mats and soaps

loans.name: Philippe

texts.en:
Amakuru (Greetings) from Philippe in Nyamagabe, Rwanda! Philippe is 48 years old, married with 7 children and 1 adopted child.

Philippe has been in business for 8 years and owns a restaurant with a bar. He sells food to people in the town and also beer. Besides the restaurant and the bar, he owns a big plantation of bananas and cassava and grows beans on a large scale. He employs 5 people in all in his business activities.

This client is requesting a loan worth 518,925 Frws. The loan is to buy more equipment for the restaurant such as plates, spoons, tables and more foodstuffs for the increasing number of customers. The loan period is 8 months to be repaid on monthly basis.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for the restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for a small business.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Amakuru ("greetings") from Jean Ndagije in Nyamagabe, Rwanda! Jean is 46 years old and married with five children, as well as two adopted orphans. 

Jean sells beverages like sodas, beer, and juice in his pub. He employs eight people to help him run the business and earns about $ 110 per month.

Jean is requesting a loan worth 518925 Frws, which he will use to buy more drinks and goats for to roast for meat. The loan period is eight months.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell and goats to roast.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
