She works as a farmer, while one of her children is employed in a garment factory and the others are attending a local school. She is currently facing a problem because her plantation is infertile. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Prom N. has asked for a loan to purchase fertilizers to support her field. Her husband, Mr. Pol Ny, is a laborer in ice factory as well as pig breeder.  Previously, Mrs. Prom N. obtained a loan from AMK to buy three piglets for her husband's pig breeding business which she successfully paid back. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Teth

texts.en: Mrs. Teth H. is a farmer in Lor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Chan Dy, is a soldier who earns a small salary to support his family. Of their five children, three are employed in a garment factory, while two are attending a local school. Although Mrs. Teth H.'s family members work in different businesses, they still live in an old house that is in poor condition. In order to improve her family's living condition, Mrs. Teth H. is asking for a loan to help build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is 46 years old and he is married with no children. He owns a shop that he runs with his wife who is seated by him in this picture. They sell fruit juice, bottled water, drinks and snacks; they have been in this business together since January 2006. Felix is a LAPO client. He requests a loan of $850 to purchase more inventory to sell. He  thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth owns a chemist shop where he sells medicine. He runs the shop with his wife who is a trained nurse in a private hospital.  Kenneth is also a nurse but he prefers to sell medicine because selling medicine will enable him have time to attend to other family issues.  He has been in this business since 1998. His wife also assists him when she is not on duty. Kenneth is 45 years old and married with three children. He needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more medicine for sale from a pharmaceutical store. He says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more medicine to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells cooked foods like rice, beans, yams and plantain. She has a fridge from which she sells drinks and water. Maria has been in this food business since 1996. Maria also sells kerosene.

Maria is 38 years old and married with four children. She and her family live in Ajegunle, Lagos State. Maria is a LAPO client and needs the loan amount of $850 to buy foodstuffs like rice, beans and yams in bulk - she says "thank you".

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Alifmoh

texts.ru: Пирова Алифмох  жительница города Вахдат.Возраст 58 лет, замужем, имеет 10 детей.Муж клиентки работает таксистом на собственной автомашине.Этот вид деятельности является основным источником дохода их большой семьи.В данный момент ее муж хочет отремонтировать машину.Для чего ему нужны  деньги.Семья решила взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Alifmoh P. lives in the city of Vakhdat. She is 58 years old, married and has 10 children. Her husband is a cab driver. He uses their private car as a taxi. This business is the main source of income for this big family. Alifmoh’s husband would like to fix the car. The family decided to obtain a loan that they plan to repay in the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to fix the car

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget U. sells clothing materials for making suits and school uniforms. She has been selling clothing materials for a long time. Bridget is 49 years old and married with 8 children. During the holidays, her children assist her in the sale of clothing materials. She and her family live in Lagos state. 

Bridget hopes for the loan amount of $850 to purchase more clothing materials so that she can provide supplies to schools for uniform making. "l sell in cash, therefore repayment will not pose a problem to me," says Bridget. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials to sell

loans.name: Fayzinisso

texts.ru: Сафарова Файзиниссо жительница  города Вахдат.Возраст 47 лет,замужем, имеет 6 детей. Муж клиентки работает таксистом на своей машине. Работает шофером более 30 лет. Так как бензин подорожал,ее муж хочет купить газовое оборудование  для машины.Для чего они решили взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Fayzinisso S. lives in the city of Vakhdat. She is 47 years old, married and has 6 children. Her husband is a cab driver. He uses their private car as a taxi. He has been in the business for over 30 years. With fuel prices rising, Fayzinisso’s husband would need to obtain a loan for purchasing fuel. The family plans to repay the loan in the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fuel

loans.name: Muzayam

texts.ru: Саидова Музаям жительница города Вахдат.Возраст  39 лет,замужем , имеет 2 детей.Образование среднее. Клиентка более 10 лет занимается куплей продажей овощей.Этот вид деятельности помогает ей содержать свою семью ,так как муж клиентки временно не работает. Музаям скупает у местным крестьян вощи и реализует из в розницу на местном рынке. В данный момент она хочет расширить свой бизнес.Клиентка решила взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muzayam S. lives in the city of Vakhdat. She is 39 years old, married and has 2 children. She is a high school graduate. For more than 10 years Muzayam has been selling vegetables. Her business helps her sustain her family. Her husband is currently unemployed. Muzayam buys vegetables from local peasants and sells them at the local market. She would like to expand her business and is applying for a loan that she plans to repay in the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Greetings from Fatuma from Kigali, Rwanda! Fatuma is 55 years old, a single mother with 1 child.

Fatuma sells fabrics as a wholesalerto different retail shops and tailors who make dresses and shirts out of the fabrics. Many people in her area like her fabrics because they are of good quality. She employs one person to help her run the business. She earns about $110 per month.

Her loan will be used to buy more fabrics before Christmas because she is anticipating a huge market during Christmas celebrations. The loan requested is 500,000 frws and the loan period is 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics before the Christmas season

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Курбонова Дилбар жительница  района Вахдат.Возраст  38 лет, замужем,имеет 2 детей.Образование среднее.Дилбар занимается сельским хозяйством,она имееет небольшой земельный участок на котором сеет овощи.Имеет опыт в сельском хозяйстве более 10 лет.Собрав урожай клиентка делает запасы  для своей семьи,а лишнее реализует на рынке.В данный момент Дильбар хочет купить минеральные удобрения,что бы получить качественный урожай.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilbar K. is 38 and lives in Vahdat district. She is married with two children and has a high school education. Dilbar has a small plot of land where she grows vegetables for a living. She has been in the agricultural business for over 10 years. Dilbar keeps some of her harvest for her own family and sells the rest at the market. Dilbar is applying for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer, which will increase the quality of her harvest. She plans to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Мукарамджонова Ханифа жительница района Вахдат. Возраст 50 лет,замужем, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее.Ханифа более 25 лет занимается животноводством. Она обеспечивает молоком и кисло-молочной продукцией свою большую семью,а лишнее продает своим соседям.В данный момент возрос спрос на ее продукцию .Клиентка решила купить дойную корову.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 15 месяцев
texts.en:
Hanifa M. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 50 years old, is married and has 6 children. Hanifa has a high school education. She has been raising livestock for over 25 years. Hanifa provides milk and dairy products for her large family and sells extras to her neighbors. At the moment there is an increase in demand for her products. Hanifa has decided to buy a dairy cow. She plans to pay back her loan over 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Раджабова Замира жительница города Турсунзаде.Возраст 24 года,замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее.Клиентка более 5 лет занимается куплей продажей женской одежды.Она имеет небольшую торговую точку на местном рынке .Этот вид деятельности помогает ей содержать свою семью,так как муж клиентки находится в России.В данный момент Замира хочет закупить товар  у оптовых поставщиков.планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Раджабова Замира жительница города Турсунзаде.Возраст 24 года,замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее.Клиентка более 5 лет занимается куплей продажей женской одежды.Она имеет небольшую торговую точку на местном рынке .Этот вид деятельности помогает ей содержать свою семью,так как муж клиентки находится в России.В данный момент Замира хочет закупить товар у оптовых поставщиков.планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: закуп товара

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Greetings from Laurence in Kigali, Rwanda! Laurence is 36 years old, married with 4 children. 

Laurence owns a shop selling various items including bags of maize flour, cassava flour, beans, and bags of sugar. Besides that, she sells various fresh food items such as bananas, potatoes, etc. in her shop.

She is requesting a loan worth 515,000 Frws. The loan is to expand her stock and buy more food items for her growing clientele. The loan period is 8 months, repaid monthly.

loans.use: to increase her stock of foods for sale

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul sells medicine through wholesale and retail; he has been in this business since 1997. Paul is 42 years old and is married to Nkem, who sells kerosene and lubricant. They have five children and they live in Ajegunle, Lagos state. Paul needs the loan amount of $1200 to buy more medicine to sell. He is grateful to Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more medicine to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine styles hair and also supplies wrappers (like sarongs). She has 2 apprentices. Josephine opens her shop 8.am-7pm. Josephine is 28 years old and married with two children. She needs the loan amount of US$ 850 to purchase styling creams and weave-ons. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy hair creams and weave-ons to re-sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is single and has no children. She has received schooling through Junior High Level. Grace sells artificial hair pieces, panties, shoes and others products and she has also operated a beauty salon at Kwesidukrom near Elmina 2005. 

Grace uses her income to pay for utility bills and other expenses. She will use the loan of $700 to purchase more hair products and other goods for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to complete her building, which she started and had to stop.

loans.use: Grace will use the loan to purchase more hair products and other goods for sale.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Раджабова Замира жительница города Турсунзаде.Возраст 24 года,замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее.Клиентка более 5 лет занимается куплей продажей женской одежды.Она имеет небольшую торговую точку на местном рынке .Этот вид деятельности помогает ей содержать свою семью,так как муж клиентки находится в России.В данный момент Замира хочет закупить товар  у оптовых поставщиков.планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zamira R., 24, lives in Tursun-zade. Zamira is married with three children and has a high school education. For over five years, Zamira has been in business retailing women's clothing. She has a stall at the local market. Zamira's business helps her support her family, as her husband is away in Russia. Currently, Zamira wants to purchase more goods from wholesalers. She plans to repay the loan within a year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Eucharia

texts.en: Eucharia sells medicine and provisions and has been in this business since 1998. She is 47 years old and married with nine children. She lives in Lagos state and is a LAPO client. Eucharia needs a loan amount of $700 to buy more provisions and medicine to sell - and she says "thank you".

loans.use: To buy more provisions and medicine to sell

loans.name: Afi

texts.en: Afi M. sells fish which she buys from fishermen, brings home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Enyaaye near Elmina. Afi has received no formal education.  She is a single parent and has 6 children Afi has been selling fish since 1978. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale to meet her ever-increasing customer demands. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business to increase sales, which will eventually increase her income.

loans.use: Buy more fish for sale to meet her ever-increasing customer demands.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana A. sells fish which she buys from fishermen, brings home for processing and preserving, and then sends to the market for sale at Enyaaye near Elmina.

Diana has received primary education. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a policeman. Diana has been selling fish since 1988. She is responsible for helping her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale to meet her ever-increasing customer demand. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband to start putting up a house for the family.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice A. is married and has 4 children. She has received schooling through Junior High level. 

Rejoice has been in the fish selling business since 1978. She buys from fishermen and brings the fish home for processing and preservation.  The finished product is then sent to be sold at the market at Enyaaye near Elmina. She uses her income to pay for food for her family, and for their utility bills.

Rejoice will use the loan of to purchase more fish to meet the needs of her ever increasing number of customers.  Her husband is a draftsman, and with the new profits from her expanded business, Rejoice plans to help him build a house for their family.

loans.use: Rejoice will use the loan to purchase more fish to meet the needs of her ever increasing number of costumers.

loans.name: Loy's Group

texts.en:
Loy M. is a member of the Abateesa women's group in Kabowa. She has been a member of her lending group since its inception and is happy that she has achieved what she has today as a result of borrowing.

Loy is a poultry farmer with both broiler and layer chickens, which she keeps in her home. She has 500 chickens, most of which are broilers because they mature in only two months and hence fetch money faster. Broilers take five months to mature before starting to lay eggs.

Her dream is to increase the number of chicks to over 1000 and then she will be all smiles. She will use this loan from Kiva to buy chicken mash and feeds, as she has used previous loans to do.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and mash for her poultry farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock of clothing

loans.name: Sununa's Group

texts.en:
Sununa N. is married with 8 children. Sununa also cares for over 15 orphans. She has run her Sebbi Metal Workshop for 14 years. The business is running smoothly and she now needs a loan from Kiva (through Pearl Microfinance) to buy more metal.

She makes doors, windows, gates, and anything else that comes out of the metal. She has a large customer base and income from her business because she has a free nature with people, there is a lot of construction work happening locally, and the metal shop has a good strategic location.

Sununa runs the Naalya lending group hand-in-hand with the treasurer Jameo N.. Jameo is a young businesswoman with a Fashion Designer store not far from from Sununa's metal shop. For Jameo, her shop sells good quality jeans, T-shirts, tops, shoes, and some jewelry. She says that this is her best season until January, and with the loan she has planned to stock her shop with fancy material that can bring in money quickly.

loans.use: To buy more metal for her workshop.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Greetings from Francois in Kigali, Rwanda! Francois is 47 years old, married with 6 children. Francois is a retail shop owner, who sells items like juice, bars of soap, clothes for children, shoes, bottles of water, toilet paper, powder, etc.

Francois is looking for a loan worth 519,175 Frws to increase his stock. The loan repayment term is 8 months.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Slobodanka

texts.en: Slobodanka Dubajić was born in 1937. She is a widow and is in retail. She is a very healthy old women, and she does not like to just sit. Slobodanka keeps busy by embroidering. She does that in a traditional way and it is very popular. Slobodanka also does the frames. Now she needs a loan to buy needed things for her work such as thread, frames, needles and similar items. She decided to take a loan from WWI.

loans.use: To by needed things for embroidery

loans.name: Dejana

texts.en: Dejana Bajić was born in 1989. She comes from Doboj where she lives with her parents. Dejana is employed and she earns 400 KM monthly. Beside her job, she re-sells cosmetics and jewelry, bags and straps. She wants to order more products and be able to offer more and get more customers. That is the reason why she has requested a loan through WWI in the amount of 1300 KM.

loans.use: To buy products for re-selling

loans.name: Flaura

texts.en:
Greetings from Flaura in Byumba, in the north of Rwanda! Flaura is a young single entrepreneur of 22. She runs her own "cantine" (small shop) and sells drinks and food in a Catholic center.

She has been in a credit association and employs 2 people to help her run the business. She is requesting a loan worth 519,175 Frws to expand her business by buying more soft drinks, food, etc. The loan repayment period is 8 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es: Fortunato es agricultor, tiene una gran pasión por trabajar las tierras y hacerlas producir, tiene grandes hectáreas de terrenos de cultivo en las afueras de su comunidad, lugares que están sumamente alejados de su hogar, pero gracias a su caballito puede trasladarse sin dificultan y rápidamente a sus chacras.Nos comenta que le tiene un gran aprecio a su caballo, quien además es una muy buena compañía cuando sale muy temprano de su hogar.Fortunato es quien sostiene los gastos de su hogar, y ahora está muy preocupado por su producción debido que le hace falta una fumigadora, con la cual poder atacar las plagas y enfermedades de sus cultivos, por este motivo, solicita este préstamo, para la compra de su fumigadora y los abonos necesarios para sus terrenos de producción.
texts.en:
Fortunato is a farmer who has a great passion for working the land and making it produce. He has many hectares of farmland outside of his community, areas which are quite far from his home. However, thanks to his little horse, he can travel quickly and without difficulty to his small farm. He tells us he has a great appreciation for his horse, who is also good company when he leaves very early from his house. Fortunato is the one who supports his household, yet he is currently worried about his crops given his inability to use a fumigator. This leaves them vulnerable to attack from pest infestations and disease. It is for these reasons that he seeks a loan, so that he can buy a fumigator and the necessary fertilizers for his farmland.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a fumigator and fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban es uno de los hombres más trabajadores de su localidad, esta característica lo diferencia de los pobladores de la zona y lo hace un hombre altamente importante y respetado dentro de su comunidad.Visitamos la chacra donde cultiva maíz, donde se le encuentra gran parte del día, pero una de las dificultades, es la lejanía de su terreno, le toma horas de caminata para llegar hasta ahí, cuya ruta es muy conocida para don Esteban, pues la camina diariamente  para ir a trabajar.Esteban ahora  requiere de  una cantidad de dinero para comprar el abono y fertilizantes necesarios para su producción. Espera de tu apoyo.
texts.en:
Esteban is one of the most hard-working men in the area where he lives, which differentiates him from other local residents and makes him stand our as a well-respected and very important member of the community. We visited the plot of land where he grows corn and where he spends most of his day. The problem is that his plot is very far from where he lives, and Esteban spends several hours each day walking to and from his farm, a route he know very well by now.

Esteban is requesting this loan to buy the fertilizers he needs for his farm. He hopes you will support him.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for corn farm

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es una madre abnegada, dedicada a la agricultura y al trasporte de sus productos a los mercados de diferentes ciudades para su comercialización. Su esposo (en la foto), nos comenta de la ardua labor de Mercedes, a quien calificó como la mejor madre de familia y ayuda idónea para los trabajos agrícolas que realizan juntos. Esta pareja desea seguir adelante con su trabajo y solicitan este préstamo para incrementar su producción, para la compra de abono y fertilizantes, útiles en todo sembrío, para así aumentar sus ganancias y tener la capacidad de satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a self-sacrificing mother, dedicated to farming and to the transport of her products to the markets of different cities for their commercialisation. Her husband (in the photo) tells us about Mercedes’ hard work, whom he describes as the best possible mother of a family and an ideal helper for the agricultural labours that they undertake together. This couple wants to improve their lives with their work, and are asking for this loan in order to increase their production, in order to buy fertilizers, useful in all plantings, in order to improve their harvests and to have the capacity to satisfy the needs of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for the fields she cultivates

loans.name: Nilton

texts.es: Nilton es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado a sus sembríos, es agricultor, y esta es la actividad primordial con la cual puede solventar los gastos de su familia.Su trabajo es muy arduo y pesado, tanto en el campo como las largas caminatas a sus terrenos, pero al final, con tan solo ver a sus hijos creciendo y desarrollándose  adecuadamente, es su motivador para seguir con las mismas fuerzas.Es así, que Nilton trata de esforzarse por sus seres queridos, y por ellos es que tiene las ganas de superarse y de mejorar su producción, para satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.Es por estos motivos que solicita un préstamo para invertir en sus tierras, y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Nilton is a very hardworking man, who is very dedicated to his planting. He is a farmer, and this is the basic activity with which he is able to meet the expenses of his family. His work is very arduous and heavy, especially in the fields with the large extent of his fields, but in the end, as he is able to see his children growing and developing adequately, he is motivated to continue with the same level of effort. It is thus that Nilton tries to work for his dear ones, and for them that he has uses the income to improve himself and to improve his production, in order to satisfy the necessities of his children and improve the quality of life for his family. It is for these motives that he is asking for a loan to invest in his land, and so increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capitol for farming

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge es agricultor, todas las mañanas sale muy alegremente con su burrito hacia sus terrenos de cultivo, donde pasa el mayor tiempo posible, cuidando y abonando sus plantas de papa y maíz.Como padre, no deja de responsabilizarse por el cuidado de sus hijos, quienes requieren de su apoyo, no tan solo en lo económico, sino en lo afectivo, y a pesar de su recargada labor trata de dedicarles un tiempo para pasar junto a ellos.Don Jorge tiene pensado incrementar su producción, para ello solicita un préstamo de 1500 soles, para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes, indispensables para sus cultivos.Si usted esta en la capacidad de ayudarlo, él estará sumamente agradecido y lo retribuirá con su pago puntual y su trabajo constante.
texts.en:
Jorge is a farmer. Every day he leaves happily with his donkey toward his crops, where he spends as much time as possible taking care of, and fertilizing his potato and corn crops. As a father, he knows he's reponsible for the care of his children who need his support not only economically, but also affectionately. Despite his work overload, he tries to dedicate some time to be with his children. Jorge wants to increase production and is asking for a loan of 1500 soles ($1US = 3 soles, approx.) for fertilizers, necessary for his crops. If you are in a position to help him, he'll be very grateful and pay back the loan punctually and work constantly.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcelina siempre estuvo conviviendo con las actividades agrícolas, debido a que en su familia esta era la actividad que desempeñaban para ganarse la vida.Más ahora le tocó trabajar en ello, para que sus seres queridos, que conforman su joven familia puedan tener lo básico para crecer y desarrollarse sanamente.Por ello trabaja de sol a sol en su chacra, para que sus productos sean los mejores y puedan brindarles considerables ingresos económicos.Ella y su esposo desean aumentar sus cultivos de productos agrícolas para poder ahorrar, y en el momento en que su hija tenga que estudiar, puedan tener la posibilidad de brindarle una educación de calidad.En sus planes de producción le hace falta un monto, el cual solicitan, para adquirir lo necesario para sus cultivos.Si usted está la posibilidad de ayudarles, hágalo, por una buena causa.
texts.en:
Marcelina has always been involved in agricultural activities, since her family was in this business of cultivation in order to earn a living. More recently she has undertaken work in the fields, for her dear family, so they can have the basic necessities in order to grow and develop healthily. For this she works day to day in her farmhouse, in order that her produces are the best and able to bring a considerable income. She and her husband want to increase their harvest of agricultural products in order to save, so that when their daughter has to study, they will have the opportunity of giving her a quality education. In their production plans, they are lacking a horse, for which they are asking, in order to acquire what they need for their cultivation. If you have the possibility of helping them, please do it, for a good cause.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Funds to improve and increase agricultural production

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado a sus deberes agrícolas, con las cuales hace más de 15 años ha alimentado a su familia, y educado a sus hijos, quienes aman a su padre y lo tienen como ejemplo de un gran hombre.Es una persona muy responsable y amable, puesto que nos muestra sus terrenos donde  cultiva habas y otros productos agrícolas. Productos que consumimos gracias a personas como don Samuel, quien trabaja para llevar alimentos a las personas y para  brindar alimentación a su familia y sobre todo de tener la posibilidad de mejorar su calidad de vida dentro de su hogar.Bajo este fin, por los altos costos de los abonos y fertilizantes, de no adquirir estos, sería muy perjudicial para sus chacras, requiere de un préstamo, en usted esta la posibilidad de que Samuel pueda mejorar su producción y sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Samuel is a very hardworking man, dedicated to his farm work, with which for more than 15 years he has supported his family and educated his children, who love their father and have him for an example of a good man. He is a very responsible and kind person, who cares for his land where he grows beans and other agricultural products, products that we eat thanks to people like Don Samuel, who works to deliver food to the people and to enable his own family to eat, and above all to have the possibility of improving the quality of life inside his home. For this end, because of the high costs of fertilizers, he needs a loan. In you is the possibility in which Samuel could be able to improve his production and his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith, es de las mujeres que no se enfoca en un solo producto de venta, sino que amplía su negocio con nuevos productos, a base de que analiza y observa las necesidades de sus vecinos. Su tienda es una de las más concurridas en la zona, no sólo por la variedad de productos, sino también por los costos razonables, esto demuestra que Judith tiene una capacidad de venta, utilizando sus nociones de marketing en su negocio y hasta ahora le esta yendo muy bien. Además, por ser su comunidad un lugar alejado de la ciudad, los pobladores tienen muchas necesidades, esto contribuye al éxito del negocio de Judith, que gracias a que hay una buena carretera, puede transportar sus productos de la ciudad a su poblado. Ahora, tiene la necesidad de invertir en nueva mercadería, para lo cual requiere de su apoyo y solicita un préstamo, dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos nuevos productor para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Judith is a woman who doesn’t focus on a single product to sell, but rather enlarges her business with new products, on a basis of what she analyses and observes her neighbours to need. Her store is one of the most crowded in the area, not only because of the variety of products, but also for the reasonable costs. This demonstrates that Judith has a talent in sales, using her marketing ideas in her business and until now everything has gone very well. Also, because her community is outside of the city, the townspeople have many necessities, and this contributes to the success of Judith’s business as thanks to a good road, she is able to transport her products from the city to her town. Now, she needs to invest in new merchandise. For this she needs your help and is asking for a loan, money that she would invest in the purchase of new products to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with a new variety of products

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es una gran mujer, a lado de un gran hombre, a quien ayuda en sus labores de agricultor, aúnan esfuerzos para salir adelante económicamente por el bien de su familia, sobre todo por su pequeña niña.Este  trabajo obtuvo más  participación de Julia cuando su esposo fue brutalmente atacado por un toro luego de regresar de su chacra, lo dejó gravemente herido y tuvo que ser llevado al hospital de la cuidad más cercana, donde podían atenderlo, afortunadamente no tuvo complicaciones mayores, pero fueron como dos semanas donde su esposo no podía levantarse, fue ahí donde Marina asumió la responsabilidad del cuidado de sus chacras. Desde entonces, ambos trabajan en sus terrenos y ambos desean poder progresar como agricultores para brindar lo necesario a su pequeña hija y es por ella que se animaron a solicitar un préstamo, para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para sus terrenos. Esta pareja espera que puedan ayudarles a cumplir con su deseo.
texts.en:
Julia is a great woman, next to a great man, who helps in his work as a farmer. They join forces to succeed economically for the good of their family, especially for their small daughter. This work took more participation from Julia when her husband was brutally attacked by a bull after returning from his ranch. It left him seriously injured and he had to be taken to the hospital in the nearest city where they could take care of him. Fortunately, he did not have any major complications but there were two weeks when her husband could not get up, and it was then that Julia took over caring for their ranches. Since then, they have both worked in their fields and both want to be able to progress as farmers to provide what is necessary for her small daughter and it is for her that they are encouraged to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer for their land. This couple hopes that will help them fulfill their desire.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for their crops

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es: Pamela es una mujer muy trabajadora, dedicada a su tienda de abarrotes que con mucho esfuerzo logró adquirir junto a su esposo, gracias a la venta de artesanía, juntos elaborar collares y diversos adornos de decoración con semillas e hilos muy costosos y muy solicitados por los artesanos.Pamela desea contribuir con su pareja, quien desea viajar a la selva amazónica y traer estas singulares semillas, venderlas a los artesanos de su zona, además de los materiales que ellos necesitan para la producción de sus diversos adornos.Por ello, requieren de una suma de dinero que será invertida primeramente en adquirir algunos productos para su bodega y también para la actividad de artesano de su esposo, y así pueda viajar a la selva amazónica y traer gran cantidad de materia prima y artículos novedosos para ser ofrecidos a los turistas.
texts.en:
Pamela is a very hard-working woman dedicated to her grocery store, which she managed to acquire with great effort along with her husband, thanks to the sale of handicrafts. Together they embellish necklaces and various ornaments decorated with seeds and wires that are very expensive and highly sought after by artisans. Pamela wants to contribute with her partner, who wants to travel to the Amazon jungle and bring back these unique seeds, selling them to artisans in their area, in addition to the materials they need to produce the various adornments. For this they require a sum of money to be invested primarily in purchasing some products for their store and also for the handicraft activity of her husband, and thus they can travel to the Amazon jungle and bring back large quantities of raw materials and innovative items to be offered to tourists .

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in their store in addition to paying for travel expenses of her husband to get materials to make his handicrafts

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Eliana, joven muy optimista, apoya a su familia y de la misma forma trata de crecer económicamente y tener la posibilidad de prosperar en la vida.Es por ello que se asoció con su madre para poner un negocio de adornos artesanales, los cuales elabora su madre y ella se ocupa en traer las semillas necesarias para la confección de los diversos objetos.Su mayor aspiración es comercializar estas artesanías en lugares alejados, llevarlas a las ciudades más comerciales y vender al por mayor, con el fin de ayudar a su familia, sobre todo a su madre, quien es la persona más importante para ella.Es por estos dos fines que solicita un préstamo, para hacer de su negocio la mejor alternativa de trabajo, espera en usted, que le pueda ayudar a lograr sus objetivos personales y familiares.
texts.en:
Eliana is a very optimistic young woman who supports her family while trying to grow economically and to have the possibility of prospering in life. This is why she and her mother started their business selling handmade decorations. Her mother makes the items, while Eliana collects the seeds her mother needs to make the various objects. She hopes to someday sell these handicrafts in faraway places, to bring them to more commercial cities to sell in bulk so that she can help her family, especially her mother, who is the most important person in her life. She is requesting this loan with these two objectives in mind, and with the hope of making her business the best work option available to her. She hopes that you will help her achieve her goals for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more supplies for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
Floride M. sends you greetings from Byumba in the northern region of Rwanda! Floride is 36 years old, married with 3 children. Floride has owned a small shop since 2006. She sells clothes, shoes, etc.

Besides the shop, Floride owns a cow farm and earns about US$ 110 per month by selling dairy products. She is requesting a loan worth 200,000 Frws to expand her business. The loan term is 8 months.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Gaagay Group

texts.fr: Palmarin  (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php) étant une zone d’élevage extensif et vu l’abondance du tapis herbacé et l’abondance de plants fourragères, le Gie Gaagay s’est fixé comme objectif de revaloriser la race bovine et ovine. Le prêt acquis, ils vont acheter des animaux à bas prix, les engraisser  et les revendre surtout aux moments de fêtes de Tabaski (Aîd El kabir). Après cette période de fête, et comme ce sera la saison sèche, ils vont créer des réserves fourragères pour vendre du foin aux populations environnantes
texts.en:
Palmarin (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php) is an area of extensive livestock raising and in view of the abundance of grasslands and plants that serve as fodder, the Gaagay group has decided to have excellence in cattle and sheep raising as its aim.

Assuming the loan request is granted, they will buy animals at a low price, fatten them, and then re-sell them at the period of feast days (Tabaski or Aîd el Kabir: the Muslim feast of the sacrifice). After the feast days this year, it will be the dry season, so they are going to create reserves of fodder so as to sell hay to the neighboring people.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fattening livestock for sale

loans.name: Ebun

texts.en: Ebun is 59 years old and married with three children. Ebun sells charcoal and kerosene; pictured behind her is the tank for kerosene and the store is where she keeps her bags of charcoal. She has been in this business since 1995. She is seeking a loan of 1200 USD to purchase more kerosine for sale. She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support and Lapo microfinance for their business training.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Greetings from Charlotte in Byumba, in the north of Rwanda! Charlotte is 29 years old, married with 3 children and 1 adopted orphan.

She owns a shop where she sells various clothes for women and children in a nearby market. She has been in this business for three years. She earns about US$ 45 per month. She employs one person to help her in her business.

Charlotte is requesting a loan worth 150,000 Frws to buy more items for her clothes shop for the Christmas season. The loan term is 6 months.

loans.use: To buy more items for her clothes shop for the Christmas season

loans.name: Bolajoko

texts.en: Bolajoko is 65 years old and married to Mr. G.; together they have four children. They also have two of their grandchildren living with them. Bolajoko runs a cybercafé. She has been in this business for a long time and loves it. Bolajoko is seeking a loan of 1200 USD to purchase more computer accessories for the cybercafé. She says thank you!

loans.use: To buy computer accessories for a cybercafé

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel O. is 50 years old and he is married with six children. He sells spare motor parts. He travels to Onitsha main market to purchase the parts which he then sells in Benin city. He also has a bus that he uses for commercial purposes. He is seeking a loan of 425 USD to buy more spare parts to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Vegetable Garden and Nursery Bed  for Children

loans.name: Shu

texts.en:
Shu M. B. is married to Wanchia Walters; together they have six children. She is a very hard-working woman. 

M.'s husband married another woman and can no longer take responsibility for the children. In order to take care of herself and her children, M. joined GHAPE, where she learned the business and management techniques that helped her borrow and repay her first loan with ease.

M. provides her community with a variety of flowers for decoration. She will use this loan to buy seeds, a watering can and spade, polythene bags and other supplies. She has confidence in her in her business because she has been doing well for a long time and customers are always needing flowers to beautify their homes and communities.

loans.use: Buy flower tending supplies

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Greetings from Francois in Kigali, Rwanda! Francois is 35 years old, married with 4 children.  Francois owns a small pub  where he sells local beer and soft drinks  to the people in his area, especially taxi drivers and other motorists.

Francois started his business in 2003 with around US$ 400 as working capital but has now grown to US$ 800 as his capital in 2008. He earns about US$ 143 from other sources of income. He employs 6 people to help him run the business. 

Francois is looking for a loan worth 519,175 frws to increase his working capital. The loan repayment term is 8 months.

loans.use: To increase his working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Carpentry work

loans.name: Osarieme

texts.en: Osarieme E. is 48 years old, and she is married with five children. Osarieme sells palm oil, foodstuffs and "pure" drinking water. The demand for her pure water is high, and she wants to retain her customers, so she is seeking a loan of 700 USD to buy a deep freezer. She says that the deep freezer will enable her to keep her pure water cold and therefore meet the demands of her customers. In the picture, she is standing in the middle between her two daughters. She says a big thank you to all that made this loan possible!

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer for pure water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy Yams and ressell them in Lome , Capital City of Togo

loans.name: Ndifon

texts.en:
S. is 45 years old and married to Joseph Nfona. 

She sells Koki pudding, which is made up of ground beans mixed with red oil and salt; this is eaten with boiled plantains, coco yams, potatoes, and cassava. This is a very delicious meal that many inhabitants in the community love eating. Palm wine is a drink gotten from Palms and is white in colour. It is usually called "White mimbo".

S.'s life has been especially difficult because her child has been ill and she hasn't been able to take her to the hospital because S. hasn't been able to pay the fees. Faced with this illness, S. joined GHAPE in order to improve her living standards. She is a hard-working woman who has acquired many business and management techniques from GHAPE.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy second hand clothes and resell them to students and in rural areas

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Greetings from Emmanuel in Byumba, Rwanda! Emmanuel is 26 years old, married with 2 children.

Emmanuel has worked very hard in his restaurant and has grown from a working capital of US$ 1150 to US$ 1400 over the last three years. Emmanuel sells various foodstuffs in his restaurant such as rice, potatoes, cassava flour bread, maize flour bread, fish, beef, etc.

He is looking for a loan worth 519,175 Frws to buy more foodstuffs for his restaurant and more equipment such as plates, spoons, etc. to expand his business. The loan repayment period is 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for his restaurant and more equipment

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret S. Forbah s 55 years of age and married to Nsoh F.. She has faced many difficulties, including the death of her husband and having to undergo an operation.

She has joined GHAPE to improve her living standards; she has taken numerous loans from GHAPE and repaid them without any difficulties. The management and business knowledge she has received from GHAPE has really changed her business, which she is now looking to expand.

Margaret's business is in pigs, from which she provides the community with meat and manure. From the manure she is able to sell some and use some for the cultivation of vegetables. Pork is in high demand, especially for big ceremonies like Cry Die.

loans.use: To buy piglets and seeds

loans.name: Ngwafu

texts.en:
G. is married and has four children with Nche Nji Michael. 

G. dropped out of school early because her parents were unable to continue her education. She was then pushed   to marry early in order to care for herself. As a child with her parents G. practiced a lot of farm work. Now in her husband's house she continues to use the skills of hard work and farming practices, and is able to support and cater to the needs of her family. Her yield from her activity is always good and she always has a ready market. She provides a lot of corn and beans to the community; people buy from her and go to resell at long distances.

Since joining GHAPE in 2006, G. has been able to take and repay two loans. This will be her third loan, which she will use for farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides and beans.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La señora Felicidad, se dedica a la distribución de medicamentos en zonas alejadas de la ciudad de El Alto, en su mayoría son zonas perihurbanas y rurales de la ciudad de El  Alto, Bolivia. Labor que realiza junto a su hija quien estudió la carrera de enfermeria. Ambas realizan esta labor con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo, generando un pobre ingreso económico, por lo cual trabajan los siete días de la semana, con mucho ahinco. Viven en una casa muy pobre, que apenas cuenta con los servicios básicos de saneamiento.
texts.en:
Señora Felicidad distributes medications in the outskirts of the city of El Alto, along with her daughter, who studied nursing. Most of the areas she works in are suburban and rural areas. Both she and her daughter work very hard, make a lot of sacrifices and earn very little, so they eagerly work seven days a week. They live in a very humble home, which only has a very basic drainage system.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medications

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
J. is 65 years old and has two wives and five children and must provide for their basic necessities and pay his children's school fees. He is a hard-working man and provides transportation to people on his motorcycle; he has been doing this for a long time and is able to manage his business.

J.'s motorcycle transit business helps the community because the roads are bad and people use the cycles occasionally for transportation from one area to another. 

J. joined GHAPE from the beginning and has developed a lot concerning both his business and management techniques. He has taken loans through GHAPE before and been successful in repaying them.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Sesselou Group

texts.fr: Comme l’écovillage de Palmarin (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php) est une zone côtière de grande production de Sel. Le groupement Sesselou, pour lutter contre l’oisiveté et aider les femmes à commercialiser le sel, a décidé de travailler dans le marché du sel d’où son exploitation et sa commercialisation.  Avec le prêt, ils vont exploiter le sel après l’avoir extrait. Ne disposant pas encore de machines à coudre pour ensacher le produit fini,  Ils vont acheter des ficelles, aiguilles, sacs, pour y mettre le sel et l’exporter vers d’autres contrées Joal, Djiffer et même vers  la Gambie.
texts.en:
Since the ecovillage Palmarin (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php) is located in a costal area which produces a great amount of salt, the Sesselou group decided to exploit an commercialize salt, to fight idleness, and help women with this business. With this loan, they will extract salt and exploit it. Lacking sewing machines to make bags to pack the product, they will buy strings, needles and sacks to pack salt and export it to other regions such as Joal, Djiffer, and even to Gambia.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To exploit and sell salt

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married to Nde Peter N. and is a mother of ten children, five of which are below the age of fifteen. With this heavy responsibility on her husband to provide for her children and those of her house cleaners, Margaret decided to become a GHAPE member in 2000 so she could obtain a loan and continue with her business, so as to raise money and assist her husband in paying school fees and providing food for her children.

Through GHAPE, Margaret was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline; since then she has shown commitment in investing and repaying her loans.

With this loan, Margaret plans to construct a fence for her pigs, buy piglets, pay for the cleaning and hoeing of her farm, and for the purchase of seedlings. She knows her business will succeed because the droppings from her piggery will be used as fertilizer in her farm.  

She also plans to raise money to invest in an additional line of business and buy food for her family.

loans.use: construction of fence, purchase of piglets and labor for farming

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean in Gisenyi, Rwanda! Jean is 49 years old, married with 8 children.

Jean sells tomatoes, onions, carrots, and green vegetables in the market. He employs 4 people to help him run the business. He is looking for a loan worth 409,875 Frws to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his crops. The loan repayment period is 8 months, to be repaid monthly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chemicals for his crops

loans.name: Mayra Judith

texts.es:
La señorita Mayra A. está tramitando una casa por medio de infonavit pero le está haciendo falta una diferencia para que le entrege la casa.

Ella vive con su mama la casa en donde viven se las tenían prestada pero hace unos meses se las pidieron; pero las rentas de casa están muy altas para ellas así que mejor decidieron utilizar su ahorro Infonavit y así mejor pagar su propio patrimonio de ellas dos.

Mayra trabaja en una compañía en el puesto de ventas esté es su ingreso familiar del de pende ella y su mama. Solicita un préstamo de $600.00 dlls para el enganche de su casa y así tener un patrimonio para su mama y ella.
texts.en:
Ms. Mayra Alfara is arranging a house through Infonavit but she lacks the difference to obtain a house. (Infonavit is a Mexican government program that provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.) She lives with her mother and the house in which they live in was lent to them but it has been several months since it was asked for, but rents on houses are really high for them so they decided to use their Infonavit savings and pay for their own property for the two of them. Mayra works in a company in the position of sales; this is the family income that she and her mother depend on. She asks for a loan of US $600 for the down payment of her house so she can have a property for her mother and herself.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Difference in a down payment to acquire a house through Infonavit.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Greetings from Jonas in Gisenyi, Rwanda! Jonas is 32 years old, married with 7 children.

Jonas sells fresh milk to people living in the town center. He employs 2 people to run the business. He is looking for a loan worth 300 575 Frws to buy materials and milk for his business. The loan repayment period is 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more materials and milk for his business

loans.name: Señor De Accha Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “SEÑOR DE ACCHA”, se fundo en el año 2000, actualmente se encuentra en el IV ciclo, esta conformada por  20 socias, de los cuales, 15 mujeres y 5 varones.
Es un banco comunal conformado por socias que viven en el distrito de Pisac,  ubicado en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas a 25 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
Las socias que conforman el banco comunal se dedican principalmente a la artesanía, por ser Pisac, un pueblo eminentemente de artesanos.
Las ferias dominicales de Pisac son un atractivo turístico, donde las socias desarrollan sus actividades de venta de artesanías. Entra las principales líneas podemos citar la bisutería, tejidos, cerámica.
Las socias valoran principalmente el acceso al crédito, la cultura del ahorro, como ejes principales del programa de bancos comunales.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Senor de Accha" was founded in 2000, is currently in the fourth cycle, and is made up of 20 members, 15 women and 5 men. It is a community bank made up of members who live in the district of Pisac, located in the Sacred Valley 25 minutes from the city of Cusco.The partners that make up the community bank are principally engaged in handicrafts because they are from Pisac, a town largely of artisans. Sunday fairs in Pisac are a tourist attraction, where members sell their handicrafts, including jewelry, textiles, ceramics. The partners value principally the access to credit and the culture of saving, as main axes of the program of community banks.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The members of the community bank use their credit for artesanal activities

payments.comment: correction due to overpayment for business 68396

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Greetings from Alphonse in Gisenyi, Rwanda! He is 25 years old and single but cares for an adopted child.

Alphonse has been in the phone repair business for a number of years. He repairs mobile phones for the local people in his town. Many local people have mobile phones for their business activities. 

Alphonse is requesting a loan worth 300,575 Frws to buy materials like batteries and chargers for his business.The loan repayment period is eight months.

loans.use: To buy more materials for his business.

loans.name: Afi Enyonam

texts.fr:
Mariée à un mécanographe, Madame  M. Afi Enyonam est née le 21 juin 1974 Mission Tové dans la préfecture de Yoto. Elle a un enfant et a pour activité la vente des produits cosmétiques et de bijoux. Elle s’est installée à Lomé depuis 2004 et vend de quartier en quartier. Son stock est composé de parfums, de lait, de savons et de bijoux. 
Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et s’est bien comporté dans le remboursement.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire son stock par l’achat de 10 cartons de pommades, 8 cartons de parfums et 35 bijoux afin de pouvoir bien servir ses clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afi Enyonam M. was born on June 21, 1974 in Mission Tové in the prefecture of Yoto. She's married, has one child, and sells cosmetics and jewelry. She settled in Lomé in 2004 and sells from neighborhood to neighborhood. Her stock is composed of perfumes, beauty milks, soaps and jewelry. She already benefited from a loan that she repaid without problems. She's now seeking this second loan to resupply her stock in order to better meet customer demand. She intends to buy 10 boxes of ointment, 8 boxes of perfume, and 35 pieces of jewelry.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell cosmetics

loans.name: Lisset Antonia

texts.es: Lisett tiene 26 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe de la ciudad de Managua, un lugar rural caracterizado por su producción de piñas y pitahayas. Lisett es casada, su esposo es obrero y trabaja en una fábrica, y junto a ella unen esfuerzos para sacar a su pequeña familia adelante, ellos todavía son un matrimonio sin hijos. Lisset se dedica a la venta de comida, ofrece en su vivienda sopa y nacatamales los fines de semana,  inició desde muy joven esta labor, tiene 5 años de tener el negocio, cuya experiencia fue adquirida de su mamá. En estos momentos ellos planean invertir en la mejora de su hogar con el préstamo solicitado compraran materiales de construcción para terminar de construir la sala de estar de su vivienda, y así poder tener una vivienda digna que ofrecerle a sus hijos, para cuando éstos vengan al mundo.
texts.en:
Lisett is 26 years old, lives in the Ticuantepe municipality of Managua, a rural place known for its production of pineapples and dragon fruit. Lisett is married, her husband is a laborer and works in a factory, and along with his wife they work to help their small family get ahead, as they do not yet have children. Lisett sells food from her home on the weekends, such as soup and “nactamales” (a type of tamale made of smashed corn and potatoes wrapped in a banana leaf along with some pork meat, little fresh tomato and some garlic & salt.). She began selling food at a young age, and has been in business for 5 years, acquiring her experience from her mother. Today she plans to invest in improving her home with the loan, she will buy construction materials to build a living room in her home and in this way have a worthy home to offer to her children when they come into this world.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the living room of her home.

loans.name: Margueritte

texts.en:
Greetings from Marguerite in Kigali, Rwanda! Marguerite is 37 years old, married with two children and one adopted orphan.

Marguerite owns a small shop. She sells clothes and food stuffs, as well as needed household items like soap and candles. She employs one person to help her run the business.

She is applying for a loan worth 519,175 Frws to increase her inventory. This loan will be repaid in eight months.

loans.use: To Increase her inventory.

loans.name: Adjovi Délali

texts.fr:
Dame A. Adjovi Délali est née le 04 décembre 1972 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Depuis plus de 8 ans, elle a pour activité commerciale, la vente du charbon de bois et du fagot de bois. Elle s’approvisionne dans un village situé à 80 Km de Lomé. Les frais de transport de marchandises étant trop élevés, elle a toujours de rupture de stock et n’arrive pas à bien satisfaire ses clients.
Pour éviter d’aller s’approvisionner de temps en temps et pour réduire les frais de transport, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 45 sacs de charbon de bois. Ainsi cet important stock lui permettra de servir les clients pour au moins 2 mois et dame A. Adjovi Délali pourra bénéficier des frais de transport qu’elle aurait dû payer au transporteur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjovi Délali A. was born on December 4, 1972 in Lomé. She's married and the mother of two children. For 8 years, she's been selling charcoal and bundles of firewood. She gets her supplies in a village located 80 km from Lomé. Due to high transportation costs, she's always out of stock and cannot meet customer demand. To avoid having to go and get her supply on a regular basis, and to lower the transportation costs, she's seeking this first loan to buy 45 sacks of charcoal. This large stock will enable her to meet customer demand during at least two months, and Mrs. Adjovi Délali A. will be able to keep the money she would have had to pay for transport.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell charcoal

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Socorro

texts.es: Guadalupe V. tiene 48 años de edad, habitan en el barrio Laureles Sur de la ciudad de Managua. Es soltera y tiene 4 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Ha tenido que luchar mucho en la vida para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya que no ha tenido el apoyo del papá de sus hijos. Guadalupe es comerciante se dedica a la venta de medicamentos y también de cosméticos. Ella compra el producto en Managua y después viaja fuera de la ciudad para distribuir los medicamentos y cosméticos. Requiere del préstamo para la compra de medicamentos ya que hará un viaje a Bluefields y pretende invertir más para así poder generar más ganancias y captar mayor número de clientes.
texts.en:
Guadalupe V. is 48 years old and lives in the southern borough of Laureles Sur in the city of Managua. She's single and has 4 children that still depend on her. She's had to fight against a lot to raise her kids, as she hasn't had any support from their father. Guadalupe is a business woman who sells pharmaceuticals and cosmetics. She buys product in Managua and travels outside the city to distribute the pharmaceuticals and cosmetics. She is applying for the loan to buy pharmaceuticals as she's planning a trip to Bluefields and will also invest the rest to be able to generate more income and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase pharmaceutical inventory

loans.name: Koami

texts.fr:
Monsieur B. Koami est né le 19 décembre 1985 à Togblékopé, localité située à 19Km de Lomé. Il est marié et a pour activité, la vente des matériels électriques. Il a commencé cette activité depuis qu’il a quitté les bacs d’école et y tire de revenu pour satisfaire ses besoins et celui de sa femme.
Pour faire face à la demande des clients et pour mieux les satisfaire, il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter quelques matériels manquants dans son magasin « ETS ESPRIT SAINT ».
Avec ce crédit il fera l’achat de 100 Ampoules néon et 100 réglettes.
texts.en:
Mr. Koami B. was born on December 19, 1985 in Togblékopé, which is located 19 km from Lomé. He is married and his business is selling electrical supplies. He began this business right after he finished high school and gets enough income from it for himself and his wife.

To meet customer demand and better satisfy his clientele, he is asking for this first loan to buy some supplies that he doesn't have in his shop he calls "Holy Spirit Inc.". With this loan he will buy 100 fluorescent light bulbs and 100 switches.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of electrical supplies

loans.name: Roukéya

texts.fr:
Née à Lomé en 1976, dame I. Roukéya est une femme dynamique mariée. Elle a trois enfants et a pour activité la vente de l’oignon au grand marché de Lomé. Elle a commencé ce commerce à l’âge de 19 avant d’être mariée.
Ayant pour objectif d’agrandir son activité et de bien servir ses clients, elle désire vendre en gros et en détail afin d’écouler ses marchandises.
A cet effet, après un prompt remboursement de son premier crédit, elle sollicite ce second pour acheter 14 sacs d’oignon. Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle pourra supporter les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Roukéya I. is a very energetic woman who was born in born in Lomé in 1976. She has three children, and her work involves selling onions at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She started this business at the age of 19 before getting married. Having the goal of expanding her work and serving her customers well, she would like to sell at the wholesale and retail levels in order to move her merchandise on the market. For this reason, after having promptly repaid her first loan, she is requesting this second one to buy 14 sacks of onions. With the income from her work, she will be able to cover the cost of schooling her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 14 sacks of onions

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco se dedica a la labor de la jardinería, oficio que realiza de forma ambulante en algunas casas del municipio de Tipitapa en donde éste habita, y también otras veces viaja a Managua en busca de trabajo. Francisco tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, el dinero ganado es para su sustento y ayuda a su familia. El préstamo será usado para comprar materiales de construcción y reparar ciertas partes de la vivienda de su familia que están en mal estado y ahora está siendo afectado por las lluvias.
texts.en:
Francisco is a gardener. He works for many houses in the Tipitapa municipality where he lives and other times he travels to Managua looking for work. Francisco is 35 years old, single and has no children. The money he makes is for his own sustenance and to help out his family. The loan will be used to buy construction materials and to fix those parts of his family's house that are in disrepair, as they have been affected by the heavy rainfalls.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair his house

loans.name: Têko

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Têko est né le 31 décembre 1984 à Lomé. Il est célibataire et a pour activité la vente des cartes de recharge. Avec un an d’expérience dans ce domaine, il compte y évoluer dedans. 
Son activité consiste à acheter auprès des compagnies téléphoniques nationales (Togocel, Togotélécom et Moov) afin de vendre à ceux qui ont ouvert les cabines téléphoniques au bord des routes.
Pour palier aux difficultés financières qu’il rencontre dans l’exercice de son activité, il sollicite ce premier crédit pour 6 cartons de cartes de recharge.
texts.en:
Mr. Têko A. was born on December 31, 1984 in Lomé. He's unmarried and his business consists in selling recharge phone cards. With one year of experience in this field, he wants to evolve in it. His business consists in buying cards from large national phone companies (Togocel, Togotélécom and Moov), and in reselling them to those who opened phone booths on the sides of the roads. To overcome the financial difficulties he encountered in his business, he's seeking this first loan to buy 6 boxes of recharge phone cards.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy recharge phone cards

loans.name: Laura Zefanias

texts.pt:
Laura Zefanias M. nasceu na província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 48 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 5 filhos, sendo a primeira com 25 anos de idade e ultima com 11 anos de idade. Apenas sustenta a sua família.

Laura não teve a oportunidade de ir a escola devido a guerra de libertação colonial e a sua família não tinha condições para pagar o internamento noutras zonas. Passou a sua juventude ate ao casamento, e pois esta foi a cidade de Maputo na companhia do seu marido em 1988 no bairro do Aeroporto B. Local onde mora até hoje e por ai o marido abandonou-a. Assim viu se obrigada a procurar alternativas para sustentar os seus filhos onde optou pelo negocio de venda de produtos da primeira necessidade.

Laura vive basicamente de negocio onde trabalha todos os dias das 6 as 18horas, destaca nos seus produtos o sal e repolho, onde o sal adquira por 140,00mt o saco de 50kg e vende por 250,00mt. Tem um rendimento diária de 400,00mt e poupa mensalmente 3000,00mt.

Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva nunca solicitou noutras instituições, e conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que já eram clientes. Constitui grande sonho para Laura ter mais uma banca para aumentar os seus rendimentos.
texts.en:
Laura Zefanias M. was born in the province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. She is 48 years old, divorced, and the mother of 5 children. The oldest is 25 years old, and the youngest is 11 years old. She only supports her family. Laura did not have the oppurtunity to go to school due to the war of colonial liberation, and her family did not have the conditions to pay for enrollment in other zones. She passed her youth until her marriage when she moved to the city of Maputo with her husbands' company in 1988 to the Airport District B where she lives today, and from there her husband abandoned her. As such she found herself obliged to search out alternatives to support her children and she decided to sell products of primary necessity. Laura lives basically through the business where she works every day from 6:00am to 6:00pm. Her stand out products are salt and cabbage. She acquires the salt for 140MT per 50kg sack, and she sells it for 250MT. She has a daily income of 400MT and saves 3,000MT monthly. This is her first loan through Hluvuku and Kiva, and she never solicited other institutions. She came to know Hluvuku through some friends who were already clients. Her big dream is to have one more stand to increase her profits.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food products for resale

loans.name: Heber Franz

texts.es:
Heber R. C. vive en casa de sus padres con su esposa, la señora Martha Huallpa en la zona de llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz junto con sus dos hijos.
Heber trabaja en una empresa de instalación de gas natural y su esposa es profesora de una unidad educativa de la zona en la que viven.
La pareja adquirió un lote de terreno que aun se encuentra sin construcción.
El crédito solicitado será destinado para construir dos habitaciones, de principio a fin (obra gruesa y fina), con lo cuál iniciarán el proceso de edificación de su futura casa
Esta es la primera vez que Heber solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado le califica favorablemente, por lo tanto, puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Heber R. C. lives with his wife, Martha Huallpa, in the Llojeta area of the city of La Paz and his two sons. Herber works at a natural gas installation company and his wife is a professor at the education centre in the region where they live. The couple acquired a lot that still hasn't been developed. The loan applied for will be destined for the contruction of two rooms, from beginning to end, and by doing so, initiating the edification of their future house. This is the first time Hereber applies for a loan. His credit record is very favourable and, thus, he is able to apply for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CONSTRUCCIÓN

loans.name: Koudjo Mazamasso

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Koudjo Mazamasso est né en 1970 à Bago, Localité située à 220Km au de Lomé. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Depuis 2003 il a ouvert un centre informatique à Agoè où il faisait le traitement de texte, les photocopies et la vente des produits congelés.
Avec cette petite activité, il arrive à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
Après un prompt remboursement de son premier crédit qui lui a permis d’acquérir le congélateur, il sollicite ce second prêt pour acheter 3 cartons de produits congelés et deux boîtes de cartouche d’encre.
texts.en:
Mr. Koudjo Mazamasso A. was born in 1970 in Bago, which is located 220 km from Lomé. He is married and the father of one child. In 2003 he opened a computer center in Agoè where he does printing, makes photocopies, and sells frozen foods.

With this business, he manages to support his family.

After a prompt repayment of his first loan, which allowed him to buy a freezer, he is now requesting a second loan to purchase 3 cartons of frozen foods and two boxes of ink cartridges.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 3 cartons of frozen foods and 2 boxes of ink cartridges

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena C. D. M. tiene domicilio propio en la zona Las Delicias, su esposo es el señor Emilio M., la pareja tiene dos hijos.
El matrimonio atienD. una pensión (restaurante donD. los clientes que lo deseen pueden comprar una especie D. membresía y almorzar durante un período D. tiempo determinado) en la que sirven almuerzos. Los  ingresos D. este negocio les permitieron comprar su vivienda y construir dos plantas D. estructuras D. su vivienda.
El crédito solicitado será destinado a la conclusión D. la obra fina en dos habitaciones.
Esta es la quinta vez que Elena solicita préstamo, el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y pueD. acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Elena C. D. M. has her own home in the Las Delicias zone. Her husband is named Emilio, and the pair has two children.

The couple tends to a pension (a restaurant where customers can purchase a type of membership and eat lunch there for a determined period of time) where they serve lunch. The income from this business allowed them to buy their house, as well as to build two additions to it.

The loan sought would be destined to complete the detail work on two bedrooms.

This is the fifth time that Elena solicits a loan, and the financial analysis conducted indicates that she qualifies favorably for access to credit.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction.

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MARIA ANDREA TRABAJA COMO ASISTENTE EDUCATIVA DE UN PRESTIGIOSO COLEGIO Y SU ESPOSO EL SEÑOR JOSE DE JESUS LABORA TAMBIEN PARA UN COLEGIO COMO PROFESOR DE EDUCACION ARTISTICA JUNTOS ESTAN SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PORQUE LE QUIEREN COLOCAR PROTECCIONES EN PUERTAS Y VENTANAS A SU CASA YA QUE TIENEN UNA BEBITA DE TAN SOLO 2 AÑITOS Y POR MEDIO DE ESTE PRESTAMO SE SENTIRAN CON MAS SEGURIDAD, “SU META DE VIDA ES TENER UN MEJOR MODO DE VIDA”.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Andrea works as an education assistant at a prestigious college and her husband is Mr. Jose de Jesus. He also works for a college as a professor of art and together they are asking for a loan because they want to put protection on the doors and windows of their house because they have a small baby that is only two years old and through this loan they will feel more secure. Their goal in life is to have a better way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put protection on the doors and windows

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To replenish her small grocery store

loans.name: Victor Noe

texts.es:
VICTOR NOE S. P. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit.  Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.


EL SEÑOR VICTOR TRABAJA COMO VIGILANTE DE UN HOSPITAL DONDE LO ADMIRAN POR LAS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE QUE DEMUESTRA, ES UNA PERSONA QUE VINO BUSCANDO UNA SOLUCION ECONOMICA Y CON LA FUERZA DE VOLUNTAD QUE POSEE LO HA LOGRADO. EL ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA AMPLIAR SU HOGAR MEDIANTE LA CONSTRUCCION DE UN CUARTO EN LA PARTE TRASERA Y ASI LOGRANDO UNA MAYOR COMODIDAD PARA SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Victor Noe S. P. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home. Mr. Victor Noe S. P. works as a guard in the hospital where he is admired for his desire to succeed. He is a person that came looking for an economic solution and with his personal will he has achieved it. He is asking for this loan to expand his home through the construction of a room in the back part of his house and achieve greater comfort for his family

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room in the back part of his house

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR MIGUEL ANGEL TRABAJA COMO MESERO DE UN FAMOSO 
RESTAURANT SU ESPOSA TRABAJA DE LIMPIEZA EN UN SALON DE EVENTOS, EL Y SU ESPOSA TIENEN DOS HIJOS MENORES PARA LOS CUALES BUSCAN SU PROTECCION ESTAN SOLICITANDO  ESTE PRESTAMO PARA CONSTRUIR UNA BARDA EN SU CASA Y BRINDARLES A SU FAMILIA UN MEJOR MODO DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel works as a waiter at a well-known restaurant. His wife is part of the cleaning staff at a conference hall. Together they have two young children. To help protect their children and improve their family's quality of life, they are requesting a loan to pay for the construction of a fence around their house.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construccion de una barda

loans.name: Galo

texts.en:
Galo S., 37 years old, is married with four children.  She has three years of experience in the baking, ice cake business. She sells to the village people three days per week. In addition, she has had four previous loans with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about 166 USD). SPBD loans are Galo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She is looking to buy ingredients for her business. In addition, her husband and children help out.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients used in her ice cake business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To add beef and pork to her inventory

loans.name: Anevili

texts.en:
Anevili S., 45 years old, is married with one child.  She has many years of experience in the taro/banana business. She sells to the village people about three days per week. She already has had one previous loan with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately 166 USD).  SPBD loans are Anevili's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She hopes to buy additional equipment required to be used in her business. Her husband and child also helps out.

loans.use: To buy equipment necessary for banana / taro sales

loans.name: Molimaufou

texts.en:
