Molimaufou F. is 42 years old and is married with five children.  She has many year of experience working in the handicraft business. She sells to the Flea market at Savalalo about five days per week.  She has had three previous loans with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (approximately 125 USD). SPBD loans are Molimaufou's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her business provides financial support for her kids to attend school. In addition, they also are devoted members to the church, Her whole family is so committed to this business. Molimau wants to export some of her handicrafts overseas if her business is successful.

loans.use: To purchase a carving board, materials, new rip saw, chain saw, samoan bags, kava bowls, fine mats, samoa earrings and elei materials etc.

loans.name: Saienesi

texts.en:
Saienesi S., 50 years old, is married with six children.  She has many years of experience producing and selling taro and bananas. She sells to the villagers and public three days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (about 187 USD). SPBD loans are Saienesi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.  She hopes that this loan with assist her in buying materials for her business needs. Her husband is also fully engaged with the business.

loans.use: To purchase taro tubers, weed killer, pesticides, chemicals and a shovel

loans.name: Lilliam Haydee

texts.es: Lilliam Haydee  T. tiene la edad de 33 años, habita en el barrio Los Meléndez, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe. Esta señora habita con su esposo Manuel Rivera Vilchez, este señor le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, se desempeña como personal encargado de servicio al cliente en una empresa de Managua; ellos tienen a cargo a dos hijos que estudian actualmente en primaria , los sueños de doña Lilliam es darle una condición de vida mejor a sus pequeños ya que ha pasado muchas dificultades para poder logra lo que hoy en día tienen , esta señora es comerciante tiene una pulpería  ubicada en su casa , y solicita el apoyo del crédito para aumentar su inventario ya que quiere lograr tener una miscelánea en el futuro
texts.en:
Lilliam Haydee T. is 33 years old and lives in the Los Meléndez neighborhood of Ticuantepe city. She lives with her husband Manuel Rivera Vilchez, and he helps her with the household expenses. She works as a personal courier for a business in Managua. They have two children who are in primary school. Lilliam dreams of providing a better standard of living to her little ones as they have overcome many difficulties to be able to have what they have today. This woman has a small grocery store located in her home, and she is asking for a loan to increase her inventory as she wants to have a general store in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cleaning and personal use products

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en:
Imeleta T., 40 years old, is married with five children. She has five years of experience in the elei printing and design business. She sells to companies in town and within the village community about five days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD as well. 

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (approximately 145 USD). SPBD loans are Imeleta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She hopes to use this loan to help her in buying items for her business needs. Her whole family supports this business.

loans.use: To buy paints in different colours, materials for printing, brushes for painting, broom and roll to print out design elei board.

loans.name: Gelgi

texts.es: Doña Gelgi tiene 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Campo Bruce de la ciudad de Managua, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos, dos varones y una mujer. Doña Gelgi es costurera, tiene 9 años de experiencia en esta actividad lo que le ha servido para que actualmente cuente con más clientela con la que empezó. El uso del préstamo será para la compra de telas para elaborar manteles, colchas, sábanas, etc. Debido a la gran dedicación a su trabajo actualmente tiene más clientes y una demanda de servicios más grandes, y no desea dejar por fuera algunos clientes por no contar con suficiente capital.
texts.en:
Ms. Gelgi V. is 42 years of age and lives in the Campo Bruce neighborhood of the city of Managua. She is single and has 3 children—two sons and a daughter. Ms. Gelgi is a seamstress with 9 years of experience in this field, which has helped her gain more customers now than when she started out. The loan will be used to purchase fabric to make tablecloths, bedspreads, bed sheets, etc. Due to her dedication to her work, she currently has more customers who demand even more services, and she does not want to leave out any of her customers for lack of capital.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Doña Gloria Maria es una pequeña comerciante que cuenta con una pulpería en su casa de habitación ubicada en el barrio 14 de Febrero de la ciudad de Managua. Es casada, y con cuenta con el apoyo de su marido para sacar adelante a su familia, tiene 4 hijos, dos varones y dos mujeres. El crédito solicitado es para reforzar el inventario de su pulpería ya que actualmente cuenta con poco inventario y quiere mantener la oferta, para así no perder a sus clientes. Su sueño como madre es poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, para que ellos puedan tener una mejor vida, y puedan ser hombres útiles a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Maria is a small business woman who runs a local store at her place of residence. Her home is located in the neighborhood 14 of February in the city of Managua. She is married is helped by her husband to get her family ahead. She has 4 children; 2 boys and 2 girls. The requested loan is to reinforce the inventory in her store, since she is low in supplies right now and she would like to keep her sales up so she does not lose her clients. Her dream as a mother is to help her children succeed so that they can have a better life and can be productive members of society.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona F. is 55 years old and is married with seven children. She has four years of experience in the retail shop business. She sells to the publc and villagers seven days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about 208 USD).  SPBD loans are Lona's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Lona indicates that even though there are many shops in her village, she wishes to attract more customers than others because she believes she offers the best customer service to her clients. Lona also wants to expand her shop. For these reasons, she wants to buy cement and other materials for business expansion as well as buy stock for her business.

loans.use: Purchase snacks e.g bongos,twities,chips lollies pubble gums, mutton flaps ,box of chicken,noodles, rice, sugar, flour, salt ,herrings,Cement,iron roofing ,timber,weelbarrow.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena M. is 44 years old and is married with three children. She has three years of experience producing and selling taro and bananas. She sells to the village people and general public three days per week. She has had four previous loans with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (approximately 187 USD). SPBD loans are Filomena's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She hopes to use this loan to continue to send her kids to school and church. Her husband is also fully engaged with the business.

loans.use: To buy taro tubers, weed killer, pesticides, chemicals, a shovel and barbed wire.

loans.name: Inosia

texts.en: Inosia M., 35, is married with 5 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the sewing business has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Inosia's only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Inosia would like a loan to purchase thread, lavalava materials, a sewing machine, and needles.  This capital will help her support her kids at school and keep her church commitments.

loans.use: To purchase thread, lavalava materials, a sewing machine, and needles

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona F., 28, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to families and at the public market 3 days per week.  She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Lona's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She would like a loan to purchase fertiziler, a spade, bushknifes, a sharpener, a weedkiller sprayer machine, a wheel barrow, taro tubers, and bananas.  This loan will help her support her kids at school and keep her church commitments.

loans.use: To purchase fertiziler, a spade, bushknifes, a sharpener, a weedkiller sprayer machine, a wheel barrow, taro tubers, and bananas.

loans.name: Luafulu

texts.en: Luafulu T., 49, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to relatives and to the village community 5 days a week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Luafulu's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Laufulu would like a loan to purchase fertilizer, a spade, bushknifes, a sharpener, a weedkiller sprayer machine, a wheel barrow, taro tubers, bananas and barbed fence.  This loan will help her support her kids at school and keep her church commitments.  She is fully committed to her business because this is the main source of income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, a spade, bushknifes, a sharpener, a weedkiller sprayer machine, a wheel barrow, taro tubers, bananas and barbed fence.

loans.name: Sigalu

texts.en: Sigalu I., 39, is married with 6 children.  She has 3 years of experience in handicrafts.  She sells at the flea market at Savalalo 6 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Sigalu's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Sigalu would like a loan to purchase kava bowls, fine mats, Samoan earrings, elei materials, siapo, table mats, and Samoan shirts. The loan will help her support her kids at school and keep her church commitments.  Sigalu has a back-up business tin farming but all she requests is a loan to buy is handicraft materials for her flea market business.

loans.use: To purchase kava bowls, fine mats, Samoan earrings, elei materials, siapo, table mats, and Samoan shirts.

loans.name: Tuvalu

texts.en: Tuvalu S., 38, is married with 7 children.  She has many years of experience in the food business. She sells to families and at the public market 5 days a week. She has had 7 previous loans with SPBD.  Tuvalu would like a loan to purchase a box of mutton flaps, chicken legs, sausages, potatoes, vegetables, fruit, a sack of sugar, rice, flour, salt, baking powder, a new stove, new Chinese pots and a teapot.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Tuvalu's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This loan will help her support her kids at school and keep her church commitments.

loans.use: To purchase a box of mutton flaps, chicken legs, sausages, potatoes, vegetables, fruit, a sack of sugar, rice, flour, salt, baking powder, a new stove, new Chinese pots and a teapot

loans.name: Taoa

texts.en: Taoa T., 50, is married with 1 child.  She has many years of experience in the food business. She sells to families and at the public market 2 days per week. She has had 5 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  Taoa would like a loan to purchase a box of mutton flaps, chicken legs, sausages, potatoes, vegetables, fruit, a sack of sugar, rice, flour, salt, baking powder, and a new stove.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Taoa's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Taoa wants to expand her business to a big restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To Taoa would like a loan to purchase a box of mutton flaps, chicken legs, sausages, potatoes, vegetables, fruit, a sack of sugar, rice, flour, salt, baking powder, and a new stove.

loans.name: Maulu

texts.en: Maulu T., 53, is married with 3 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the donuts and coconut bun business. She sells to village people 6 days per week. This is her first loan with SPBD.  She would like a loan to purchase ingredients used in her business.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Maulu's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients used in her business

loans.name: Otila

texts.en: Otila T., 68, is married with 9 children.  She has 4 years of experience in farming. She sells her produce at the public market 3 days per week. She has had 4 previous loans with SPBD.  She would like a loan to purchase fertilizer, bush knives, sharpeners, more taro tubers, cement, iron roofing, timber,a wheelbarrow and a shovel. Part of her loan will be used to repair her house.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Otila's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, bush knives, sharpeners, more taro tubers, cement, iron roofing, timber,a wheelbarrow and a shovel.

loans.name: Otila

texts.en: Otila T., 68, is married with 9 children.  She has 20 years of experience farming. She sells her produce to the public 3 days per week. She has had 4 previous loans with SPBD.  She would like a loan to purchase fertilizer, bush knives, sharpeners, more taro tubers, cement, iron roofing, timber,a wheelbarrow and a shovel.  Part of her loan will be use to repair her house.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Otila's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, bush knives, sharpeners, more taro tubers, cement, iron roofing, timber,a wheelbarrow and a shovel.

loans.name: Faapopo

texts.en: Faapopo A., 68, is married with 6 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the ice cake and farming business. She sells to the village 5 days per week. She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  Faapopo would like a loan to purchase sugar, cordial, plastic cups, cement, timber, nails, taro tubers, barbed wire, bush knives and fertilizer.   Part of her loan will be used to repair her house. Her husband helps to operate the business.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Faapopo's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cordial, plastic cups, cement, timber, nails, taro tubers, barbed wire, bush knives and fertilizer

loans.name: Gese

texts.en: Gese F., 43, is married with 7 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the produce business. She sells her produce in the village 2 days per week while her husband does all the farming.. This is her first loan with SPBD.  Gese would like a loan to purchase knives, weedkiller and pesticides.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).  SPBD loans are Gese's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase knives, weedkiller and pesticides

loans.name: Leiasina

texts.en: Leiasina S., 38, is married with 8 children.  She has 3 years of experience growing and selling stys (pigs) business with her husband. She sells to the public 6 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  Leiasina would like a loan to purchase a barbed wire fence, nails, and to pay for the labor to fix the fence.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Leiasina's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a barbed wire fence, nails, and to pay for the labor to fix the fence

loans.name: Thi Ly

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Lý 41 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1997, vòng vốn ban đầu gia đình chị vay 500.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, thấy rằng việc chăn nuôi hiệu quả các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị đã vay mức vốn cao dần, mô hình chăn nuôi được mở rộng chị đã đầu tư vốn chăn nuôi vịt đẻ, hiện tại gia đình chị đamg nuôi 500vịt đẻ chứng và hơn 1 nghìn cá giống các loại, thu nhập sau khi trừ chi phí bình quân 300.000đ/ ngày. Chị có 2 con hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân 9.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs N. Thi Ly, 41 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 1997. She borrowed the first loan of 500,000VND (about 31USD) to invest in rearing pigs. Realising the profits from raising livestock, she continued to obtain loans of increasing values and proceeded to breeding ducks. Currently, she has 500 breeding ducks and more than 1000 breeding fish of various types.Her average daily income after deducting living expenses is 300,000VND (about 18USD). She has 2 children who are still going to school. This time, she would like to borrow 10,000,000VND (550USD) to invest in raising livestock. Her average monthly income is 9,000,000VND (about 562USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Thi Hang

texts.vi:
Chị Hà Thị Hằng 44 tuổi, chị tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1997. Trải qua 11 năm vay vốn của Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị đã thay đổi rõ rệt, gia đình chị sống tại vùng nông thôn nên thu nhập chinh của gia đình chị là chông vào làm ruộng và làm vườn, Với diện tích vườn rộng nên chị đã đầu tư vốn vào chồng cây ăn quả. Hiện tai gia đình chị đang đầu tư vốnd vào chồng chuối tiêu, với 500 gốc chuối tiêu thu nhập hàng tháng bình quân 3.000.000đ. Chồng chị làm nghề xe ôm thu nhập bình quân hàng ngày 100.000đ. Chị có 4 con hiện đang đi học, kỳ thi đậi học vừa qua con trai đầu chị đã đỗ đại học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000 mua cây giống và phân bón.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. H. Thi Hang, 44 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 1997. After 11 years, her family's financial situation has improved significantly. Living in the rural area, her family mainly relies on farming for a living. Having a large garden, Mrs. Hang decided to invest in planting fruit trees. Currently, her family is investing in planting banana. They have 500 banana tress giving the average monthly income of 3,000,000VND (about 187USD). Mrs. Hang's husband is a motorbike taxi driver with the average daily income of 100,000VND (about 6USD). Mrs. Hang has 4 children who are still going to school. In the last college entrance examination, her eldest son got into college . This time, she would like to borrow 15,000,000VND (925USD) to purchase saplings and fertilisers. Her family's monthly income is 6,000,000VND (about 375USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying saplings and fertilisers

loans.name: Thi Xep

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Xếp 59 tuổi, chị tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1999. Trướcc khi trưa tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn do các con còn nhỏ, thiếu vốn để phát triển kinh tế. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã vay vốn đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi và chồng cây cảnh, kinh tế gia đình ngày càng phát triển. Chồng chị là cán bộ về hưu lương tháng ổn định 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Chị có 3 con các con chị đều đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và chồng cây cảnh.
Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.0000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. Thi Xep, 59 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 1999. Before joining the Fund, her family faced many financial problems because her children were still young and she lacked fund to do business. After joining the Fund, she obtained loans to invest in raising livestock and planting decorative plants, thus her family's financial situation has been improving. Her husband is a retired civil worker with the stable retirement benefit of 1,500,000VND (about 93USD) per month. She has 3 children. All of them are married,thus they do not live with her any more. This time, she would like to borrow 15,000,000VND (925USD) to invest in raising livestock and planting decorative plants. Her family's average monthly income is 4,000,000VND (about 250USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising livestock and planting decorative plants

loans.name: Thi Be

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Bé 41 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006. Sinh sống tại vùng nông thôn nên gia đình chị đã lựa chon chăn nuôi và chồng trọt để phát triển kinh tế. Các vòng vốn vay của Qũy gia đình chị đều đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi lợn và trồng cây ăn quả, hàng năm thu nhập từ chăn nuôi và trồng cây ăn quả của gia đình chị ước tính khoảng 60.000.000đ. Chồng chị chuyên đi làm gạch thuê thu nhập hàng tháng 1.500.000đ, chị có 2 con, 1 con nhỏ đang đi học, 1 con lớn đã đi làm lương tháng 1.200.000đ. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua giống cây và phân bón.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Be, 41 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2006. Living in the rural area so her family chose raising livestock and planting to improve the financial situation. All the loans obtained from the Fund are used to invest in livestock and fruit trees, which yield a yearly profit of approximately 60,000,000VND (about 3750USD). Her husband is a hired brick-maker with the monthly income of 1,500,000VND (about 93USD). She has 3 chilren. 2 of them are still going to school while one of them is already working with the mothly income of 1,200,000VND (about 75USD). This time, she would like to borrow 10,000,000VND (625USD) to buy saplings and fertilisers. Her family's average mothly income is 6,000,000VND (about 375USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying saplings and fertilisers

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đào Thi Dục 47 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2007. Các vòng vốn vay của gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào quán ăn. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000 tiếp tục đầu tư vào quán ăn và mở thêm dịch vụ giải khát. Nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị là kinh doanh hàng ăn, bình quân mỗi ngày gia đình chị thu nhập 200.000đ từ quán ăn, chị có 3 con, 2 con còn nhỏ đang đi học, con lớn đi làm lương tháng 1.500.000đ.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Đào Thi Dục - 47 years old - joined the TYM Fund in 2007. The family has used every loan to invest in their restaurant business. For this loan cycle, the family requests 9,000,000 VND to reinvest in their restaurant and into other commercial services business opportunities. The family's main source of income is the restaurant. The restaurant gives them an average daily income of 200,000 VND. Mrs. Đào has 3 children, 2 of which are still school-aged, whereas the eldest is employed with a monthly salary of 1,500,000 VND. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To reinvest in family restaurant business (food services).

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đoàn Thị Đông 47 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và chồng cây ăn quả. Hiện tai gia dình chị đang nuôi 10 con lợn thịt và chồng 200 cây cam, Bình quân môi năm gia đình chị thu nhập từ chăn nuôi và chồng trọt ước tính khoảng 40.000.000đ. Chồng chị là người chịu khó ngoài công việc gia đình anh thường đi làm thuê bình quân mỗi ngày 50.000đ, chị có 3 con, 2 con nhỏ hiện đang đi học, 1 con lớn đã có công việc làm ổn định lương 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn nay gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ mua con giống và phân bón trồng cây ăn quả.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Đoàn Thị Đông - 47 years old - joined the TYM Fund in 2006. She has used every TYM loan to invest in raising livestock and planting fruit-bearing trees. Today, her family has 10 pigs and 200 orange trees. Each year, on average, the family has an income of about 40,000,000 VND from raising livestock and planting rice. Her husband is a hardworker. In addition to the family businesses, he regularly works as a hired hand for an average of 50,000 VND per day. She has two children who are currently in school. One older child has steady employment with a salary of 1,500,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, her family wishes to borrow 15,000,000 VND to purchase more pigs and fertilizer for their fruit trees. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pigs.

loans.name: Thi Huong

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương 34 tuổi, Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đều đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi lợn và thêm vốn vào kinh doanh giết mổ lợn. Gia đình chị chăn nuôi với mô hình lớn bình quân mỗi lứa nuôi hơn 100 con lợn thịt, công việc kinh doanh của chồng chị phát triển rất thuận lợi bình quân mỗi ngày mổ 2 con lợn thu nhập khoảng 250.000đ/ ngày, chị có 2 con hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư mua lợn giồng và thức ăn chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Huong, 34 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2003. All the loans obtained from the Fund are used to invest in rearing pigs and butchering business. Her family rears pigs in a large scale, as each time she rears 100 pigs. Her husband's butchering business is also progressing smoothly. On average, they butcher 2 pigs everyday with the daily profit of 250,000VND (about 15.50USD). Mrs. Huong has 2 children who are still going to school. This time, she would like to borrow 10,000,000VND (625USD) to purchase breeding pigs and animal feed. Her family's average monthly income is 6,000,000VND (about 375USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pigs and animal feed

loans.name: Thi Ngan

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngạn 52 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2001, các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào kinh doanh buôn bán hàng tạp hóa. Hiện tại gia đình chị có 1 của hàng tạp hóa với nhiều mặt hàng phong phú. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư thêm vào mua các loại bia chai bán tại cửa hàng, ngoài thu nhập từ kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa chồng chị chuyên đi xây thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng, chị có 3 con, 2 con lớn đã đi làm thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng, 1 con đang đi học.
Thu nhập bình quân 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Ngan, 52 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2001. All the loans obtained from the Fund are used to invest in her general store. Currently, her family has a general store selling a wide range of goods. This time, she would like to borrow 15,000,000VND (925USD) to buy different types of beer bottles to sell. Besides the profit from the store, her family also has her husband's monthly income of 2,000,000VND (about 125USD) as he is a construction worker. Mrs. Ngan has 3 children. 2 of them are working with the mothly income of 2,000,000VND (about 125USD) while the last one is still going to school. Her family's average monthly income is 6,000,000VND (about 375USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beer bottles for general store

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Vũ Thị Phượng 41 tuổi tham gia Quỹ năm 1997. Các vòng vốn vay gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn vào mở cửa hàng tạp hóa, từ khi gia đình chị mở của hàng buôn bán kinh tế gia đình đã phát triển lên rõ rệt, mua sắm được nhiều tiện nghi trong gia đình. Chồng chị làm nghề xe ôm hàng ngày anh vân đi làm thu nhập binh quân 80.000đ/ ngày. Chị có 2 con hiện các con chị đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vốn vào kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Ms. Vu Thi P., 41 years of age, has been a part of this organization since 1997. All her previous loans was used to invest into her convenience store business. Since starting the business, her family income has rise and since been stable. She is able to afford and purchase more for her family. Ms. P. husband is a taxi-driver and makes approximately 80.000d/day. She has 2 small children who are school-aged. This next loan that she is requesting, 10.000.000vnd, she would like to use this amount to invest in buying more inventory for her business. Her average monthly income is 5.000.000vnd/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Asosoifua

texts.en: Asosoifua S., 53, is married with 5 children.  Her husband is an engineer, and his work is the other source of income for the family.She has 4 years of experience in the sewing business. She works 5 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  Asosoifua would like a loan to buy material rolls,a sewing machine, thread and needles.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Asosoifua's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy material rolls,a sewing machine, thread and needles

loans.name: Ryanna

texts.en: Ryanna A., 31, is married with 3 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the taxi business and her husband drives a taxi too. Her taxi serves the public 6 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  Ryanna would like a loan to purchase new wheels, new parking lights, a seat cover, a renewal of her taxi license. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Ryanna's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase new wheels, new parking lights, a seat cover, a renewal of her taxi license

loans.name: Khalimahon

texts.en:
Khalimahon M. lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, and she is a schoolteacher by professional background. She is married, and she has one child. She first applied to MicroInvest for a loan earlier in 2008, when she heard about MicroInvest and the way in which its loans are disbursed. Thanks to the previous loan she secured and successfully repaid, she was able to improve her family's living conditions.

Unfortunately, it is difficult to get by on a schoolteacher's salary alone, so Khalimahon is also engaged in the livestock business. Indeed, she has a good flock of animals, and she takes care of her animals so that she can sell milk products from such animals at the local bazaar on weekends. In fact, she has been involved in the livestock business for 10 years, and over that span she has acquired important business skills.

At present, Khalimahon wants to buy a pedigree bull, but she does have enough money to do so. Therefore, she is applying for a business development loan through Kiva in the amount of 3,600 STJ ($1,075) over 3 months. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her livestock business by purchasing a pedigree bull

loans.name: Lusi

texts.en:
Lusi T., 40, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the village and the public 2 days per week. She has 3 previous loan(s) with SPBD.

Lusi expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). SPBD loans are Lusi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to buy farming equipments like bush knives, weed killer, chemicals and fertilizers. Her husband is helping her in running the business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, chemicals, knives and weed killer

loans.name: Faafouina

texts.en:
Faafouina T., 24, is married with two children. She has many years of experience in the foodstall business. She sells to the village and public six days per week. 

She has tow previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Faafouina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. 

The loan will be used to buy goods for the store such as snack food, canned food and freezers. Her husband is helping her run the business.

loans.use: To buy goods for the shop and a freezer

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.en:
Gulandom N., who was born in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, is married and has one child. She is the economist in the Spitamen Khukumat, but she is also engaged in the livestock business to generate income for her family's well-being. In fact, she has been involved in the livestock business for her entire life because she helped her mother take care of home animals from an early age.

Specifically, she purchases and sells livestock for a living, and she has acquired invaluable business skills in operating such an enterprise. Currently, she is applying for a business development loan through Kiva in the amount of 2,100 STJ ($625) over 4 months to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her livestock business

loans.name: Siliga

texts.en: Siliga I., 23, is married with 4 children. She has 2 years of experience in the Elei business. She sells to the public and village people 6 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Siliga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be use to repair her house. Her husband also works to help out with the financial support.

loans.use: Buy printing board, stencials, paints, brushes, rollers also material, bricks, cement, iron roofing and timber for home improvements

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Earlier this year and with the aid of MicroInvest, Zuhro N. secured a business development loan, the proceeds of which she used to shore up her business as she was in need of capital. She proudly states that she has over 12 years of experience in the livestock industry.

On account of the proceeds from the prior loan, she was able to improve her existing livestock business and to start another business whereby she grows rice and wheat. Currently, she is seeking another business development loan through KIVA in the amount of 3,600 STJ ($1,075) over 4 months to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: To expand and improve her livestock business by purchasing another pedigree bull

loans.name: Toeae

texts.en:
Toeae V., 42, is married with 7 children. She has many years of experience in the plantation/pancakes business. She sells to the village people and public 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~83 USD).

SPBD loans are Toeae's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The whole amount of this loan will be used to maintain her businesses.

loans.use: Purchase flour, oil, deep frying pan and gas cooker; also pesticides, gromozone chemicals, backpacker spray and wire fence

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en: Miriama T., 48, is married with 7 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public 2 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Miriama's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to repair her house. She does all the farming.

loans.use: Purchase weedkiller, gromozone, pesticide, bricks, cement, timber etc.

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.en:
Mashhura N., who lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, is a schoolteacher by professional background. In addition, she is married and has 3 children. She first applied for a loan from MicroInvest earlier this year, when she heard about MicroInvest and the process by which loans are disbursed. Fortunately, the prior loan enabled her to improve her and her family's living conditions because it is difficult to support the family merely with the salary she receives from being a schoolteacher.

Accordingly, Masshura is also engaged in a material-selling business and the livestock industry. To illustrate, she proudly states that she has 2 milk cows and a pedigree bull, along with several sheep and rams. Moreover, she notes that she has been involved in the livestock industry for 8 years and, as a result, she has acquired invaluable business skills. With respect to her material-selling business, Mashhura has a wide assortment of goods for sale, all of which she has purchased directly from suppliers, and she explains that she has many loyal customers.

Currently, she is applying for a business development loan through KIVA in the amount of 2,100 STJ ($625) over 4 months to further diversify her product line by importing new materials. She thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her businesses by purchasing additional materials

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor S., who lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, is married and has 3 children. Despite the fact that she never received a quality education, she has worked hard over the years and has therefore acquired invaluable business skills in the process.

Gulbahor operates her own business whereby she trades materials at the local bazaar. Further, she states that she purchases her materials directly from suppliers, and she proudly notes that she has earned a good reputation as an honest trader. In addition, she explains that she has many loyal/repeat customers, as well as a wide assortment of materials for sale. At present, Gulbahor is seeking a business development loan through KIVA in the amount of 2,800 STJ ($825) over 4 months to expand her product line by importing new materials.

loans.use: To further diversify her expanding business' product line by importing additional materials

loans.name: Khoshimboy

texts.en:
Khoshimboy S., who lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, is engaged in the livestock business. Specifically, he purchases and sells livestock, but he supplements his livestock income by growing wheat and rice. Moreover, he works as a driver on the collective farms. In addition, he explains that he is a very experienced livestock holder and that he has therefore acquired the necessary skills to succeed in his line of business.

Although he has a good group of livestock, he now wants to buy one more pedigree bull. Consequently, he is seeking a business development loan through KIVA in the amount of 2,600 STJ ($775) over 5 months for that specific purpose.

loans.use: To expand and improve his livestock business by purchasing another pedigree bull

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta S., 32, is married with 2 children. She has many years of experience in the Pork Buns business. She sells to the village and the public 6 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Eseta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, dripping oil and a frying pan. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, dripping oil, and a frying pan

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina A., 42, is married with seven children. She has many years of experience in the shop business. She sells to the village and public seven days per week.

She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Penina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. 

Her loan will be used to buy goods for the store. Her husband is helping her operate the store.

loans.use: To buy goods for the shop

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.en:
Bahodir T., who lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, is engaged in the livestock business. Notably, he is married and has 3 children. Specifically, he purchases and sells livestock for a living, but he supplements the income from his livestock business by growing wheat and rice. He proudly states that he is a very experienced livestock holder and that he has therefore acquired the necessary skills to succeed in his line of business.

Although he has a good group of livestock, he now wants to buy one more milk cow. As such, Bahodir is seeking a business development loan through KIVA in the amount of 3,200 STJ ($950) over 4 months to purchase such a cow.

loans.use: To expand and improve his livestock business by purchasing another milk cow

loans.name: Sasa

texts.en:
Sasa T., 30, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the farming business. She sells to the village people 7 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Sasa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She needs this loan to buy the equipment used in her business. Her husband and children help her.

loans.use: Purchase the equipment used in her business

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta E., 50, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the German bun and sewing business. She sells to the village people 3 days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Mareta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use this loan to assist her in buying materials for her sewing business and ingredients for her bakery business. Her husband and children help out.

loans.use: buying materials for her sewing business and ingredients for her bakery business

loans.name: Sairam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sairam T., who was born in 1960 in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, is engaged in the livestock and agriculture businesses. More specifically, she purchases and sells livestock, and she grows wheat and rice. Notably, she sells her goods for rather low prices, so she has very good business turnover. Interestingly, many of her wholesale customers want to work directly with her.

Sairam now seeks a business development loan through KIVA in the amount of 3,800 STJ ($1,125) over 5 months to capitalize on the seasonal nature of her businesses. She thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To implement seasonal initiatives in her businesses

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia L., 49, is married with six children. She has five years of experience in the Taxi/Bingo business. She sells to the village people and public six days per week. 

She has six previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (~$291 USD). SPBD loans are Eulalia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

The loan will be used to maintain her business. Her husband also helps out the business.

loans.use: Buy taxi spare parts, car seat, bingo papers and new tires for taxi

loans.name: Maauga

texts.en:
Maauga T., 34, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the banana and taro business. She sells to the village people 3 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Maauga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to buy the equipment used in her business. Her husband and children help out.

loans.use: to assist her in buying materials and equipment used for her business

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
Karomat U. has been a MicroInvest client since the beginning of 2008, but she has a good reputation and her colleagues note that it is a pleasure to work with her as she has not had any problems repaying her prior loan. She is engaged in the livestock business whereby she purchases and sells livestock. Moreover, she is married and has 4 children who help her with the livestock business.

At present, Karomat is hoping to build a new cow sheet, so she is seeking a business development loan through KIVA in the amount of 2,600 STJ ($775) over 3 months for that specific purpose.

loans.use: To expand and improve her livestock business by building a new cow sheet

loans.name: Soloiluma

texts.en:
Soloiluma L., 70, is married with 8 children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public 6 days per week. She has 6 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Soloiluma's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to repair her house. Her husband does all the farming.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, gromozone, weedkiller, knives; also to fund home repair

loans.name: Launiu

texts.en:
Launiu M., 34, is married with four children. She has five years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the village people four days per week. 

She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~$187 USD). SPBD loans are Launiu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. 

She will use the loan to buy the equipment used in her business. Her husband and children help out.

loans.use: To buy materials and equipment used for her vegetable business

loans.name: Bahtigul

texts.en: U. Bahtigul is 22 years old and lives in the Spitamen region. She is engaged in the livestock and agricultural business. Mrs. U. Bahtigul grows and sells rice and wheat, and also purchases and sells livestock. Mrs. U. Bahtigul has requested a business development loan of 3800 STJ to be paid back over 4 months. She will use this to fulfill seasonal duties of her livestock and agricultural business. She thanks KIVA for their support and wishes them all the best.

loans.use: Fulfilling seasonal duties

loans.name: Felauai

texts.en: Felauai I., 48, is married with five children. She has 3 years of experience in the Flea Market business. She sells Samoan bags, kava bouls, earrings (sets), carvings and other Samoan weapons to the public 6 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD). SPBD loans are Felauai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. all will be use to fund business. Her husband doesn't work but he also helps out with the business.

loans.use: Felauai would like to purchase items to resell at the flea market.

loans.name: Naite

texts.en:
Naite A., 43, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in making traditional fans and cava bowls. She sells to the village people 3 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Naite's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She needs the loan to buy the equipment used in her business. Her husband and children help out.

loans.use: to assist her in buying materials and equipment used for her business

loans.name: Laitalie

texts.en: Laitalie L., 45, is married with five children. She has many years of experience in the handicrafts equipments business. She sells to the village people 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~$187 USD). SPBD loans are Laitalie's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use this loan to buy equipment used in her business and her husband and children help out.

loans.use: Laitalie would like to purchase tmaterials and equipment used for her business

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania M., 39, is married with one child. She has seven years of experience in the taxi business. She serves the public five days per week. 

She has five previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Melania's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. 

The loan will be used to fund her business. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: Renewal of taxi license, spare parts and new car seat covers

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en:
Kalameli L., 47, is married with 2 children. She has many years of experience with the equipment used in her barbeque business. She sells to the village people and the public 4 days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Kalameli's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband and children help out with the business.

loans.use: buying equipment used in her business

loans.name: Tooa

texts.en: Tooa T., 49, is married and has three children. She has five years of experience in the canteen business. She sells to the school children five days per week. She has five previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about $250 USD).  SPBD loans are Tooa's only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. The loan will be use to buy chicken, sausages, soy sauce, tomato sauce, paper plates, onions, garlic onions, mutton flaps, and a big frying pan for her canteen business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her canteen

loans.name: Saidamir

texts.en: K. Saidamir is married with two children. He is 32 years old and lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Saidamir is an animated man full of enthusiasm. He works hard preparing and selling oil in his house. He has big plans and dreams to grow his business. Since he was very young, Saidamir learned about oil preparation from his uncle and that's why he decided to dedicate himself to this work. Initially he had only one oil-press. He expanded his business and now has two oil-presses. Her wife and his brother help him with the business. Saidamir wants to expand his business and buy additional foodstuff for preparing oil. With this purpose Saidamir requests an individual loan of 700 USD to be paid back over ten months. He is very motivated to grow his business and increase his income. With his efforts, and your important contribution, he can reach his goals.

loans.use: Purchasing of the necessary materials to prepare oil

loans.name: Saua

texts.en: Saua M., 40, is married and has four children.  She has many year of experience in the barbeque business. She sells to the village people and the public four days per week. She has two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about $208 USD). SPBD loans are Saua's only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her husband and children help with her business.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for her business

loans.name: Saili

texts.en:
Saili T., 46, is married with 10 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 3 days per week. She has 5 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Saili's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to finance house repair supplies. Her husband does all the farming.

loans.use: Purchase weedkiller, pesticides, gromozone, knives ,cement, timber and also labour cost for carpenter

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: K. Zarina is 20 years old. She is married. Because of difficult living condition, her husband had to leave for Russia for work and that’s why Zarina is running her own business. For two years she has been working in a beauty salon. In the salon, she is providing various services of hair styling, haircutting, manicure, and cosmetology. At the same time the salon rents wedding dresses and accessories for decorating wedding cars. Her business is successful and generates a stable income for her family. Now Zarina is planning to purchase cosmetics and other accessories for her beauty salon. For this purpose, she requests 2000 Somoni (600 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. Zarina thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: Purchasing of cosmetics and other accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Taulagia

texts.en:
Taulagia T., 58, is married with six children. She has four years of experience in the taxi/plantation business. She sells to the village people and public five days per week.

She has four previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD). SPBD loans are Taulagia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. 

The loan will be used to finance improvements to both businesses. Her husband operates the taxi business and also does farming.

loans.use: To purchase car doors, wheels, engine repairs, car paint, fertilizers, weedkiller, pesticides and chemicals.

loans.name: Galuega

texts.en:
Galuega T., 31, is married with one child. She has three years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the village people and public three days per week. 

She has four previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~$187 USD). SPBD loans are Galuega's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

Part of her loan will be used for home improvement

loans.use: Purchase a spade, knives, fertilizer, coco wire, more vegetable seeds in different kinds and cement for home renovation.

loans.name: Shaiq

texts.en: Shaiq R. is 18-years old. He sells pastries, cookies, candies, condensed milk, tea, eggs, washing powder, mayonnaise, and other materials in his store. He is not married but works hard to ensure a good future for his very old parents, who are on pension right now. He has been in the business for two years and has many loyal customers. He is the main provider for his family. He is requesting a loan of 1200 USD. He will use the loan to upgrade and enlarge his stock, which will enable him to increase his income. Sahiq thanks everyone for support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: to upgrade and enlarge his stock

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer A. is 41 years old. He and his wife have 2 children. Azer`s children are small now, but he already is working hard to ensure the best future for them. Azer is the only breadwinner in the family and is very hard-working. 

Azer has a shop in the local central market. For more than three years he has sold a wide range of detergents, cereals, cookies at attractive prices. His shop is very popular in his neighborhood and brings in a steady income. Azer applied for a loan of 1200 USD to expand his inventory. Your support will really help him. Let's get behind this dedicated father and help him with make his children's dreams a reality.

loans.use: to expand his inventory

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur A. is a very enthusiastic 27 year old man. He runs a food store that he built next to his house. Here he sells jams, milk and meat, candies, sugar, salt and other things. This business has been the main source of income for Elnur's family for the last eight years, improving their living conditions. Now Elnur is requesting 1200 to expand his business and to increase the range of goods for sale. He thanks everyone who supports him.

loans.use: to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Rufat

texts.en:
Rufat was born in 1979. He is married and has one child. He lives in Baku city. He has been in this business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy goods for improving his business.

Rufat's relative is pictured

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: Ismayil was born in 1980 and lives in Baku city. He is a young man, who is not married. Ismayil has been in the business for 3 years. He is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy the hardware necessary to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy hardware to improve his business

loans.name: Karomatullo

texts.en: M. Karomatullo is 42 years old. He is married with four children. Karomatullo is selling food stuff like cookies, preserved food, tea, soft drinks and different kinds of detergent in the market. He has been in this business already for 18 years. Karomatullo is very polite and his trading place is very popular with the locals. This business generates the main income for the family. Karomatullo requests 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for the term of 10 months to keep growing his business and increase the variety of products that he offers. This purchase will enable him to increase his sales and to earn more and improve his family's living condition. Karomatullo thanks everyone for supports and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: to purchase the foodstuff to enlarge the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en: Zaur was born in 1975. He lives in Baku city. This man is married and has one child. He has been in this business for five years. Now he requests a loan of $1200 to buy the hardware to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy hardware

loans.name: Kumush

texts.en:
P. Kumush is 35 years old. She is married with an adorable son of school age. Tursunoy sells the fabrics for sewing national dresses. She has been in this business almost for five years. Tursunoy has very good taste and she is ready to advise her clients which textile to choose for this or that occasion. That is why she has her constant customers. Moreover Kumush’s prices for fabrics are attractive for various levels of the population as she has the wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet. She has two trading places in different markets allowing her to keep the clientele and make a good income. The income that she derives allows her to educate her dearest son on high level. She hopes that she can continue to provide for him so he will be able to receive an adequate education. 

Kumush requests a loan of 3000 Somoni (900 USD) to purchase new fabrics and increase the range of goods she sells. Kumush promises to pay the loan in 4 months without any violation and expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her. Your generosity can change her life.

loans.use: to purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Konul

texts.en: Konul was born in 1966. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Lachin region in Azerbaijan and settled Khirdalan town. She is single. Three years ago she started this business of selling souvenirs and glass-wares. Now she requests a loan of $1200 to buy goods and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Nukra

texts.en:
R. Nukra is 34 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of two children. Nukra is selling toys for children. She has rented a store in one of the local markets and has run her own small business for five years. The business is the main source of income for her large family; Nukra and her husband not only support their two children but also their parents. Having only a couple competitors in the market, she is doing well with her business. Nukra always dreamed of owning her own small store and not having to depend on anyone else. She believes that someday her dream will come true and she will open her own store. 

Today, she is requesting a loan of 2400 Somoni (725 USD) for the term of 12 months. She will use the money to purchase new toys and increase the range of goods she sells. Nukra thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate with the loan payment. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to make her dream come reality.

loans.use: to purchase toys and increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Oktay

texts.en: Oktay was born in 1954. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Fuzuli region in Azerbaijan and settled in Baku city. He has been in the auto repair  business for 14 years. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Kenja

texts.en:
Kenja T. is 44 years old. She is a widow and the mother of three children. After the death of her husband, Kenja had to find ways to provide for herself and her three children. For three years she has had a business baking and selling the national bread, “lepeshka”. It has now become the family business as the children of Kenja are grown-up and they are helping their mother.

Kenja is a cheerful, hard-working woman despite the difficulties she faces. She has already received and repaid loans from IMON which have helped create stability for her business. Today Kenja is requesting a loan of 2200 Somoni (650 USD) with the term of 12 months. She is planning to purchase flour and coal required for baking the national bread, “lepeshka”. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more so she can provide her children with a good education. With your help this will be possible. Be an important part of the growth of Kenja’s business!

loans.use: Purchasing  flour and coal

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en: Komiljon is a very responsible and hard working man. He is married and has four children. Komiljon was motivated by them to start his own business selling men’s underwear 13 years ago. The wages he received in his former job were too low to provide for all of the family's expenses. Komiljon wishes to give his children a good education and a better quality of life. This drives him to make a good job and grow his business. In order to purchase more merchandise for the new season Komiljon is requesting a loan for 2800 Somoni (825 USD) for a term of 6 months. Please be an important part of Komiljon and his family's life by contributing to the growth of his business. They sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Purchasing the new goods for selling.

loans.name: Sanja

texts.en: Sanja Mitrović was born in 1977 and comes from Doboj. Sanja is employed as a nurse in Doboj. She likes her job because she is helping people and working with them. Sanja has also her business at home; she does different services on her computer. She decide to improve her business and be able to offer better services. She needs better equipment for that. So, she is taking a loan through WWI.

loans.use: To buy equipment for computer services she offers

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom P. is 29 years old and lives in Odombang II Commune, Battambang Province. She is a hairdresser and has a small shop. She has been in this business for more than two years. Sreymom is married to Mr. Ho Chan, who is a motorcycle taxi driver, earning approximately US$5.00 per day. Sreymom does not have children.

Mom has regular customers and their number has been increasing. Recently, she decided to improve her business, but she lacked the capital to do so. Facing this obstacle, Sreymom decided to ask of a loan of US$500 to purchase more hairdressing materials and to decorate her shop in order to attract customers.

loans.use: To improve a beauty salon

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila Mitrović is 50 years old and comes from Doboj. She is divorced and lives alone. She has incomes from two jobs. One is that she daily takes care of one sick person, and the other is that she sells health products from a regional supplier. She wants to expand her reselling by buying more products and she needs a loan for that. Mila is taking her first loan through WWI. She hopes to have enough income for her needs.

loans.use: To by products for reselling

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: B. Nusrat is 43 years old. She’s married and the loving mother of two children. Nusrat is a farmer. She has worked in agriculture for eight years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. Nusrat together with her husband is growing the agricultural crops like potatoes, onion, tomatoes, cucumber, carrot and other vegetables. They work from early morning 6:00 a.m. till late evening 6:00 p.m. Each year they are growing the crops sufficient for the family consumption and for selling. At the same time the family has been engaged in raising cattle. With her business, Nusrat has been able to pay for the schooling of her two children. This motivates her even more to keep working the land. Nusrat wants to cover the higher education expenses of her elder son as he has finished the school and entered the university. With this purpose she’s asking for a loan 2700 Somoni (800 US Dollars). She will use this loan to buy cattle and expand her cattle-shed. She is planning to repay the loan fully in 12 months. Your support will really help her. Please help the growth of Nusrat’s business so that she can put her son through university.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and expand her cattle-shed

loans.name: Fikreta

texts.en: Fikreta Mujanović was born in 1972, and she is married and has two children. Fikreta and her husband are owners of a store and they have worked there for a long time. They have their constant clients and the business is good. Fikreta and her husband are expanding it little by little. Fikreta was already a WWI client, and this is her second loan. She will use this loan to buy products for reselling in her store. She hoops that her store will run as better and that their children will have good businesses also in the future.

loans.use: To buy products for reselling

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: Khalid was born in 1989. He is single. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan and settled in Khirdalan town. Two years ago he started this business selling foodstuffs. Now he requests a loan of $1200 to buy goods and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đào Thị X. 48 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1996, Vay vốn phát triển kinh tế gia đình chị đã lựa chọn mô hình chăn nuôi vịt đẻ chứng và thả cá. Hiện tai gia đình chị đang nuôi hơn 300 con vịt đẻ và các loại giống cá, Thu nhập từ vịt đẻ trứng bình quân mỗi ngày 250.000đ. Chồng chị và con trai lớn làm nghề thợ xây thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. 
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Đào Thị X. - 48 years old - joined the TYM Fund in 1996. Borrowing a loan to transform the family's financial situation, she chose the business of raising egg-laying ducks and farming fish. Currently, her family is tending to over 300 ducks and a variety of fish. The income from the egg-laying ducks is about 250,000 VND per day. Her husband and their eldest son both work in construction for an income of 3,000,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, her family wishes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in raising livestock. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising ducks and fish

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima Mujanović was born in 1949 and comes from Derventa. She is married and her husband is in retail. Fatima is an owner of a local store, and her husband works with her part time. Fatima takes care of everything and the business in the store is good. She is is satisfied because she doesn`t expect too much. She hopes to earn, every day, enough for their costs. She is taking a loan through WWI to provide bigger offerings in her store and to keep selling on this level.

loans.use: To buy products for reselling

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Hồng 46 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2000. Qua việc vay vốn đầu tư vào các dự án có hiệu quả nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển hơn rất nhiều. Gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi lợn và chồng các loại cây ăn quả. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang chồng 150 cây cam. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi và cây ăn quả hàng năm ước tính khoảng 40.000.000đ. Chị có 5 con, 1 con đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, 2 con đi làm thu nhâp 3.000.000đ/ tháng, 2 con đang đi học.Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua con giống cây ăn quả và mua phân bón.
Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Ms. Pham Thi H., 46 years of age, has been a part of this organization since 2000. Her family finances has been steady and rising since becoming a part of this organization. All the loans that she was able to obtained previously was used to invest into livestock and planting/harvesting various fruit trees. Presently she has 150 orange trees. Her income from raising farm animals and agriculture averages about 40.000.000d/year. She has 5 children, one them is grown and lives on his own. The other 2 have jobs of their own; both of their incomes average 3.000.000d/month. The last two children are currently in school. This next loan, she is requesting an amount of 10.000.000vnd to buy more fruit seeds and fertilizer. Her monthly income is about 5.000.000vnd/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agriculture

loans.name: Nurali

texts.en: H. Nurali is 36 years old. He is married and the loving father of five children. Nurali works as an accountant. Because the salary he gets is not enough for his family, he also grows potatoes and apples. He has a big family with five underaged children. He is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for the term of 9 months so he can buy potato bags. Part of the loan he will also spend on hired workers and transportation. When the season comes he wants to sell potatoes in bags at a higher price. With the money earned from selling potatoes he wants to rebuild his house and educate his children at a high level. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchasing bags for potatoes and apples

loans.name: Aleksandra

texts.en:
Aleksandra Vučković is 21 years old. She comes from Derventa and she is not married. Aleksandra works in a flower store and besides that, she is the owner of part of this store. Her flower store is well-positioned and the business will expand.

Aleksandra became an owner recently and she wants to develop the business. She needs a loan for that, so she has requested one through WWI in the amount of 600 KM. Aleksandra will invest this loan in her flower store, buying needed equipment.

loans.use: To buy equipment for flower shop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị N. 53 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2001. Nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị là chăn nuôi lợn và thả cá. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ đều được gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Gia đình chị đầu tư chăn nuôi với số lượng lớn., hiện tại gia đình chị đang nuôi 50 con lợn thịt và 2000 con cá các loại. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi của gia đình chị một năm ước tính khoảng 40.000.000đ. Chồng chị hiện là cán bộ xã lương tháng ổn định 1.000.000đ, các con chị đi làm thu nhập 2.000.000/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyen Thi N., 53 years old, has been a part of this organization since 2001. Her main business is raising livestock and fishes. All the loans she previously obtained was used to invest into her livestock business. Presently, she is raising 50 hogs and 2000 different species of fishes. Her annual income from her business is about 40.000.000vnd. Ms. N. husband is a contractor, bringing home a set salary of 1.000.000vnd/month. All her children have jobs of their own, with their average income of 2.000.000vnd/month. This next loan she is requesting an amount of 10.000.000vnd to invest into her livestock. Her monthly income is 5.000.000vnd/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flowers for reselling

loans.name: Farrux

texts.en:
Farrux X. is a 44-year-old barber. He is married and has four children. He started his business in 1985 when he saved some money and opened his barber's shop. During long years of work, he has gained a reputation as an experienced and well-known barber in his region.

He has very flexible prices which attracts clients to his shop. During a day, Farrux has at least 20-25 clients, which brings him good income and makes him able to cover his family's needs. But to expand his business, he needs more funds and for this purpose he has applied for 1200 USD. He says that he has not done any repairs since he first opened his barber shop. Let's do our best to help him.

loans.use: To repair his barber shop

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Xuân 51 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2001. Chồng mất sớm hiện tại chị đang sống một mình, tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn chị đã đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi, các vòng vốn vay đều được chị đầu tư hiệu quả, mô hình chăn nuôi của chị đã lớn hơn. Hiện tại chị đang nuôi 20 con lợn chuẩn bị xuất chuồng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Ms. Tran Thi X., 51 year of age, has been a part of this organization since 2001. She became a widow after losing her husband at an early age. After taking a part of this organization, she was able to borrow a small amount to invest into raising livestock. Each loans she previously received was invested with a lot of success; expanding her farm each time. Presently, she is raising 20 hogs and hope to invest more into her business. She is requesting a loan amount of 10.000.000vnd. Her monthly income is 4.000.000vnd/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Thủy 30 tuổi tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Vay vốn của Quỹ gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn vào buôn bán. Hiện tại chị đang kinh doanh đồ giải khát, côngviệc kinh doanh của gia đình chị diễn ra rất thuận lợi, chị cùng chồng bàn bạc tới đây sẽ đầu tư thêm vào bán cà phê. Chồng chị làm nghề xe ôm thu nhập bình quân mỗi ngày 80.000đ, chị có 2 con hiện các con chị đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư cửa hàng giải khát.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Ms. Tran Thi T. is 30 years age and has been a part of this organization since 2003. Her family used the loans she previously received to invest into doing small businesses. She presently runs a beverage store. This business has bought her family much success. She and her husband hope to expand their business with selling coffee drinks. Ms. T. husband also works as a taxi-driver and makes approximately 80.000vnd/day. She has 2 small children who are school-age. This time she is requesting a loan of 15.000.000vnd to invest into her business. Her monthly income is 6.000.000vnd/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đỗ Thị Bạo 59 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1998, Trước khi chưa tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị còn thiếu vốn để phát triển kinh tế,các con chị còn nhỏ hoàn cảnh gia đình gặp nhiều khó khăn. Khi tham gia Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn từ nhỏ tới lớn để phát triển kinh tế. Đến nay chị đang có khoảng 3 mẫu ao để thả cá và trồng sen, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị từ hoạt động thả cá và chồng sen một năm là 50.000.000đ. Chị có 4 người con, 3 con đã trưởng thành, 1 con đang sống cùng chị và đã có công việc ổn định thu nhập 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư vào nuôi cá.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Đỗ Thị Bạo - 59 years old - joined the TYM Fund in 1998. Before her participation in TYM, her family was faced with many hardships because the children were still young and the family lacked funds to improve their financial situation. After joining TYM, she worked hard to borrow both small and large loans to transform their financial situation. Today, she has a 3-acre pond to farm fish and plant lotus. The family's average income from these two business is 50,000,000 VND per year. She has four children - three of which are on their own and one is still living at home with a job and steady income of 1,500,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, her family wishes to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in their fish farming business. Their average income in 6,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming Fish

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Ngân tham gia Quỹ năm 1998. Trước khi chưa tham gia Qũy kinh tế gia đình chị còn gặp rất nhiều khó khăn do không có vốn để phát triển kinh tế. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn và mua máy sát để làm kinh tế. Hiện nay kinh tế của gia đình anh chị đã phát triển và anh chị đã mua sắm được nhiều trang thiết bị cho gia đình. Chồng chị làm nghề thợ xây nên công việc của anh rất ổn định thu nhập bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Chị có 3 con, 2 con hiện đã trưởng thành, 1 con đi làm thu nhâp 1.200.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 12.000.000đ đầu tư mua thóc làm hàng sáo.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Hoang joined the Fund in 1998. Before joining the Fund, the family's finances experienced many difficulties, and they did not have the capital to develop a business. After joining the Fund, she boldly borrowed money to buy a rice processing machine to start a business. Currently the family's finances has expanded and the couple has been able to purchase many essentials for their family. Her husband works as a construction worker, so his work is very stable with an income of 1,500,000 per month. She has 3 children, 2 of whom of grown, and 1 who works and earns 1,200,000 per month. In this round of funding the family is requesting a loan of 12,000,000 VND to invest in buying rice crop to process into edible rice. Their average month income is 6,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agriculture

loans.name: Ilkhama

texts.en: Ilkhama was born in 1986. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Djabrail region in Azerbaijan, settled in Khirdalan town.
