She has been in the clothing sales business for two years. Now she requests a loan of $1200 to buy clothes and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đào Thị D. tham gia Quỹ năm 2001. Trước khi chưa tham gia Quỹ TYM gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn không có vốn làm ăn. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ TYM chị đã bàn với chồng mạnh dạn vay vốn về phát triển kinh tế và đến nay gia đình chị đã có 2 mẫu vườn trồng bưởi và cam đường canh. Nhà chị đã sắm được một số trang thiết bị như xe máy, tivi. Chị co 3 con, 2 con đã trưởng thành, 1 con đang sống cùng chị và gia đình hiện nay đang đi làm thu nhập 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đâu tư mua giống cây ăn quả và phân bón.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Đào Thị D. joined the TYM Fund in 2001. Before participating in TYM, her family experience many financial hardships with no means to make a living. Since joining TYM, she made plans with her husband to borrow funds so they could transform their financial situation. And today, her family owns two acres of citrus orchards - grapefruit and oranges. They have been able to purchase various items for the household, such as a motor vehicle and television. She has three children - two are grown, living on their own, while one is still living with her and working with an income of 1,500,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, her family wants to borrow 9,000,000 VND to buy fertilizer and more of the same trees. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and more fruit-bearing trees.

loans.name: Thi Xuyen

texts.vi:
Chị Đào Thị Xuyến 49 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003, trước khi chưa tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn do thiếu vốn làm ăn. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán nhỏ. Hiện tại chị đang đầu tư vốn vào buôn bán quần áo, thu nhập từ buôn bán bình quân 100.000đ/ ngày, chồng chị bán vé xổ số thu nhập hàng tháng ổn định, chị có 3 con, 1 con lớn đã xây dựng gia đình, 2 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán quần áo.
Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. D. Thi Xuyen, 49 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2003. Before joining the Fund, her family faced many financial difficulties due to the lack of fund to do business. Since joining the Fund, Mrs. Xuyen has borrowed loans to invest in raising livestock and small retailing. Currently, she sells clothes with the average daily profit of 100,000VND (about 6USD). Her husband sells lottery tickets with a stable monthly income. Mrs. Xuyen has 3 children. The eldest is married and the other two are still going to school. This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to invest in selling clothes. Her family's average monthly income is 5,000,000VND (about 312USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling clothes

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Bùi Thị Bộ tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003. Trước kia khi chưa tham gia vào Quỹ đời sống kinh tế gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn do thiếu vốn làm ăn, đến nay kinh tế gia đình đã ổn định hơn trước khi vào Quỹ rất nhiều, các con được học hành chu đáo hơn, gia đình chị có 3 người con hiện 1 con đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, 1 con đã đi làm cho thu nhập bình quân 1.200.000đ/ tháng, 1 con hiện đang đi học, các vòng vốn vay gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Từ việc đầu vốn có hiệu quả gia đình chị  đã sửa sang được công trình phụ và mua sắm được một số đồ dùng trang thiết bị trong nhà. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ.
Thu nhập bình quân. 4000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bùi Thị Bộ joined the TYM Fund in 2003. Before her participation in the fund, her family experienced financial difficulties because they lacked the capital for business ventures. Today, her family's financial situation is much better than before participation in the fund. All of her children have been able to focus more on their academics. She has three children - one is grown and has left the household, one is employed with an average income of 1,200,000 VND per month, and one is attending school. Her family has used each loan to invest into the rearing of pigs and chicken. Ever since the first loan, her family has had good results allowing them to create a savings and purchase various household items. For this loan cycle, her family wants to borrow 9,000,000 VND. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rearing pigs and chicken

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thi G. 51 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003, gia đình chị có 2 con hiện đang đi học. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ vay vốn gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn vào kinh doanh dịch vụ cho thuê phông bạt, loa đài, bát đĩa phục vụ đám hiếu, hỷ trong địa phương, công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị rất phát triển bình quân mỗi đám gia đình chị thu từ 400.000đ đến 500.000đ, ngoài công việc kinh doanh cùng chồng chị vẫn chanh thủ thời gian đi chợ buốn bán nhỏ cho thu nhập hàng ngày 50.000đ. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ mua sắm đồ phục vụ kinh doanh. 
Thu nhâp bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. G. Thi Nguyen, 51 years old, joined the Fund in 2003. She has two children who are currently going to school. Since joining the Fund, the family has invested in a service which rents out audio equipment, tableware, and other equipment for use ceremonies and celebrations in the local town. The family's business is expanding quickly; for each event, her family collects 400,000 VND to 500,000 VND. Besides the family's main business, she and her husband also take advantage of their extra time to do some extra trading business with a daily income of 50,000 VND. In this round of funding, the family is borrowing 19,000,000 VND to buy more equipment to rent. Their average income is 6,000,000 VND/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more equipment to rent

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Née en 1958 à AGOUEVE dans la préfecture de Golfe, dame D. Ablavi est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle a ouvert un magasin de lavage à sec (pressing). Dans son magasin elle vend également des bijoux. Elle est souvent aidée par son premier enfant qui a terminé ses études et n’a pas encore trouvé du travail. Dame D. Ablavi assure 75% des charges de la famille car l’activité de son mari ne marche plus comme avant. 
Dix années d’expérience dans ce domaine, elle accueille beaucoup de clients compte tenu de son savoir faire.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acquérir une machine à laver et pour acheter 40 bijoux.
texts.en:
Born in 1958 in Agoueve, in the Prefecture of Golfe, Mrs. Ablavi D. is married and the mother of four (4) children. She has opened a dry cleaning store. In her store she also sells jewelery. She is often helped by her oldest child who has finished his schooling and has not yet found employment. Mrs. Ablavi D. assumes 75% of the family expenses as her husband's business is not as successful as it once was. With ten years of experience in this field, she has acquired many clients because of her "know how". She is requesting her first loan to purchase a washing machine and 40 pieces of jewelery.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a washing machine and jeweley

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hòa 50 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003, gia đình chị có 3 người con, 2 con lớn đã xây dựng gia đình và ra ở riêng, 1 con hiện đi học sống cùng vợ chồng chị. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ đều được gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, cá. Chồng chị là người chịu khó ngoài công việc chăn nuôi trong gia đình anh còn đi làm nghề thợ xây thu nhập bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Chị cũng đi chợ buôn bán nhỏ thu nhập bình quân 50.000đ/ ngày. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua lợn giống, cá giống và thức ăn chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân.4.000.000đ/ tháng
texts.en:
Mrs. H. Thi Nguyen, 50 years old, joined the Fund in 2003. Her family has three children, two of whom are grown and are starting their own families in separate residences, and one who is going to school and living with the parents. In each round of funding, the family has invested in raising livestock and fish farming. Her husband is a hardworking man; besides the livestock work with the family, he also works as a construction worker earning an average of 1,500,000 VND per month. She also trades goods at the market, with a modest income of 50,000 VND/day. In this round of funding the family is requesting a loan of 15,000,000 VND to invest in a sow, breeding fish, and buying feed. Their average monthly income is 4,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pigs, breeding fish, feed

loans.name: Mohammad Sadiq

texts.en: M. Sadiq lives with his family in a rented house. He was in Pakistan for more than 10 years. He returned to Afghanistan 2 years ago and opened a retail shop which he runs with the help of his family. He would like to expand his business so he wants to take out a loan to increase his inventory. He is trying his best to attract more clients to his shop and make a good monthly income for his family. He would like to thank lenders from around the world.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003, chị Nguyễn Thị Thêm 50 tuổi đã qua 5 vòng vốn vay của Quỹ. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ đều được gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà vịt và thả cá. Với việc chăn nuôi vịt đẻ chứng gia đình chị luôn có thu nhập hàng ngày đều đặn là: 200.000đ, chị có 3 con hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000 đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. Thi Nguyen, 50 years old, joined the Fund in 2003 and has completed 5 rounds of funding. In every round of funding, her family has used the loans to invest in raising pigs, chickens, ducks, and fish farming. With daily income from the duck eggs, the family always has a steady daily income of 200,000 VND. She has three children who are currently attending school. In this round of funding the family is requesting 9,000,000 VND to invest in raising livestock. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: invest in various livestock

loans.name: Hoa Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Hoa 49 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003. Từ khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã mạnh giạn vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và đi chợ. Hàng ngày chị đi mua thóc và bán cho các đại lý thu nhập bình quân 100.000đ/ ngày. Chồng chị là cán bộ xã lương tháng ổn định 1.000.000đ, chị có 3 con, 1 con đã trưởng thành và 2 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000 đầu tư thêm vốn đi chợ.
Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa Thi T. is a 49 year old woman. Since 2003 when she joined the TYM fund, her family has been borrowing money to invest in livestock and small businesses. She wholesales raw rice in the local market. This business usually brings in 100,000 Vietnamese Dong per day. Her husband is a village official whose income is 1,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. They have 3 children, 1 of whom has grown up. The other 2 are going to school. She plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to expand her business. The family’s income is about 5,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc T., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agriculture

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Mr. Sou L., 40, is married and is a father of one child. He and his wife work as tailors, sewing clothes in batch and then reselling them to a broker who normally comes to collect them. In 1998, he and his wife learnt tailoring skills from a tailor who lives close to his community, and a few months afterward, the couple started their own business. Presently, the tailoring business is doing well for their family and they can collectively make a gross daily income of around US$15.

With the ambition of going ahead and expanding his business, Mr. Sou L. and his wife would like to purchase more sewing machines to both accelerate their tailoring works and provide rental income.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells rechargeable phones and rechargeable phone cards. She sells the recharge cards in wholesale and retail and has been in this business for over a year. Esther is 40 years old and married to Mr. A. who is a dock worker at Tin Can Island in the state of Lagos. Esther needs a loan of 1200 USD to purchase more rechargeable phones to sell.

loans.use: To buy more rechargeable phones to sell

loans.name: Koumavi

texts.fr:
Monsieur H. Koumavi est né le 7 juillet 1969 à Agoè-nyivé. Il est marié et père de cinq enfants. Il est menuisier charpentier et fabrique des chaises, des tables et autres objets à base de bois. C’est au cours de l’année 2006 qu’il a ouvert  son atelier. Il travaille parfois en collaboration avec des maçons et les aide à faire des coffrages. Avec ce métier il satisfait ses besoins primaires. 
Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter du bois pour la fabrication de chaises et de tabourets.
texts.en:
Mr. Koumavi H. was born on July 7, 1969 in Agoè-nyivé. He is married and the father of five. A carpenter, he produces chairs, tables, and other items made of wood. It was during 2006 that he opened his workshop. He sometimes works in collaboration with masons and helps them make forms and frames. In this carpentry trade, he meets his basic needs. He is requesting this first loan to buy wood to make chairs and stools.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber for making chairs

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok S., 45, is a widow who lives with her three children in Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. She has been worked as a silversmith since 1980, when she learnt the skill from her cousin who was a gold- and silversmith. Nowadays, two of her children are learning the trade so that in the future they can provide better living conditions for their own families. Mrs. Sok S. buys raw materials (silver or gold) from the market and creates bracelets, necklaces, rings, and earrings to fulfill her customers' demands. Twice a month, she delivers her output to vendors at Ou Russey Market, which is one of the big markets in the city.  She can typically earn around US$10 profit. 

Now Mrs. Sok S. would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase more equipment and tools to make her work better and faster. In the near future, she plans to hire workers to expand her yield and wholesale her jewelry to more than one market.

loans.use: To buy more metalworking tools

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo S. N., 32, is a mother of one daughter who is currently employed by a garment factory and another child who is a student. She and her husband sell porridge and pork with rice for breakfast, together making an income of around US$15 a day.

Lately, Mrs. S. N.'s business is doing better and she has more clients than before. She would like a loan to expand her breakfast business and to buy more rice from the growers to resell for a profit when the rice price goes up.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is a teacher by profession but he owns a phone booth for making calls from which he also sells rechargeable phone cards. He has been in this business for the past three years. Dennis is 41 years old and married with five children. Dennis and his family live in the state of Lagos. Dennis is seeking a loan of 850 USD to buy more rechargeable phone cards to sell. He says thank you!

loans.use: To buy more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Mr. Kang S., 66, is a landlord who rents houses to the people from the countryside who come to work in the city. He has been in a business since 1993 and he can make around US$3 a day in revenue. His wife has started her own business selling rice and a variety of Khmer foods to the people in her community, earning around US$5 of net income. Mr. Kang S. has five children, four of whom are married and live outside the family home. The fifth is unemployed and lives with his father.

Mr. Kang S. has recently requested a loan from KIVA via CREDIT MFI to repair his rental house to satisfy his tenants. He also plans to use the loan to purchase a ton of rice from growers for resale for a profit when the rice price goes up.

loans.use: Rental house repairs

loans.name: Sényébia Afi

texts.fr:
Née le 12 juin 1960 à Kpélé-Toutou localité située à 145 km de Lomé, dame D. Sényébia Afi est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Toutes les charges de la famille reposent sur elle puisque son mari est un policier en retraite et à une faible capacité financière. 
Elle a pour activité, la vente des tubercules d’ignames, des céréales et des fruits. 
Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 sacs de maïs, 60 tubercules d’ignames et 5 paniers d’orange.
texts.en:
Born on June 12, 1960 in Kpélé-Toutou, a town located 145 km from Lomé, Ms. Sényébia Afi D. is married and the mother of two. All household expenses fall upon her shoulders because her husband is retired from the police force and has a low capacity for income. Her work involves selling yam tubers, grain, and fruit. She once was a recipient of a loan, and she repaid it. This second loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 10 sacks of corn, 60 yam tubers, and 5 baskets of oranges.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, yams, and fruit

loans.name: Olayinka

texts.en: Olayinka is 39 years old and married to Mr. O.; they have one child. Olayinka is a Lapo client; she sells provisions and has been in this business since 1998. Recently, she started selling kerosene. Olayinka hopes to buy and sell kerosene in the wholesale market. She is seeking a loan of 1200 USD to buy kerosene wholesale to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and to Lapo microfinance!

loans.use: To buy more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Gulhumor

texts.en: K. Gulhumor was born in 1972 in the Spitamen region. She is married and has two children. Mrs. K. Gulhumor applied to the MicroInvest in 2008 when she heard about the MicroInvest loan program from her sister. She was in a difficult financial situation so she took a business development loan and could change and improve the business terms significantly. Now Mrs. K. Gulhumor has a separate business in fruits, vegetables and rice selling. She works straight with the suppliers so she can trade at the low prices. She has many repeat customers. Mrs. K. Gulhumor is applying to KIVA for a business support loan and trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. She applies to KIVA for the loan of 2100 STJ to be paid back in 3 months. She dreams of opening her own trade outlet.

loans.use: business turnover increase

loans.name: Mahfirat L

texts.en: U. Mahfirat lives in the Spitamen region and is married with two children. She does not have any special education but is experienced in business and has the appropriate skills. Mrs. U. Mahfirat has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006; she is reliable and executive client. Thanks to previous loans she could open a trade outlet in the central bazaar on shoes, jackets and shirts. She trades the goods that her niece brings from China. She has repeat customers but she also trades by herself. Mrs. U. Mahfirat applies to KIVA with the request of the business development loan of 4000 STJ to be paid back in 4 months. She will use the money for the new seasonal goods importing.

loans.use: importing seasonal goods

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel sells drinks in wholesale and retail to customers. He has been in this business since 1990. He is seeking a loan of 850 USD to buy more drinks to sell, which will help him retain his customers and draw new ones. Abel is 38 years old and married to Nkiru who sells foodstuffs in the local market; they have two children. He says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.en:
Greetings from Maimouna in Gisenyi, Rwanda! This 33 year old entrepreneur is married with three children.

Maimouna sells clothes in the market places in Gisenyi. Her husband is a bus driver who earns about $200 a month driving passengers on long trips.

Maimouna is looking for a loan worth 301,895 Frws to increase her stock of clothing because she is expecting high sales during the Christmas season. The loan period is eight months.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr:
Dame A. Elise est née en 1979 à Aného dans la préfecture des lacs au Togo. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est revendeuse du haricot et de mais dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle achète ces céréales dans les villages reculés de Lomé et les conditionne dans les tonneaux et dans les bidons afin de les protéger contre l’effet des charançons. 
Compte tenu de l’évolution croissante de son activité et de la demande de plus en plus forte de ses clients, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 142 bols du haricot et 4 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsie A. was born in 1979 in Aneho in the Prefecture of Lacs in Togo. She is married and the mother of one child. She is a seller of beans and corn in the Agoe district. She buys her cereals in the villages outside of Lome and stores them in barrels and drums to pretect them from the effects of grain weevils.

Bearing in mind that her business is expanding and the ever increasing demand from her clients, she is requesting this loan to purchase 142 basins of beans and 4 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and beans

loans.name: Florentina Alexandre

texts.pt:
Florentina Alexandre L. nasceu na província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, com 38 anos de idade é divorciada e mãe de 5 filhos, com idades entre 17, 15, 13, 10 e 3 anos de idade respectivamente. Apenas sustenta os seus filhos.

Florentina estudou ate 8ªclasse e nao continuou por falta de condições, 1989 se casa maritalmente e em 2000 se divorciou e assim com tinha que sustentar os filhos optou pelo negocio vendendo roupas desde 2000 ate hoje.

Florentina  vive basicamente de negocio e nao observa o horário variando por dia segundo a demanda de clientes, tem a destacar como produto mais rentável e com mais saída os fatos de homens que os adquira na Africa do sul por (R250) equivalente a 750,00mt e revende por 2000,00mt. Assim tem um rendimento mensal de 8000,00mt liquido e consegue poupar algum mensalmente.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo na hluvuku e já teve noutras instituuiçao chamada cooperativa de credito Tchuma no valor de 10.000,00mt o primeiro e 20.000,00mt o segundo e ambos aplicou no negocio. Assim com este empréstimo no valor de 13.000,00mt pretende reforçar o negocio dado que neste momento esta fazendo a reforma da sua casa e muito do seu rendimento esta destinar nesta. Assim sonho comprar um carro e conta com ajuda do credito.
texts.en:
Born in the city of Gaza, in southern Mozambique, Florentina Alexandre L., 38, is a divorced mother of five children ages 17, 15, 13, 10 and 3. Due to her family's lack of money, Florentina's education was interrupted after middle school. She got married in 1989, and since her divorce, in 2000, she has been in the business of selling clothes to support her family. Buying and reselling clothes is her main source of income, and her business hours vary according to demand. The best selling, and most profitable item in her inventory are men's suits from South Africa, which she buys for 750,00 and resells for 2.000,00 MT. With a current net income of 8.000,00 MT, she is able save some money every month. This is the first time Florentina is applying for a loan from Hvuluku. Her previous two loans, in the amount of 10.000,00 and 20.000,00 MT, were from Tchuma Credit and Savings Cooperative. She will use her loan from Hvuluku to invest on the clothing sales business, since most of her current income has been going toward improving her house. In the future, with some credit help, she hopes to be able to buy a car.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothes for reselling

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en:
Greetings from Gaudance on the shores of Lake Kivu in Rwanda! Gaudance is 32 years old and married with two children. 

She sells fish because her family lives near Lake Kivu, the biggest lake in Rwanda. She buys fish direct from the fishermen and sells them in the market places in Gisenyi town markets and restaurants. She earns about $90 a month from her business activities.

Gaudence is requesting a loan worth 301,895 Frws to buy more fish to sell to a growing number of clients in town. The loan period is eight months.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Morayo

texts.en: Morayo sells tailoring materials in wholesale and retail to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. Morayo also has two deep freezers for selling drinks and water in wholesale and retail. Morayo is a LAPO client. She is 53 years old and is married with five children. She lives in Lagos with her family. She needs a loan of  850 USD to buy more tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible!

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Sandra Carlota

texts.pt:
Sandra Carlota T. nasceu na cidade de Maputo e tem 37 anos de idade, casa maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos a mais velha tem 18 anos de idade e estuda na 9ªclasse , a segunda vai completar 15 anos e estuda na Sétima classe, a terceira tem 10 anos e estuda na 5ªclasse. Para alem da sua família tem ajudada a sua mãe enviando dinheiro ou géneros alimentícios.

Sandra estudou até 11ªclasse e parou por gravidez e assim viu se obrigada a ir ao lar. Em 1989 juntou com o marido casamento que resultou em três filhos, desde nunca mudou se de cidade, aprendeu a fazer o negocio com a sua avo que vendia mariscos num dos mercados da preferia da cidade de Maputo.

Sandra vive basicamente de negocio e o produto a destacar é o amendoim que compra por 1950,00mt o saco e revende por 2500,00mt, assim tem um rendimento mensal de 28000,00mt e consegue poupar algum. Vive numa casa própria.

Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e nunca solicitou noutras instiT.ções. Conheceu a hluvuku através de amiga. Paulina esta confiante que o seu negocio vai melhorar por que poderá satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes e aumentara os seus ingressos. Tem como sonho formar os seus filhos e construir melhor a sua casa.
texts.en:
Sandra Carlota T., 37, married, was born in the city of Maputo, Mozambique. She's the mother of three children, ages 18, 15 and 10, all enrolled in school. Her studies were interrupted in 11th grade, when she got pregnant with her first child. She and her partner have been together since 1989 and own their own house. She's learned how to run a business with her grandmother, who used to sell shellfish at one of the markets on the outskirts of Maputo. Sandra helps support her family, and her mother, by selling basic food products from home, an activity that gives her a monthly net income of about 28.000,00 MT and allows her to save some money. The bulk of her profit comes from selling peanuts, which she buys bulk for 1.950,00 MT a bag, and resells for 2,500,00 MT. Sandra's business is the main source of the family's income. She heard about Hvuluku through a friend, and this is the first time she's applying for credit. She is confident that this loan will help her improve her business, serve her clients better, and save more money. Sandra's dream is to remodel her house and to see her children graduate from college.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic food products to sell at her grocery stand

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Greetings from Theogene in Kigali, Rwanda! He is married with three children.

This entrepreneur has owned a small shop (boutique) for three years. He sells different items, like kilograms of sugar, maize flour, cassava flour, beans, rice, and bars of soap. Besides the shop, he also grows beans, sorghum, and cassava for sale. He employs one person to help him in the business.

Theogene is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Frws to buy more stock for his shop. The loan period is eight months.

loans.use: To increase his shop's inventory.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima O. is a hair stylist. She also sells hair creams, weaves, and hair extensions. Fatima also buys and sells ladies handbags and shoes to people in her community. She has been in this business since 2002 and is a LAPO client. Fatima is 33 years old and is a widow with two children. She is seeking a loan of  850 USD to buy more hair materials to sell in her salon. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible!

loans.use: To buy more hair materials for her salon

loans.name: Celine

texts.en: Celine is a 40-year-old widow with five children who sells smoked fish and other foodstuffs like plantain and corn. Celine is the leader of a lending group represented by LAPO microfinance. She is seeking a loan of 850 USD to buy more cartons of fish to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible!

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish to sell

loans.name: Paulina Alberto Mavanga

texts.pt:
Paulina Alberto mavanga M. nasceu em Cabo Delgado, no distrito de  ao norte de Moçambique, tem 43 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 6 filhos com idades o mais velho tem 26 anos e o dois últimos são gémeos com 13 anos todos ainda são estudante. Para alem da sua família tem ajudada a sua  mãe enviando dinheiro para cidade de pemba.

Paulina estudou até 7ªclasse do antigo sistema nacional de educação, e parou de estudar por problemas de saúde e falta de condições financeiras para suportar as despesa. Paulina saiu de cabo delgado acompanhando o seu marido transferido pelos serviços e por cá ficaram até data hoje.

Paulina dedica se a vende de roupas e camarão, negocio que aprendeu desde pequena através das suas irmãs. O melhor produto é a roupa de trajem africana feita de capulanas e vende por 125,00mt a Blusa e o fato por 950,00mt. Tem um rendimento mensal de 5.000,00mt e poupa mensalmente 2.000,00mt.

Para Paulina este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva nunca solicitou noutras instituições, conheceu a hluvuku através das amigas que já são clientes, pretende com este empréstimo aumentar a mercadoria e fornecer mais produtos aos seus clientes, tem sonho para os próximos empréstimos construir uma loja.
texts.en:
Paulina Alberto Mavanga Mondiane was born in Cabo Delgado, in the district in the north of Mozambique. She's 43 years old, married, and mother to six children. The eldest is 26, and the two youngest ones are 13-year-old twins. All are still students. Besides her family, she helps her mother, sending money to the town of Pemba. Paulina studied until 7th grade in the old national system of education. She stopped her studies due to health problems and financial difficulty in paying the fees. Paulina left Cabo Delgado, accompanied by her husband, who was transferred by his work, and they have been here until today. Paulina works at selling clothes, a business that she learned from her sisters ever since she was little. Her best product is clothing made out of African wax print cloth, sold for 125 meticais per blouse and 950 meticais for a suit. She has a monthly income of 5000 meticais and saves 2000 of it. For Paulina, this is her first loan from Hluvuku and Kiva. She has never solicited a loan from other institutions. She heard of Hluvuku through friends who are clients. She plans with this loan to increase her amount of stock and supply more products for her clients. She has a dream of constructing a store with future loans.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing for resale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella sells sand for building houses. She has been in this business since 2002. She uses a boat to transport sand from Badagry Beach and brings it to Ikotun Ð Egbe in the state of Lagos to sell to individuals who are building houses. A big boat of sand contains about two truckloads of sand. Stella is 34 years old and married with two children. Stella is seeking a loan amount of 1200 USD to buy more sand to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible!

loans.use: To buy more sand to sell

loans.name: Fezret

texts.en: Fezret A. is a 52-year-old butcher. He is married and has three children. Fezret started his business in 1995 and since that time he has gained the respect of his permanent clients. He runs his business in the heart of the central bazaar. Every day local farmers bring him livestock for meat, but Fezret’s working day finishes too fast because he sells all the meat in about four hours. Fezret wants to improve his financial situation by purchasing more meat each day. To do this, he needs more funds, so he is applying for a loan of $1200 USD. You can be a helping hand to Fezret’s business.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Panah

texts.en:
Panah H.  is 47 years old. He is married and he has three daughters of school-age for whom he works very hard. Panah wants his children to be well-educated and he wishes to send them to better schools. His wife is a homemaker. Panah raises onions and then sells them in the local bazaar. Because he sells onions from his garden, his onion wholesale prices are lower than the regular market prices. He has gained rich experience by working in this kind of business for 9 years. 

He is going to use this loan to diversify the types of vegetables that he sells. He will also purchase potatos, seasonal fruits and vegetables. Panah expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To diversify the vegetables he sells

loans.name: Firengiz

texts.en: Firengiz S. is 46 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of four children. All of her children are in school. Her husband helps her with sales, but before, they were both unemployed and Firengiz was pushed to start her own business so that she could help him cover their living expenses. For more than 10 years she has been selling children's clothing. Firengiz is a very enthusiastic and dynamic woman. She has very good taste in selecting the clothing that she buys and amazing marketing skills in convincing her clients about the clothing they should buy. She has been the main breadwinner of the family for a long time. She now requests a loan which she will use to buy new clothing for the autumn season and to purchase some women's clothes. Firengiz is grateful for your generosity and help.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Feride

texts.en: Feride A. is 48 years old. She is married and has four children. She started her business because there was no other way to feed her family as she and her husband were unemployed. Now, she has been running her store for 10 years. She sells different kinds of goods, including kitchen equipment and accessories for girls. Feride is very dynamic and cares for her family. She tries to give her family as much money as possible to cover the school expenses of her children because she dreams that all of them will be well educated. Today, Feride wants to expand her business and to increase her working capital for purchasing new goods to sell. For this purpose, she requests a loan. She is borrowing money for the first time. Your help and support can make her closer to her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Diap Thialène Group

texts.fr: Situé dans la région de Thiès, Louly Ngogom (http://www.sem-fund.org/loulyngogomfr.php) est un village sérère dont l'activité principale est l'agriculture et l'élevage. La récolte 2007 étant productive, l’accessibilité à l’eau et la disponibilité de la paille d’arachide (fourrage) font de Louly, un cadre adéquat pour l’embouche bovine. C’est pourquoi nous venons auprès de kiva solliciter un prêt pour acheter des jeunes bœufs pour nous orienter vers l'embouche dans le but d'améliorer le revenu monétaire de leur exploitation et la fertilité de nos sols par l'utilisation du fumier.
texts.en:
Located in the Thiès region, Louly Ngogom (http://www.sem-fund.org/loulyngogomfr.php) is a quiet little town whose main activities are agriculture and livestock. The harvest in 2007 was bountiful, and access to water and the availability of peanut straw for fodder make Louly a good place for fattening cattle. That is why we have come to Kiva requesting a loan to purchase young steers for fattening. Our goal is to use them to increase our monetary income and to use the manure to improve the fertility of our soil.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening of cattle

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif N. is a 26-year-old man. He is married and is the father of two adorable sons. Yusif has a grocery store which he attends to himself, along with caring for his family and his home. 

Yusif began his small business 6 years ago. The reason for starting the business was to increase his large family's income. His business has been gradually growing ever since.  

In order to grow his business still more, he requests a loan. Yusif is planning to use the loan to buy more goods for re-sale, thus increasing his range of goods. He promises to repay his loan and thanks everybody who decides to support him.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Sherafet

texts.en: Sherafet Q. is a 55 year old woman who is married and has three children. She sells table furniture which is very popular and rents them for wedding parties. She started her business in 1991 when she saw that her salary was not large enough to cover her family's needs. Her husband is unemployed and he helps her with her shop while she is teaching lessons. She is a school teacher and we took the photo of her while she was checking home exercises at her workplace. She says it is very hard to work at both jobs but that she does not have any other choice. Every single day she tries her best to bring money home to feed her children.  Now, she wants to expand her business and for this purpose she is applying for the loan.  She is thankful for your generosity and help.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira Sinanović is 25 years old and lives in Jaruke, village near Lukavac. She is married and the mother of two high school children. Elvira's husband works in one company in Sarajevo and earns a living that covers their expenses. Elvira is a housewife and she keeps her busy in her cornfield. She produces corn for selling, and besides that she grinds it and sells the corn flour. She also is starting a poultry business because she has grain to use as food. She decided to take a loan through WWI to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy poultry for her new business

loans.name: Merima

texts.en: Merima Hidanović was born in 1988 and comes from the village Jaruke near Lukavac. She is employed and lives with her parents. She earns not so much but she has extra income from her little business at home. She has chickens and other poultry. Merima wants to expand her business, so she is taking her first loan from WWI. She will buy poultry and food for it. Merima hopes to develop her business really well.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Samiat

texts.en: A. is 45 years old and married with three children. She sells wrappers (sarong) and lace materials. She also sells gold earrings and necklaces. She has been in this business for a long time. She is seeking a loan of 850 USD to purchase more wrappers (sarong) and lace materials to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible!

loans.use: To buy more sarong and lace materials to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine O. is 50 years old and a widow with 12 children. She takes care of her children alone although her two eldest daughters who are working assist her as much as they can. Her youngest child is 11 years old and he is in a public secondary school in Lagos state. Catherine sells provisions like toothpaste, hair cream, and detergent retail. She has been in this business since 2006. However, she is also a cake designer and often gets contracts to bake cakes for people during social engagements. She is a LAPO client and is seeking a loan of 850 USD to buy more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible!

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Olabisi

texts.en: Olabisi is 43 years old and married to Mr. B.; together they have three children. She sells soft drinks in wholesale and retail as well as rechargeable phone cards and phone calls. She has been in this business for the past five years. She needs a loan of 700 USD to purchase more soft drinks and phone cards for sale. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible!

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks and phone cards to sell

loans.name: Jesutofumi

texts.en: Jesutofumi sells foodstuffs like garri, yam, beans, and rice in wholesale and retail. She has been selling foodstuffs for a long time. She has been the leader of a lending group with LAPO microfinance for over three years. Jesutofumi is 53 years old and married to Mr. O. who is a missionary. They have two children who are both in a higher institution of learning in Lagos state. Jesutofumi is seeking a loan of 1200 USD to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible!

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Calista

texts.en:
Calista sells provisions, food products, drinks and rechargeable phone cards. She has been in the business of selling provisions and drinks for the past ten years, but after joining LAPO Microfinance, she added the sale of food products and rechargeable phone cards to her business.

Calista is 39 years old and married with two children. Calista needs the loan amount of $850 to purchase more food products and provisions to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more food products and provisions to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 40 years old and lives in Lagos State, Nigeria.  Her husband, Mr. O. is an artist and owns a gallery. They have four children. 

Victoria sells provisions and has been in this business for the past eight years. She needs the loan of $850 to purchase more products to sell in her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 34 years old and married with 4 children. She and her family live in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and foodstuffs and the demand for her products is high.  Doris hopes to retain her customers and therefore needs the loan of $1200 to buy more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Confiadas Group

texts.en: "Mujeres Confiadas," as the name suggests, is a group of 10 confident women. Each one of these women is ready to change her life and start her own small business. Mirtha J. was chosen as the representative of this group. Mirtha is a hardworking mother of 6 children. She feels that starting her own business is a way she can improve her life and the life of her big family. She plans on starting a small business selling clothes, and hopes to someday turn it into a thriving business. Her dream is to provide her family a comfortable life and improve their situation. This whole group realizes that this is their chance to change their situation, and they are all ready for this loan and this opportunity. On behalf of Mirtha, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To start a clothing business

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en: Jumoke is 39 years old, married to Mr. O., and they have five children. Jumoke sells foodstuffs like gari, beans, and rice, both wholesale and retail. The demand for her foodstuffs is high. She needs the loan amount of US$ 925  to enable her to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin is 34 years old and married to Mr. D., who is a welder, and they have three children. 

Toyin sells foodstuffs in wholesale and retail. Toyin is a LAPO client and she needs the loan amount of $925 to purchase more food products to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola is 44 years old and is married with 4 children. She sells frozen foods and started this business in 2002. She and her family live in Lagos State, Nigeria. 

Bola opens her shop at 8:00am and closes by 6:00pm daily. She needs the loan amount of $425 to buy more frozen foods to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their kind hearts.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Bigam

texts.en:
G. was born on February 6, 1966, and is married to Atuh Mercy. He is the father of four children, all under the age of fifteen. The loss of three children, and a motor accident two years ago, brought a great set-back to his life and that of his family.

However, he is an ambitious man, and decided to put all the effort he can into seeing that his remaining children are established in good vocations in life. Because of these hardships, he was not able to pay the school fees; now they have all exceeded the primary school age, and their only option is to be trained in a trade. So G. sought help from GHAPE, from which he has received loans amounting to $280 to do business and pay an apprentice fee for his children.

With this loan, G. plans to buy a two-wheel motorcycle and pay for its documents. He knows his motorcycle transport business will succeed because the bad roads of his community prevent the movement of vehicles, thereby creating a high demand for motorcycles for easy movement.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and its documents

loans.name: Njuambuh

texts.en:
Njuambuh M. is married to Alexander Kencholia and they have seven children, two of which are under the age of fifteen. She was born on June 5th, 1959; M. and her family live in a three-room house in the Nkwen neighborhood. 

As the family's bread-winner, Njuambuh finds it difficult to care for the family single-handedly. She was also in a serious accident involving getting robbed by thieves. Faced with a low level of education, she could not secure a good job for herself and thus started making and selling craft-work, something she has now been doing for fifteen years. She supplies the community with craft articles such as dulls.

When she became a member of GHAPE, she was fortunate to acquire some techniques which have helped her improve her craft business. She has had previous loans which she has successfully repaid. Njumbuh will use this loan for such craft supplies as fibers, straw, loin cloth, paint and camwood. She will repay this loan in 18 months, with repayments beginning four months from disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of craft supplies

loans.name: Tante

texts.en:
Born in 1968, Tante V. is married to Tante Mathais and they have five children, three of whom are still bellow the age of fifteen. Due to the fact that she is unable to assist her husband to take care of the family and the need for capital to add to her business, she joined GHAPE in 2007. Also, she has been having a lot of marital problems which has made her sad a lot of the time, but she is appreciative of the fact that she is alive.

Tante's desire is to give her children love and education. She states that she feels better each time she provides something small to her children. Her inability to get investment capital which could generate income for her to meet her children's needs is what motivated her to obtain a loan from GHAPE. With her previous loan of $40, she succeeded in providing her community with food, chicken and manure.

Given a loan, she plans to buy a bag of groundnut, a bag of Irish potatoes, an umbrella, measuring buckets, a table, fowls and fowl feed. She knows this business will succeed because she is located at a good business site. She plans to use the profits generated to sponsor her children in school and to cater to the basic needs of her family. She plans to repay her loan in 12 months.

loans.use: Tante would like to purchase items to help her business so she can pay for her children's schooling.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
La señora Santusa M.  vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona Munaypata, área peri urbana de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Santusa fabrica buzos deportivos en su taller que tiene en su domicilio, los que vende a una empresa que envía los mismos al interior del país.
La habitación que tiene no le da mucho espacio para que pueda trabajar con las maquinas y le resulta incomodo poder desarrollar su actividad.
El crédito solicitado será para la construcción de una habitación que funcionara como taller de costuras.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Santusa M. lives in her parents' house in the Munaypata neighborhood, in the periphery of the city of La Paz. Santusa makes sweat suits in a workshop that she has in her house. She sells them to a business that ships them to the interior of the country. The room that she has does not have much space for her to work with the machines and this makes it uncomfortable for her to do her work. The loan she is requesting will be for building a room that will function as a sewing workshop. This is the second time that she has requested a loan. She qualifies favorably according to the socioeconomic analysis that has been done and she can obtain a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room to function as a sewing workshop for her business of sewing sweat suits.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
El señor Teodoro C. vive en su vivienda propia en la zona de Llojeta, área suburbana de esta ciudad con su esposa y sus dos hijas.
El señor Teodoro trabaja como empleado en la empresa de agua de la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa vende pescado en los mercados.
El crédito solicitado será destinado a la conclusión en obra fina de dos habitaciones que mejoraran las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. 
Esta es la sexta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Teodoro C. lives in his own house in the neighborhood of Llojeta, a suburban area of this city, with his wife and two daughters. Teodoro works as s an employee at the water company in the city of La Paz and his wife sells fish in the markets. The loan requested will be used to finish up two new bedrooms that will improve living conditions for his children. This is the sixth time he has requested a loan. He qualifies favorably according to the socioeconomic analysis that has been done and he can obtain a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish up work on two new rooms in his house so can give his family a more comfortable place to live.

loans.name: Ndeh

texts.en:
Ndeh P. is married and has six children. Since childhood, P. has been a very hard working man. The death of his two brothers made him to strain himself too much, because he was to continue the education of their children. He tried borrowing money from other financial institutions, but had problems of repaying due to high interest rates. 

With this burden on him, he went to GHAPE, where he could borrow money to invest and care for the children's education and needs. Motivated by his ambitions as a farmer, he joined GHAPE in order to borrow money and also benefit from their numerous trainings on techniques of loan usage and management. He has taken loans seven times and repaid without any problems. 

With the profit from this loan he will be able to maintain himself and the family. He will use this loan to buy farm supplies, including piglets, chicks, seedlings, and a water pump. He plans to repay the loan in 24 months, with the first repayment four months after disbursement.

loans.use: Buy farm supplies

loans.name: Tenjei

texts.en:
Tenjei is married and has six children. He is a very hard working man, as far as educating his children is concerned. He often has the problem of unemployment, since it is a very rampant situation in his community. 

He joined GHAPE and learned loan usage and management techniques which have built his skills and made him who he is today. With this loan, he plans to expand his business to rear pigs. He thinks his business will succeed because the manure he gets from his animal farm will be used to boost the production of vegetables in his community, and he will provide them with pork and red oil for big ceremonies. 

The profit he gets from the business shall be used to pay tuition fees for his children, with the remainder as back capital.

loans.use: Buy motorcycle and pig supplies

loans.name: Mbanwi

texts.en:
M., age 37, is married and has four children. As a young woman M. was treated badly by a relative with whom she was living, and so M. resorted to getting married early to relieve the stress on her. She is a very hard-working woman who produced and sold products, but she encountered a break down when her goods were destroyed inside a transport vehicle that was carrying animals. This caused her to become short on market capital.

It was under this stress that a friend introduced her to GHAPE, from which she took a loan and was able to pay it back. She has also learned loan and business techniques and management skills through GHAPE, which she wants to use to expand her business.

Through her business M. provides the community with soap, omo for washing utensils and bathing, and rubbing oil. She also sells garri, bananas and kernels. She will use the profit to care for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, bananas, garri, pears and kernels.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon C. was born in 1954. He is not married. 

He decided to join GHAPE and took his first loan of $30; since then, he has borrowed and repaid loans six times, using the money to invest in pig farming and cassava and yam cultivation. This business helps his community because he provides them with pork and other foods. The manure from the pigs also helps in the cultivation of vegetables and other foodstuffs.

With this loan he plans to buy piglets, feed, medication, and yam seeds; he also plans to set aside some money for medical services for his pigs.

loans.use: Purchase piglets and yam seeds

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Née en 1966, dame KEGBEGNON Abla est une veuve  avec trois enfants en charge. Les trois enfants sont tous scolarisés et constituent pour elle une grosse charge. Depuis le décès de son mari elle rencontre beaucoup de difficultés pour joindre les deux bouts. Elle est une revendeuse de charbon de bois d’ignames et de maïs mais compte tenu de ses charges les stocks de maïs et d’igname sont épuisés et elle n’arrive pas seule à faire l’approvisionnement.
Raison pour laquelle elle sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter 60 ignames, 2 sacs de maïs et 12 sacs  de charbon de bois.
texts.en:
Born in 1966, Mrs. Abla Kegbegnon is a widow raising three children. The three children are all enrolled in school and so are a big expense for her. Since the death of her husband she has had lots of difficulty making ends meet. She sells charcoal, yams, and corn, but due to her household expenses, her stocks of corn and yams are depleted and she is not able to restock her business.

This is the reason why she is requesting this, her second loan to purchase 60 coco yams, 2 sacks of corn, and 12 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 60 coco yams, 2 sacks of corn, and 12 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Agée de 34 ans, dame A. Adjo est mariée et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle a pour activité, la vente du charbon de bois et du bois de chauffe dans le quartier d’Agoè situé à 12km du centre ville de Lomé. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 6 ans et tire un revenu pour pouvoir accompagner son mari qui est un tailleur dans les dépenses de la famille.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 17 sacs du charbon de bois et 2 tas du bois de chauffe afin de reconstituer son stock pour mieux vendre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjo A., 34, is married and the mother of four children, all enrolled in school. Her business is selling charcoal and firewood in the Agoè district, located 12 km from downtown Lomé. She has been in this business for more than 6 years and it creates income to help her husband, who is a tailor, with the family's living expenses.

She is asking for this, her first loan to purchase 17 sacks of charcoal and two heaps of firewood so that she can expand her inventory and make more sales.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Marta Alberto

texts.pt:
Marta Alberto M. nasceu no bairro periférico da cidade de Maputo e tem 40 anos de idade e mãe de 4 filhos com idade entre 22, 20, 15 e 4 anos de idade respectivamente, para alem dos seu filhos sustenta uma enteada e um sobrinho que vive com e as vezes ajuda os seus pais em um valor monetário.

Marta estudou ate 6ªclasse e parou por falta de condições para custear os seu estudos, nasceu e cresceu juntos com os seus pais, nunca mudou se de cidade ou província, aos 18 anos se casou e desde então vivem de negocio.

Marta a 10 anos que gere um negocio de tipo loja onde vende roupa e diversos produtos de género alimentício. Abre o estabelecimento as 7_00h e fecha as 18:00h, com tudo tem a destacar as roupas com mais rendimento e saída onde vende um fato por 2000,00mt umas calças por 500,00mt, umas saias variando de 400, 500 e 600,00mt respectivamente. Tem um rendimento mensal variando entre 20000,00mt a 25000,00mt.

Este será o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva com qual pretende aumentar as suas mercadorias e diversificação dos produtos. Conhece a Hluvuku através de amigas que eram clientes. Com o crescimento do negocio pretende construir uma mercearia e uma viatura com tudo conta com apoio do credito.
texts.en:
Marta Alberto M. was born on the outskirts of the city of Maputo and is 40 years old with four children. They're aged 22, 20, 15, and 4, respectively. Besides her children, she supports a stepdaughter and a nephew, who live with them, and sometimes she helps her parents financially. Maria studied until 6th grade and quit due to lack of resources to fund her studies. She was born and raised with her parents, never moving from the city or state. At 18 years old she married, and since then has made her living in business. For the last ten years, Marta has managed a business selling clothing and various food items. She opens the establishment at 7 in the morning and closes at 6 in the evening. She needs to increase income and sales. She sells a suit for 2000 meticais, pants for 500, and skirts for 400, 500, or 600 meticais. She has a monthly income varying between 20000 and 25000 meticais. This will be her first loan with Hluvuku or Kiva. She plans to increase her merchandise and diversification of products. She heard of Hluvuku through friends who were clients. With the growth of her business, she plans to construct a store and get transport. For all of this, she counts on credit.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of clothing and food

loans.name: Zinatou

texts.fr:
Agée de 21 ans, dame A. R. Zinatou est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle a pour activité la vente de foulard et de vêtement pour enfant. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2005 au moment où elle réside à Sotouboua dans la région centrale du Togo.
Actuellement, elle vit avec son mari qui est un chauffeur de taxis à Lomé.
L’activité de A. R. Zinatou consiste à vendre ses marchandises de quartier en quartier. Elle parcourt en moyenne 14km à pieds par jour.
Elle désire augmenter son stock avec 2 douzaines de foulards et 5 douzaines de vêtement pour enfant afin de pouvoir bien vendre raison pour laquelle elle sollicite ce premier crédit.
texts.en:
Ms. Zinatou A. R., age 21, is married and the mother of one child. Her work involves selling scarves and clothing for children. She started this business in 2005 when she lived in Sotouboua in the middle of Togo. Currently, she lives with her husband who is a taxi driver in Lomé. She sells merchandise from district to district covering on foot a 14-km course on average each day. She would like to increase her inventory with two dozen scarves and five dozen pieces of children's clothing in order to do well in her sales. This is why she is requesting this initial loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy some children's scarfs and clothing

loans.name: António Filipe

texts.pt:
António Filipe Z. é natural da cidade da Matola uma zona que dista a 15 km da cidade de Maputo, tem 46 anos de idade, é casado e pai de 3 filhos com idade entre primeiro 14, 12 e 6 meses de idade respectivamente. Para alem dos seus filhos e esposa sustenta a sogra e a sua mãe enviando dinheiros mensalmente.

António estudou até 10ªclasse quando jovem e abandonou para ir a Republica Sul-africana trabalhar e neste momento frequenta 11ªclasse. Sempre viveu em Boane excepto quando foi trabalhar na RSA como infiltrado.( pessoas que entra no pais ilegalmente).

António é funcionário da educação a 10 anos como docente,  tendo se formado no instituto do magistério primário de Maputo. Tem um salário mensal de 2900,00mt trabalha das 12:10 as 17:30h. Este é o terceiro empréstimo para António e os dois primeiros destinou para compra de material de construção e este é para continuação com projecto. constitui grande sonho para António a continuar com os estudos aumentando assim o seu nível académico.
texts.en:
António Filipe Z., 46, married, was born in the city of Matola, in Mozambique. He currently lives in Boane and is the father of three children, ages 14,12 and 6 months. In addition to supporting his family, every month he sends money to help support his mother and mother in law. His studies were interrupted in 10th grade, when he left Mozambique to go work illegally in the Republic of South Africa. He is now enrolled in the 11th grade. ... Republica Sul-africana trabalhar e neste momento frequenta 11ªclasse. Since 1998 he has been working as an elementary teacher. He graduated from the magistério primário de Maputo. His monthly salary as a teacher is 2900,00 mt and his work schedule is 12:10-5:30 pm. This is his third loan cycle applied to buying construction material to build his house. His dream is to continue his studies and better his academic level. TRANSLATION NOT COMPLETE BUT NAOMI REPORTED IT AS A DUPLICATE.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction material to finish building his house

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Isabel M. nasceu na província de Gaza tem 48 anos de idade é casada maritalmente e mãe de 5 filhos e o mais velhos tem 29 anos de idade e os mais novos são gémeos e estudam na 9ªclasse, para alem dos seus filhos sustenta dois sobrinhos que vive com eles.

Isabel estudou ate 6ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus pais, em 1977 incorporou se nas forças armadas de Moçambique e em 1981 foi desmobilizada, desde 1981 trabalha com civil no hospital militar como assistente  administrativa.

Funcionaria do ministério da defesa a Maios de 20 anos com um horário das 7:30 ate as 15:30 tem um salário mensal de 2779,21mt . este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva nunca teve noutras instituições. Os dois primeiros foram aplicados na construção da sua residência e com pretende fazer os acabamentos e construção do muro de vedação.

Assim num futuro tão breve pretende mobilar a casa e conta com apoio de credito.
texts.en:
Isabel M., 48, married, was born in the city of Gaza, in Mozambique. She is the mother of 5 children. Her oldest son is 29 years old, and her youngest, enrolled in the first year of high school, are twins. In addition to supporting her own kids she provides for two nephews, who live with them. Due to lack of financial resources, her studies were interrupted in 6th grade. She joined the military in 1977 forças armadas de Moçambique... until 1981, when she was....desmobilizada... and started working in a Military Hospital as an administrative assistant. She's been working full-time for the Department of Defense for over 20 years with a monthly salary of 2779,21 MT. This is her third loan cycle with Hluvuku and the first through Kiva. Her first two loans were used to build her house and now she pretends to invest the money from this loan on finishing touches and insulation. In the future with the help of another loan, she hopes to furnish her house. TRANSLATION INCOMPLETE BUT NAOMI SUBMITTED AS A DUPLICATE

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de material de construçao

loans.name: Guilherme Filimone

texts.pt:
Guilherme Filimone M. natural de Boane um dos distrito da província de Maputo, tem 32 anos de idade é casado maritalmente e pai de dois filhos, o primeiro com 6 anos e o segundo com 1 ano de idades respectivamente. Apenas sustenta a sua família.

Guilherme estudou até 12ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras, nasceu na vila sede do distrito de Boane e neste momente vive a 25 km desta vila, tendo se mudado quando foi contratado pela empresa de gestão da barragem dos pequenos libombos e lá se casou.

Trabalhador dos pequenos libombos a 12 anos como observador na barragem, ainda nao tem casa própria vive na casa dos serviços, para Guilherme este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva e nunca teve noutras instituições. Constitui sonho para Guilherme abrir um negocio qual consistira na vende de produtos de primeira necessidade e diz conta com o credito.
texts.en:
Guilherme Filimone M. was born in Boane, one of the districts in the province of Maputo. He is 32 years old, married, and father of two children – a six-year-old and a one-yea-old. He only provides for his family. Guilherme studied up to the 12th grade and then stopped due to lack of funds. He was born in the main village of the Boane district, and now lives 25 km from that village. He moved away when he was hired by the dam management company on the small “libombos.” He also got married there. Guilherme has worked on the small “libombos” for 12 years as an observer on the dam. He does not yet have his own house, so he lives in a house on the work site. This is Guilherme’s first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva, and he has never taken out a loan before with any other institution. It is his dream to open a small business selling basic goods with this credit.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier C. C. tiene domicilio propio en la zona de Pasankeri, área suburbana de esta ciudad. Es casado y tiene dos hijas.
Javier tiene instalado un taller de carpintería en casa, pero el espacio es muy reducido y no le permite desenvolverse con comodidad, lo cual va a perjudicarle en caso de comprar mas herramientas y maquinaria, es por eso que solicita un préstamo con el fin de ampliar el ambiente.

Nos enorgullece decir que es su quinto préstamo y que el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente, por lo tanto, puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Javier C. C. has his own home in the Pasankeri zone, a suburban area of the city. He is married and has two daughters. Javier has set up a carpentry workshop in his house, but the space is very limited and does not allow him to move around comfortably. This will be detrimental for him if he buys more tools and machinery. For this reason he is asking for a loan in order to expand the area. We are proud to say that this is his fifth loan and a socioeconomic analysis evaluates him favorably. For this reason, he may obtain a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction (expand carpentry workshop)

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa M. vive en la Avenida Franz Tamayo, zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto
 
Felipa es casada y tiene una hija de 1 año, toda la familia vive en un solo cuarto que tomaron en alquiler

Ella trabaja como vendedora ambulante de mates y empanadas en horarios matinales por las calles donde se realizan ferias diariamente. 

El crédito lo destinara  para compra de insumos al por mayor, así disminuirá sus costos
 
Es su primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Felipa M. lives on Franz Tamayo Avenue, in the Villa Ingenio zone of the city of El Alto. Felipa is married and has a 1-year-old daughter. The whole family lives in a single room that they are renting out. She works as a street vendor, selling mates (a type of South American herbal tea) and empanadas (stuffed pastry) daily during the morning hours on the streets near the markets. The loan will be used to purchase wholesale supplies, thus she can cut down on her costs. This is her first loan with Impro. Her credit evaluation qualifies her to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel  P.  vive en la calle Barrio Lindo  de la zona Alto Chamaco Chico en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Daniel vive junto a su esposa y su hija de 8 años en la casa de  sus suegros

Mientras él es chofer de una empresa, su esposa trabaja como vendedora en un negocio de artículos alimenticios.

El crédito será destinado para poder iniciar un negocio propio el cual será atendido por su esposa en una zona comercial de la ciudad de El Alto. 
 
Este es su primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica favorablemente, por eso, esperamos que lo ayuden a impulsar su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Daniel P. lives in the Barrio Lindo neighbhorhood, Alto Chamaco Chico zone, in the city of El Alto.

Daniel lives with his wife and 8-year old daughter in the home of his in-laws.

While he works as a chauffer for a company, his wife works as a saleswoman at a food products business.

The loan would be destined to start their own business, which would be tended to by his wife, in a commercial zone in the city of El Alto.

This is his first credit with IMPRO, and the evaluation conducted indicates he is favorably qualified. For this reason, we hope that you will help him get started in his endeavor.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.en: Mujeres Del Nuevo Renacer is a group of 15 very eager women who are all ready to start their own businesses. Balbina S. is the chosen representative of this group, and is very proud to be leading her friends. Balbina is a hardworking mother of 2 young children. She is planning on using her loan to start a small beauty salon from her house. She hopes to have a thriving business one day, and her dream is to have enough money to remodel her house. She wants to be able to provide her family with all the basic necessities and live a comfortable life. These women all realize that this could be their chance to change their future, and all of them are ready to take the first step in bettering their lives. On behalf of Balbina, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To start a beauty salon

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married. She and her husband Valeryi who serves in the military raise two wonderful daughters – 9 and 5 years old. Irina is a successful small entrepreneur selling women’s footwear in the local market of Melitopol where she is originally from. Irina started this business 4 years ago. She has benefited a lot from Nadiya Ukraine loans. Her business has grown to turnover capital of about $1600. Her gross income is about $1000 a month. Net profits amounts to $400.

Irina is constantly seeking ways to develop her business and promote its consistent growth. She is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas to purchase additional stock for fall/winter season and attract more customers to her kiosk. She is hoping to invest some generated profit in purchase of new furniture for her family and also make savings for a future private house buy which has been the dream of all their family for a long time.

loans.use: increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is divorced. She has a grown daughter Yelena and little grandson Svyatoslav. Nina sells clothing in one of the local marketplaces in Melitopol. She is an experienced vendor who has worked in this sphere of trade for about 12 years. Currently, she has about $4000 in inventory. Her gross income is about $1600 a month. Net profit amounts to $400.

Nina is seeking a 5000 Grivna loan to diversify assortment of inventory she offers for sale in her kiosk before fall/winter season. She is determined to work hard and invest much energy in her enterprise as she wants to see it flourish and succeed as every focused entrepreneur. Nina is willing to stay on the run for she has many people she is responsible for – her daughter, little grandson and elderly father who is 90 now. Nina loves her pace of life and looks into the future with much optimism and enthusiasm. She is hoping to repay the current loan in 7 months.

loans.use: increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Faauma

texts.en:
Faauma A. F., 54, is married with 7 children. She has many years of experience in the cabbages, cucumbers, tomatoes and pumpkins business. She sells to the villages and the public 3 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Faauma's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy a sack of fertilizers, vegetable seeds, a spade, a shovel and a knife for her vegetable business. Her husband helps her in operating the business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds, spade, shovel and knife

loans.name: Taufaiesea

texts.en:
Taufaiesea L., 36, is married with two children. She has two years of experience in the popcorn, pork buns and ice-block business. She sells to the public and villagers five days per week. 

She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~$145 USD). SPBD loans are Taufaiesea's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. 

Her loan will be used to buy corn seed, sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, foam cups for the ice-block and yeast. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: Purchase to buy corn seed, sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, foam cups and yeast

loans.name: Faleseu

texts.en:
Faleseu R., 45, is married with eight children. She has many years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the village people and public six days per week. 

She has six previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Faleseu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

Part of the loan will be used to finance what is needed for home renovation and school fees for her kids. Her husband does the farming.

loans.use: Purchase another sewing machine, needles, pins, thread, rolls of material and cement, timber and school fees

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives with her mother, daughter, and a granddaughter. They are from Simferopol, which is in the south of Ukraine on the Crimean peninsula. Anna is a private entrepreneur who sells household items in one of the local stores. Anna has been in this trade for two years. Her current income is over $400 a month.

Anna has had several previous loans from Nadiya Ukraine. Other entrepreneurs characterize her as a consistent and reliable market expert who is capable of repaying her loans without delinquency. Anna is seeking a 5000 Grivna loan ($900 USD) to increase her turnover capital. She plans to invest some of her profit in repair work for her house. Anna's business is the only source of income for the family of four. She is hoping to keep her business running and growing as a stable enterprise.

loans.use: increase turnover capital

loans.name: Tiaga

texts.en:
Tiaga Leana, 43, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the banana and taro business. She sells to the villagers and the public 3 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Tiaga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, cromoxzone, a spade, a shovel and bush knives for the plantation. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, cromoxzone, spade, shovel, and bush knives

loans.name: Mu

texts.en:
Mu P., 35, is married with 7 children. She has many years of experience in the banana and taro business. She sells to the villagers and the public 4 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).

SPBD loans are Mu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, cromoxzone, a spade, a shovel and bush knives for the plantation. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, cromoxzone, spade, shovel and bush knives

loans.name: Senerita

texts.en: Senerita M., 23, is married with two children. She has 4 years of experience in the Flea Market business. She sells to the public 6 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Senerita's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of her loan will be used to finance what is needed for the business, buying kava bowls, siapo, fine mats, elei materials, earrings, and other handicrafts to resell at her flea market. Her husband doesn't work but helps out with the business.

loans.use: Senerita would like to handicrafts to resell at her flea market.

loans.name: Maxim

texts.en:
