Maxim is married to Irina. He is a businessman from Simferopol. He owns a small hairstyle salon offering different types of services for women clients. Maxim started his business about two years ago. He also owns a second enterprise selling clothing in one of the local retail stores. Currently, he has about $20,000 invested in inventory.

Maxim is very committed to his venture. He has used 10 loans from Nadiya Ukraine to expand his trade and see his business consistently growing. This time Maxim is requesting a 3000 Grivna loan to increase his turnover capital and generate additional income as a result. Maxim is hoping to invest additional income in a purchase of his own apartment where he would move with his wife. Housing question has been a crucial issue for this family and Maxim is hoping to finally see his dream fulfill as they move out of the house of his wife’s parents and start living apart from them as a separate family.     


Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: increase turnover capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria I., 36, is married and has three children. She has five years of experience making and selling ice cakes and pancakes. She sells her products six days per week. She has three previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala ($187 USD).  SPBD loans are Maria's only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy ingredients for the business like plastic cups, sugar, Kool aid, vegetable oil, and flour. One of her daughters helps her with the business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Raul Boris

texts.es:
Raúl Ibañez es soltero,  vive en casa de sus abuelos en la calle Sánchez Lima de la zona de sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz., trabaja como portero en una iglesia donde le pagan un sueldo mínimo, hace lo que puede con tan miserable paga (550 Bolivianos mensuales o 67 dólares al mes). Es por eso que solicita crédito  para tramitar sus documentos de bachiller y así poder estudiar en alguna universidad. Desde muy pequeño Raúl ha sido independiente (sus padres nunca lo apoyaron), ahora quiere ser profesional.

Su historial es bueno y puede acceder al crédito.
texts.en:
Raúl Ibañez is single and lives in his grandparents’ house on Sánchez Lima street in the Sopocachi neighborhood of La Paz. He works as a doorman at a church where they pay him a minimum salary. He does what he can with such miserable pay (550 Bolivianos per month, or $67.00 per month). Because of this, he is requesting a loan to process his high school graduation documents so that he can study at a university. Raúl has been independent since he was very young (his parents never supported him). He would like to be a professional. His credit history is good and so he can obtain a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en: Sesilia S., 32, is married and has five children.  She has four years of experience in the ice cake and pancake business. She sells her products six days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala ($187 USD).  SPBD loans are Sesilia's only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy ingredients for the business like plastic cups, sugar, Kool aid, vegetable oil, and flour. One of her daughters helps her with the business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Vaimaila

texts.en:
Vaimaila T., 55 and married with five children, has many years of experience in the fish business, selling to the village and general public four days per week while her husband and two boys do the actual fishing. She has received two previous loans with SPBD, her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

Vaimaila expects her weekly net cash flow to soon rise to $208, and she plans to use both her earningss and the loan she is currently requesting to improve her business and help out the family through some home improvements.

loans.use: To purchase a new boat, goggles, spear, cement, bricks, and timber

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie A. F., 37, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the tomatoes, cabbages, and cucumber business. She sells to the villagers and the public 7 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Jessie's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to purchase chemicals, pesticides, vegetable seeds, a spade and a shovel in order to make her vegetable farm more reliable.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, pesticides, vegetable seeds, spade and shovel

loans.name: Luz Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela G. vive en la calle caupolican de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz . Gabriela  es madre soltera, tiene una hija de  13 años, actualmente paga el alquiler de dos habitaciones y una pequeña cocina. Para obtener ingresos Gabriela presta un servicio de amplificación para fiestas y eventos similares en las diferentes zonas de la ciudad de La Paz. Solicita  crédito para comprar una pantalla gigante, lo cuál le permitirá hacer cobros extra por sus servicios

Su historial es bastante confiable, por eso, califica para obtener un nuevo credito.
texts.en:
Gabriela G. lives on Caupolican Street in the Tembladerani district of the city of La Paz. She is a single mother of a 13-year-old daughter. Currently Gabriela is renting an apartment with two bedrooms and a small kitchen. To earn a living, she rents out amplifiers at parties and similar events throughout La Paz. Gabriela is requesting a loan to purchase a large projection screen, which will allow her to charge extra for her services. Gabriela has a reliable credit history. As such, she qualifies to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia, 25, is married with 1 child.  She has 4 years of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the villagers and the public 5 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Verginia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy boxes of mutton flaps, chicken franks, sausage, onions and soya for her BBQ business. Her older sister is helping her with the business.

loans.use: Purchase to buy mutton flaps,chicken franks, sausage, soya, onions, salt,etc

loans.name: Lusi

texts.en: Lusi F., 45, is married with three children. She has five years of experience in an ice cake, pop corn and chips business. She sells to the villagers and the public six days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 550 Tala (229 USD). SPBD loans are Lusi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy ingredients needed for her business, like corn seeds, Kool-Aid, sugar, vegetable oil, sacks of flour and plastic papers. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients needed for her business

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia F., 26 and married with two children, has three years of experience in the fish business, selling to the village and general public three days per week. She has received one previous loan from SPBD, her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks.  

Malia expects her weekly net cash flow to soon rise to $187,  and any additional earnings that arise from her loan request will be reinvested in her business and contribute to the renovation of her home.

loans.use: To purchase fishing rods, spears, a canoe, and cement for home improvements

loans.name: Leafa

texts.en:
Leafa I., 42, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the taro/banana business. She sells to the villagers and the public 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Leafa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy chemicals, pesticide, fertilizers and farming tools like a spade, a knife and a shovel. Her husband helps her in operating the business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, pesticides, farming tools

loans.name: Pala

texts.en: Pala T., 25, is married. She has many years of experience in the taro/banana business. She sells to the villagers and the public two days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about $208 USD). SPBD loans are Pala's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy chemicals, pesticides, bush knives, spades, and shovels. Her husband helps her with her taro/banana business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, pesticides, bush knives, spades and shovels

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria V., 53, is married with six children. She has five years of experience in the beans, cabbage, tomato and cucumber business. She sells to the villagers and the public four days per week. 

She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Maria's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. 

She will use her loan to buy chemicals, pesticides, vegetable seeds, a spade and shovel. Her husband is lending a helping hand in operating the business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, pesticides, vegetable seeds, a spade and shovel

loans.name: Litara

texts.en:
Litara W., 47, is married with 4 children. She has 3 years of experience in the pork cake business. She sells to the villagers and the public 6 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Litara's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy a sack of flour, pork, soya beans, a bag of onions, a sack of salt and garlic. Her husband helps her in operating the business.

loans.use: Purchase flour, pork, soya sauce, onions, salt, garlic

loans.name: Fale

texts.en:
Fale T., 30, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 4 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Fale's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy weed killer, pesticides, chemicals, gromozone, knives and sharpeners. Her husband is lending a great help in operating the business.

loans.use: buy  weedkiller, pesticides, chemicals, gromozones, knives, sharpeners

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Pepe M., 49, is married and has four children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation/fishing business. She sells to the village people four days per week. She has five previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala ($208 USD).  SPBD loans are Pepe's only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with  traditional banks. She will used her loan to buy fishing nets, goggles, spears, and a canoe. Her husband is one of the very professional fisherman in the village.

loans.use: Purchase fishing net, goggles, spear, and a canoe

loans.name: Reyna De Los Angeles

texts.es: Reyna tiene 36 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo Eduardo. Tuvieron tres hijos, pero uno de ellos ya está casado. Sus otros dos hijos tienen 8 y 10 años de edad y actualmente cursan la educación primaria. Reyna trabaja en una zona franca, oficio en el cual devenga un bajo salario, pero su marido la apoya en los gastos familiares. Debido a los bajos ingresos de la familia no han podido mejorar su vivienda, es por eso que están en la necesidad de un préstamo. El techo de su vivienda está en muy mal estado y las lluvias les está afectando su vivienda. Con el préstamo comprará láminas de zinc para cambiarlas y así poder ir mejorando su casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
Reyna is 36 years old. She lives in the town of Ticuatepe with her husband Eduardo. They have three children, one of whom is married. Their two other children are 8 and 10 years old and are currently in grade school. Reyna works in a free trade area, where she earns a small salary. Nevertheless, her husband helps cover household costs. Because of the family's small earnings, they haven't been able to improve their home. For this reason, they find themselves needing a loan. The roof of their house is in very bad condition -- so much so that rain is damaging the house. They will use the loan to purchase roof sheeting made of zinc to replace the old sheeting and, in this way, improve their house little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair roof of their house

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan N. tiene un taller de costuras donde confecciona pantalones deportivos para niños y adultos. Sus productos son comercializados por docenas y circulan en  toda la ciudad de El Alto, el negocio le permite mantener a sus dos hermanos pequeños que son huérfanos y asisten a la escuela estatal. Juan y los niños viven en la casa de su tio quien no les hace pagar alquiler, en retribución Juan emplea a su primo como ayudante en temporadas de mayor demanda, su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Pedro Domingo Murillo de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de materia prima (tela) para confeccionar sets completos de ropa deportiva (pantalón y chaqueta), consolidar su microempresa, generar mayores ingresos y fuentes de trabajo. 
 
Es su primer  crédito con Impro pero dados los sorprendentes resultados de su negocio, podemos decir que es apto para el préstamo.
texts.en:
Juan N. owns a sewing workshop in which he produces sports pants for both children and adults. His products are sold by the dozens and are distributed all around the city of El Alto. The business allows him to support his two young brothers, who are orphans and attend a state school. Juan and his brothers live in their uncle’s house. Since his uncle does not make them pay rent, Juan employs his cousin as an assistant during peak seasons in recompense. Their house is located in the Pedro Domingo Murillo zone in the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to purchase the materials (fabric) needed to make complete sports suits (pants and jackets), to strengthen his small business, and to generate more jobs and income. This is his first loan with Impro, but due to his surprising business results, it is safe to say that he is fit to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
Yola M. es empleada en un salón de peinados, también tiene una tienda de abarrotes. Su esposo es empleado de costura en un taller particular, la pareja tiene un hijo pequeño y vive en la casa de sus padres (Yola tiene dos hermanos, los cuales ven en la fotografía) ubicada en la zona  Tahuantinsuyo de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito será destinado para incrementar la mercadería de la tienda de abarrotes, así podrá incrementar sus ingresos en menos tiempo, lo que le permitirá mantener a su familia´.
 
Es su primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica favorablemente.
texts.en:
Yola M. works in a hair salon and owns a small convenience store. Her husband works as a tailor in a private workshop. The couple have a small son and live in their parents' home in the Tahuantinsuyo district of the city of El Alto. (Yola has two brothers, who appear in the photograph.) The loan will be used to expand the merchandise in Yola's convenience store. This will allow her to increase her revenue in little time, which in turn will help her support her family. An assessment conducted by Impro qualifies Yola for her first loan with the organization.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roberto  Antonio C. tiene la edad de 48 años de edad habita en el sector de la Borgoña, Ticuantepe con su esposa Rosa Emilia Ortiz  ama de casa que a la vez le ayuda a su marido en el campo cortando piña y dándole mantenimiento a la misma, ellos tienen a cargo 2 hijos, una adolescente de 17 años y otra de 19 años que también apoyan a sus padres en las tierras cultivadas. Este señor tiene 20 años de trabajar en sus tierras y necesita apoyo para darle mantenimiento a la producción ya que no consta con recursos para poder ejercer dicha actividad. Por lo cual necesita C$ 8,000.00 córdobas pagando el monto en un año.
texts.en:
Roberto Antonio C. is 48 years old and lives in the Borgoña district of Ticuantepe with his wife Rosa Emilia Ortiz. Rosa is a housekeeper who also helps Roberto cut and prepare pineapple in the field. Together they have two daughters, ages 17 and 19. They also help their parents in the fields. Roberto has been a farmer for 20 years. He needs support to maintain his production, seeing he currently does not have sufficient resources. For this reason, he needs a loan of 8,000 Nicaraguan córdobas [about US$ 425], which will be paid back in one year.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for growing pineapple

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria F. tiene taller de costuras, junto a dos operarios (sus hermanos de 18 y 21 años de edad) confecciona chamarras para varones. Su marido trabaja en la ciudad de Cochabamba, la pareja tiene una hija de 5 años de edad pero Maria espera sus segundo hijo (lleva 4 meses de embarazo). 

Maria vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la Zona Brasil de Rio Seco, ciudad de El Alto.

Piensa usar el monto crediticio para comprar materia prima (tela) y confeccionar mayor número de  chamarras que se puedan llevar a la frontera con Perú (Desaguadero). 
 
Es su cuarto crédito con Impro, su buen comportamiento de pago es una buena garantía
texts.en:
Maria F. owns a sewing workshop. With two partners (her brothers, ages 18 and 21), she makes men's jackets. Maria's husband works in the city of Cochabamba. The couple have a 5-year-old daughter and Maria is expecting her second child (she is 4 months pregnant). Maria lives in her parents' house located in the Zona Brasil de Rio Seco district of the city of El Alto. She plans to use the loan to purchase materials (fabric) and make a greater number of jackets, which can be brought to the Peruvian border (Desaguadero) for sale. This is Maria's fourth loan with Impro. Her good payment history is an indicator of her ability to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena D. Álvarez tiene la edad de 36 años de edad habita en los Madrigales Nortes del municipio de Ticuantepe con su compañero de vida José Luís González, este señor es contratista y tiene un ingreso de C$ 3,800.00 córdobas tienen a cargo a 2 hijos que estudian primaria. Esta señora es comerciante   distribuye productos de la compañía de belleza llamada ZERMAT,  tiene dos años de trabajar con esta empresa y su sueño es tener mas condiciones de vida, por lo cual quieren comprar 12 laminas de zinc, 7 cuartones de pino, 11 reglas de pino, 10 libra de clavo de 3 “, 5 libra de clavo de zinc y un galón de pintura. Para lo cual no tienen los suficientes recursos y optaron por hacer un préstamo de C$ 5,000.00 córdobas  pagando la cantidad prestada en 9 meses
texts.en:
Maria Elena D. Álvarez is 36 years old and lives in the Madrigales Nortes of the municipality of Ticuantepe with her partner José Luís González. He is a contractor and has an income of C$ 3,800.00 córdobas. They care for their 2 children who are in primary school. She is a salesperson and distributes products for the ZERMAT beauty company. She has been working with this business for two years and her dream is to have better living conditions which is why she wants to buy 12 sheets of zinc, 7 wooden doors, 11 wooden boards, 10 pounds of 3" nails, 5 pounds of zinc and a gallon of paint. Because they do not have enough resources they decided to take a loan of C$ 5,000.00 córdobas, paying the amount borrowed in 9 months.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make improvements to her housing

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin Peña tiene un taller donde realiza servicios  de muellería en automóviles y mantenimiento de los mismos en general. Su esposa es comerciante de camisas a detalle en la feria de la calle  Tumusla (feria popular de la ciudad de La Paz). Con ambas ocupaciones apenas cubren la  manutención de sus 6 hijos de 16, 14, 12, 10, 6, 4 años de edad. La familia vive en la casa de sus padres (no pagan alquiler) ubicada en la Zona Villa Huayna Potosí de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito será usado para comprar maquinaria (compresora y una gata hidráulica semi industrial) para facilitar y agilizar su trabajo. 
 
Es su cuarto crédito con Impro, su buen comportamiento de pago le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Martin Peña has a workshop where provides bodywork and general maintenance services for automobiles. His wife is a shirt seller in the Tumusla Street Market (popular market in the city of La Paz). With both occupations they just cover the basic needs of their 6 children who are 16, 14, 12, 10, 6, 4 years old. They live in her parents’ house (they do not pay rent) located in the Villa Huayna Potosí zone of the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to purchase machinery (compressor and a semi-industrial hydraulic press) to facilitate and improve his work. It is her fourth loan with Impro and her good payment behavior permits her to access another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Machinery

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es:
Alejo es carpintero, realiza muebles, puertas y ventanas a pedido. Tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos son sus ayudantes, el negocio le permite mantener dignamente a la familia, su esposa esta a cargo del hogar y no trabaja. La familia paga alquileres de una casa ubicada en la zona Franz Tamayo de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (madera). Es su primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Alejo is a carpenter. He makes furniture, doors and windows by order. He has 4 children, two of which are his helpers. The business allows him to support his family with dignity. His wife is in charge of the home and does not work. The family pays rent for a home located in the zone of Franz Tamayo in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase materials such as wood. This is his first loan with Impro; the evaluation conducted qualified him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Gregoria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Gregoria tiene 48 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Laureles Norte, casada y con tres hijos mayores de edad de 18, 20 y 28 años de edad, el hijo mayor ya trabaja y es independiente los otros dos están estudiando la universidad, su esposo es comerciante y vende películas en un mercado de la ciudad, lo cual le va bien por que se venden bastantes.
El negocio de Sra. Gregoria es la venta de ropa y comida, con veinticinco años de experiencias, inició con fondos propios que su esposo le dio para invertir. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para comprar ropa ya que se aproxima la temporada en donde las ventas son bastantes buenas lo cual espera obtener buenas utilidades asì como captar màs clientes y seguir creciendo en las ventas. A largo plazo es poder mantener su negocio, desea remodelar el local en que vende para atender en mejores condiciones a sus clientes, seguir ayudando a sus hijos en la educación para que sean hombres de bien ante esta sociedad.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 48 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Laureles Norte. She is married and has three grown children ages 18, 20 and 28. Her oldest son is now on his own and working, and the other two are studying at the university. Her husband works selling movies at a market in the city, which is going well as quite a few are purchased.

The business of Gregoria is the sale of clothing and food. She has 28 years of experience, and started with her own funds that were given to her by her husband to invest. This request for a loan is to buy clothes now that the next season is approaching and, during which, sales are brisk so she hopes to capture new customers and continue to grow her number of transactions. Long term, she hopes to look after her business and wants to remodel the location where she sells so she can tend to her customers under better conditions. She also wants to continue helping her children with their educations so they will become men of good standing in their communities.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase children's clothing.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Maria es madre soltera de dos hijos de 22 y 25 años de edad, los cuales ya están casados e independiente, tiene 50 años de edad, y habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Monseñor Lezcano, doña Maria le ha tocado trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a sus hijos en sus necesidades, ella tiene una pulpería que desde hace veinte cuatro años administra,  comenzó con dinero propio ya que anteriormente solo vendía verduras ambulante, ahora con la facilidad del crédito ha invertido mas en su negocio. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para comprar productos de consumos y así ofertar variedad de productos a sus clientes. A futuro es incrementar el volumen de ventas y así obtener mejores utilidades, como mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is the single mother of two children of 22 and 25 years of age, who are already married and independent. She is 50 years old and lives in a neighborhood in the capital of Managua that is called Monseñor Lezcano. Maria has had to work from a young age to support her children in their needs. She has a small grocery store that she has administered for the past four years. She started it with her own money as she had previously just sold vegetables as a travelling salesperson. Now with a loan she has invested more in her business. This loan request is to purchase consumable products and in this way offer a variety of products to her clients. In the future she wants to increase the volume of sales and through this obtain better tools as well as improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Sara Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Sara tiene 34 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama 380, tiene dos hijos de 5 y 10 años de edad, es madre soltera, los niños están estudiando, doña Sra. es ama de casa pues cuenta con la ayuda del padre de los niños que les da una ayuda y su hermano esta en el extranjero y le manda remesas pues ha corrido con la suerte que su familia la apoyado. Con la solicitud de crédito es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de cerámica para ponerla en el piso del porche y así estar en mejores condiciones y gozar de una casa digna para sus hijos. A futuro es poder tener un empleo que le permita dar mejores condiciones a sus hijos, ya que hasta ahora se le ha hecho difícil encontrarlo.
texts.en:
Sara is 34 years old, lives in a neighborhood that is called 380, has two children ages 5 and 10 years of age, and is a single mother. The children are in school. She is a homemaker as she has the help of the father of her children and her brother who lives abroad and sends her remittances, so she has had the luck of her family’s support. With the loan application is for infrastructure to purchase the ceramic materials to put it on the porch floor and in this way have better conditions and enjoy a dignified house for her children. In the future she would like to have a job that will allow her to provide better conditions for her children, but until now it has been difficult to find it.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tiles for the floor of her home

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: la Sra. Martha, casada y con dos hermoso hijos de 10 y 17 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando, tiene 38 años de edad, y habita en un barrio que se llama Memorial Sandino, su esposo es comerciante en venta de queso. Doña Martha tiene una pulpería y vende también verduras desde hace dos años, e inicio con fondos propios que su esposo le dio, comenzó solo con venta de ropa, pero tuvo la iniciativa de poner una pulpería en su casa que le permitiera obtener mejores ganancias. Con la solicitud de préstamos es para invertir en capital en la compra de granos básicos y productos enlatados y otros, para ofertar siempre la variedad de productos a sus clientes. A futuro es captar otros clientes, obtener mejores ingresos a si como ayudar a sus hijos en la educación de los estudios.
texts.en:
Martha, married and with two beautiful children who are 10 and 17, both of whom are in school, is 38 years old and lives in a neighborhood that is called Memorial Sandino. Her husband is a cheese salesman. Martha has a small grocery store and has also sold vegetables for the past two years. She started with her own funds and from her husband, beginning only with clothing sale, but she took the initiative to put a small grocery store in her house that would allow her to obtain higher earnings. This loan request is to invest in capital for the purchase of basic grains and canned products and others to always offer a variety of products to her clients. In the future she would like to gain other clients, obtain a higher income as well as to help her children in their education.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and canned goods.

loans.name: Lester Trinidad

texts.es: El señor Lester  de la Trinidad R. tiene la edad de 26 años, labora como conductor desde  hace 4 años para personas particulares, él habita en el barrio Madrigales Norte del municipio de Ticuantepe, acompañado de su esposa e hijos los cuales son menores de edad, 3 de sus hijos estudian secundaria y dos de sus otros hijos primaria, tienen una edad entre 5  a 14 años de edad y un pequeño de un año de vida. Su esposa Rebeca Delgado trabaja de doméstica en una casa particular para ayudarle con los gastos de alimentación para sus pequeños. Ellos requieren de un crédito en para mejora las condiciones de vida, por lo consiguiente ellos van invertir en 4 la construcción de un anexo a su vivienda
texts.en:
Mr. Lester de la Trinidad R. is 26 years old and has worked for 4 years as a driver for private individuals. He lives in the Madrigales Norte neighborhood of Ticuantepe with his wife and young children. 3 of his children are in secondary school and 2 are in primary school, and their ages range from 5 to 14 years old and they have a one year old son. His wife Rebeca Delgado works as a domestic employee in a private home to help with the costs of feeding their children. They need a loan to improve their living conditions, as they will invest in the construction of an annex to their home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build an annex on his home

loans.name: Margarita Del Carmen

texts.es: Cliente inicio su negocio hace 3 años, en su casa de habitación, por la demanda de la población solicitaron permiso a la alcaldía de Nindiri para trasladar el local donde esta  ubicado,  a la orilla de la calle  de la entrada principal a la comarca Campuzano, en el municipio de nindiri,  Comenzó ofertando solo productos de la canasta básica, debido a que es una mujer emprendedora y con mucha capacidad en los negocios , lo fortaleció con la introducción de mas productos tales como, perecederos, lácteos, carnes etc.actualmente el negocio oferta una gran variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Doña Margarita es madre de 2 hijos  los cuales con la ayuda de su esposo los ha sacado adelante, ella sueña con tener en el futuro su propio local.
texts.en:
The client started her business 3 years ago in her home. Due to the demand of the population they requested permission from the municipality of Nindiri to move the locale to where it is located at near the street of the main entrance of the Campuzano community in the municipality of Nindiri. She started offering only essential food products. As she is an enterprising woman and with much capacity in business, she strengthened it with the introduction of products like perishable goods, dairy products, meats etc. Currently the business offers a great variety of everyday products. Margarita is a mother of 2 children who she has supported with the help of her husband. She dreams of having her own locale in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: José Humberto

texts.es: El señor José Humberto B. P. tiene la edad de 48 años habita en el barrio San Caralampio La Concepción  , con su esposa Ángela Rosa Lopez, ella es comerciante vende frutas y verduras en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, con las ganancias del negocio ayuda a don José con los gastos de la casa ya que tienen a cargo 2 hijos que estudian en secundaria , una niña de 12 años y 1 niño de 14 años, estos pequeños después que salen de clase la niña le ayuda a la mamá con los quehaceres del hogar y el varón se va con ella a buscar mercadería para el siguiente día, tienen 4 años de vender en este mercado . Este señor labora como guarda de seguridad en el hogar Belén desde hace 8 años este hogar este ubicado en el 10 ½ carretera Masaya. Esta familia cuenta con una pequeña cantidad de tierra la que cultivan para obtener otros ingresos. El solicita el crédito para mejoras de su vivienda ya que el techo esta en muy malas condiciones y cada vez que llueve tienen que colocar muchos recipientes por toda la casa para que no se le deterioren las pocas cosas que con mucho esfuerzos han logrado
texts.en:
Mr. José Humberto B. P. is 48 years old and lives in the San Caralampio La Concepción neighborhood with his wife, Angela Rosa Lopez, who is a produce vendor in the Mercado Oriental in Managua. With the profits earned from the business, she helps out José with the household expenses because they have 2 children in middle school—a 12-year-old girl and a 14-year-old boy. After getting home from school, the girl helps her mother with the household chores, while the boy accompanies his mother in search of the next day’s merchandise. They have been selling in this market for 4 years. Mr. B. has been working as a security guard at the Belén household, which is located on 10 ½ Masaya Highway, for 8 years. This family has a small plot of land that they cultivate in order to earn extra income. He is requesting this loan for home improvement because his roof is in disrepair, and everytime it rains, they have to place containers all over the house to collect the water so that it will not deteriorate the few things they have.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair home roof

loans.name: Guillermina Ignacia

texts.es:
Inició su pequeño negocio solicitando permiso a la directora del colegio para la apertura de un Kiosco escolar, donde le oferta a los estudiante, golosinas variadas, helado, gaseosa, frutas, enchiladas etc. Ella trabaja de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00p.m ya que atiende los dos turnos,  los productos refrigerados los lleva en termos para mantener su temperatura, ya que ella manifiesta que con el próximo crédito, poder comprar una refrigeradora y de esta manera almacenar mayor cantidad de productos.
Ella vive dedicada a su negocio, puesto que no tiene hijos y solo la administra con su compañero. Su mayor propósito es tener una pulpería en su casa, la cual dice que solo lo lograria con la ayuda que ADIM le pueda brindar.
texts.en:
She started her business asking for permission from the school principal to open a school kiosk where she could sell candy, ice cream, sodas, fruits, enchiladas and more to the student body. She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm since she works two shifts. She takes her refrigerated products in thermos to maintain their temperature. With this loan, she will purchase a refrigerator in order to store these products. She is very dedicated to her business since she has no children and manages it with her partner. Her main goal is to own a small store based out of her home, and says she will be able to do so with the help that ADIM can provide her.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.es: La señora Eva Maria tiene la edad de 24 años habita en el sector de Esquipulas en Managua, es casada su marido Geyner Laguna es chofer desde hace 4 años años y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa  , la señora todavía no tiene hijos ya que quiere esperar un tiempo por que su planes en estos momentos es sacar adelante el negocio de repostería que tiene 6 años de funcionar en ese sector , ella quiere incrementar la producción de dichos productos ya que tienen una demanda mas alta  que su presupuesto , doña Eva decidió solicitar el préstamo ya que con ese dinero comprará mas material y abastecerá a todos sus clientes. Su sueño es llegar a tener por lo menos una sucursal dentro del casco urbano de Managua pero para eso necesitará mucho esfuerzo y apoyo
texts.en:
Eva Maria is 24 years old and lives in the Esquipulas neighborhood of Managua. She is married to her husband, Geyner Laguna, who has been a chauffeur for the last 4 years and helps pay the bills. Eva doesn't have any children yet as she'd like to wait until they follow through with their current plans of growing their bakey business, which has been operating for 6 years in their neighborhood. She'd like to increase production of certain product as it is in higher demand than previously anticipated. Eva decided to solicit a loan so that she could buy more product and supply it to all of her clients. She'd like to realize her dream of having an office in the urban centre of Managua, but for that, a great effort and much support is needed.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients to make baked goods.

loans.name: Narcisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Narcisa habita en el barrio San Judas, tiene 51 años de edad, es viuda, con cuatros hijos mayores de edad, tiene una pulpería desde hace diecisiete años, e inició sólo con ventas de gaseosas y productos lácteos, con la solicitud del préstamo es par invertir en la pulpería en los diferentes productos para mejorar la oferta a sus clientes, y poder tener más capital ya que entre las dificultades ha sido la poca inversión de su negocio para crecer. A futuro quiere tener una miscelánea donde pueda ofrecer todos los productos que el cliente necesite, y así obtener mejores financiamiento y generar más ganancias y capital.
texts.en:
Mrs. Narcisa lives in the neighborhood of San Judas. She is 51 years old, and is a widow with 4 adult children. She has had a small grocery store for 17 years and started by selling sodas and dairy products. With this request for a loan, she will invest in her grocery store by buying different products to improve the selection for her clients. She will also be able to have more capital because as a result of difficulties, there has been little investment in her business to help it grow. In the future, she wants to have a general store, where she can offer all the products that her clients need. In this way, she will have better financing and earn more income and capital.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase cabbage seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Mrs. Men Phat's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten members in Prey Sak Village, Kampong Chhang Province form a village bank, whose president is Mrs. Men P.. She and her husband, Mr. Keo Koeurn, are farmers who grow rice on a hectare of land. They have a child who is attending the local school. Mrs. Men P.'s family currently live in poor housing conditions, but she cannot afford to build a new house. Hence, Mrs. Men P. is asking for a loan to build a new house to improve her family's living conditions.

All the members in the village bank loan have end-of-term loans and they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Mrs. Sorn Ra's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
There are eleven members in the village bank located in Chamka Khai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Sorn R., 29 years old and mother of three children, is the village bank president. She is a farmer who earns a small revenue from harvesting rice to support her family. On her plantation, she now faces a problem because her field is infertile, thus badly affecting her crops. To solve this problem, Mrs. Sorn R. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her field conditions and grow more crops. Her husband, Mr. Leng Soeurn, is a palm juice collector who collects palm juice to process into palm sugar or wine.

All the members in the village bank loan have end-of-term loans and they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mrs. Cheng Sovann's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank [solidarity group], which consists of nine people, is located in Chamkar Khlai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. All the members plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Cheng S. is the village bank president, and she is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. She has 0.5-hectare to cultivate rice and a hectare to grow vegetables. Because her vegetable field has been covered by grass, she cannot plant vegetables. To solve this problem, Mrs. Cheng S. decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to chop all the grass to ready the land for cultivation. Her husband, Mr. Long Lorn, is a breeder who raises 15 pigs. He also helps her with both plantations. Mrs. Cheng S. is 27 years old and the mother of two children. One child is attending the local school, while the younger one is one year old and thus too young to work or study.

Mrs. Mork Sophal did not come to receive her loan, but her husband did; so he is shown in the picture instead of her.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK [Kiva’s Field Partner] has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva. The borrowers in the group are: 1. Nu S. 2. Prak Linda 3. Nov Yon 4. Loem Sovannara 5. Soa Saran 6. Pov Sokhon 7.Kong Mom 8. Cheng S. ( Village Bank President) 9. Mork Sophal

loans.use: To hire laborers to clear all the grass to prepare her land for cultivating vegetables

loans.name: Mrs. Ly Sath Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly S. is the group leader of four loan members in Chambork Khpuos village, Kampong Chhnang province. She and her husband, Mr. Linh Cheng, are farmers. They earn a small revenue to support their family by harvesting rice on their small piece of land. Three of their children are employed in a garment factory, while their youngest is a farmer. Although Mrs. Ly S.'s family work in different businesses, they still experience poor living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Ly S. is asking for a loan to buy a pig for breeding, as well as build a piggery. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Two members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy a pig for breeding and build a piggery

loans.name: Soam

texts.en:
Soam P., 52, is one of the vendors who sells many kinds of vegetables, fish, and grocery items in her village. She lives with three of her children in Prey Veng, Cambodia. She has been selling since 2007 to earn a living and is able to make around US$1 of profit each day. Before 2007, she worked with her husband growing rice but she changed to her business to help double the family income. Her husband, Chhet Bou, 55, still works on his rice field and normally he makes less than US$1 each day. He said planting rice is just to support the family members.

Normally, people in the village grow rice two times each year. In the dry season, they grow a kind of rice that bears during 3-4 months and in the rainy season, they grow another kind of rice that can bear during 6-7 months. But both seasons the farmers need enough water or the crop will be damaged. Rice plants are easily spoilt if there is too much or too little water.

Soam Pun is requesting a loan of US$625 to purchase a motorbike to transport her vegetables and grocery items to sell in the village.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long M., 52, is a mother of four children who lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. She and her husband, Touch Sim, 55, work in their rice field to earn a living and are able to make US$3 each day. This couple also gets support from three of their children who work in the construction industry. Mrs. Long said that every month she spends less than US$50 on food. Around 35 percent of the Cambodia population lives under the poverty line. This number is of huge significance and currently inflation has been out of control, reaching a record of 23 percent this year.

Every farmer needs to work very hard to get a good harvest. In Cambodia there are M. types of rice seed and two rice-growing seasons a year. During the dry season, the farmers invest 3-4 months effort to harvest, but in the rainy season farmers need to work for 6-7 months. Growing rice in the rainy season is harder than in the dry season because more attention and care is needed to keep the crop healthy.

To make more money to help support the family, Mrs. Long is asking a loan of US$900 to purchase more construction tools for her children.

loans.use: Purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Mrs. Phon Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon M. is the group leader of four loan members who live in Chambork Khpuos village, Kampong Chhnang province. She is a fish seller who earns a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Bo Beang, and one of their children, are fishermen, while their other child is a pig breeder. Although Mrs. Phon M.'s family members work in different businesses, they still cannot afford to pay for electricity in their house. Mrs. Phon M. is asking for a loan to buy three batteries for a lamp to light the house to improve her family's living conditions.

All the members in the group have end-of-term loans and they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy batteries for lamp to light house
